job.title: Staff Software Engineer - Java/Javascript
job.body:
As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.

At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.

You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Job Description

What's the job? As part of the Network Processing Product Development organization, you will be responsible for system development, implementation, maintenance and support of Visa's Clearing and Settlement systems, which clear, settle, and deliver transactions to issuer and acquirer financial institutions globally. Through this challenging job, you will gain experience collaborating with various parts of the business in understanding requirements for system enhancements, identifying areas of improvement and implementing changes to the system where it is needed. The product that you oversee will be of the highest quality meeting all requirements within the scheduled timeframe.

Who are we looking for? You! We are looking for a Senior Lead Engineer with application design and development experience who will take ownership and/or lead the engineering responsibility for multiple components in a project. You are a great teammate, making sure that everyone on your team feels valued and is excited to work with you. Location, time pressure, distractions, none of it matters: no matter the environment, you know you can code and build amazing, high-performing, and bug-free products.

Experience in Java, Javascript, with SQL and Linux is necessary. You lead and encourage others to take risks, be bold, and innovate in order to create exceptional products that are both seamless for our clients and consumer facing. No matter the challenge, you know you can find a solution and encourage others to think the same. You recognize when to ask for help and when to collaborate with others, working across departments and influencing in areas beyond immediate control. Above all, you are someone who takes initiative and thinks like an owner - you've defined your everywhere and lead others to find theirs all while launching Visa ahead of the game.

Why us? Working at Visa is challenging. The problems that we face and solve and the decisions that we make affect the world. Visa is all about helping people around the world reach their Everywhere, the place where their personal, professional and financial goals intersect. As the premier payments technology company, we're proud to boast that our commerce platforms touch the lives of billions, all over the globe. If you have ambition, focus and drive, and are interested in joining a global team focused on changing the way the world pays and is paid, you'll find your everywhere at Visa.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:

  • 4 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 2 years of work experience with an Advanced degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 0 years of work experience with a PhD degree.
  • 4 years of experience on application development on Linux and Windows are required.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • 7-10 years of work experience and a Bachelor’s Degree or 6 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 3 years of experience with a PhD.
  • Be passionate about technology and solving large-scale complex business problems.
  • Be an established self-starter who possesses a relentless drive to initiate change, raise the technical bar and deliver result
  • Working experience in Angular, NodeJS, MySQL and REST web services is must.
  • Strong design and coding skills with Java/J2EE, Spring, JavaScript technologies.
  • Knowledge and working experience on Git/Stash, Jenkins and Jira
  • Experience in applying modern Agile Software Development practices is required.
  • Experience with database technologies like MySQL, SQL Server.
  • Experience in MicroServices development is a plus.
  • Experience handling vendor product and integration with internal Windows/Linux based applications.
  • Must be capable of translating architecture into a delivered solution that realizes the vision and purpose and effectively translate functional and non-functional requirements into an engineered solution.
  • Should be able to lead the technical team in comfortably extending an existing solution, or conceiving a new solution and working with delivery to have the target state architecture realized.
  • Provides direction for selecting appropriate engineering techniques to solve for non-functional requirements at the project level.
  • Strong problem determination skills and ability to resolve critical issues for complex systems under tight timeframes using dumps and other tools.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Ability to multi task and handle multiple competing priorities with minimal direction from management. Should possess excellent planning and organizational skills.
  • Must be able to write technical design and build documentation for all aspects of a technical infrastructure.
  • Good interpersonal and facilitation skills.
  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent career experience is required.

Responsibilities

  • Take complete end-to-end technical & engineering ownership of one or more applications
  • Be at the forefront of translating complex functional and technical requirements into detailed architecture and design
  • Have significant influence on our strategy by helping define and build the next wave of product features and system architecture
  • Coordinate engineering activities across the delivery of the project and work with engineers to ensure they are delivering quality and efficiently against project requirements.
  • Partner with Architecture and Business teams to provide best in class solutions
  • Champion Agile to inspire change and continuous improvement throughout the delivery process
  • Take a hands on role in influencing and guiding day-to-day development activities by leading architecture decisions, participating in designs, design review, code review, and implementation
  • Be the ambassador for engineering best practice across the development lifecycle and champion continuous improvement across the Centre
  • Define solutions in terms of components, modules and algorithms
  • Development and Implementation of the proposed solution
  • Identify or develop software frameworks to be used
  • Refactor existing solutions to make it reusable and scalable
  • Leads and/or supports both product and technical discussions about how to apply existing and/or new technology in support of the business.
  • Create design documents, code, unit/functional test, document and implement new programs and subprograms, as well as enhancements, modifications, and corrections to existing software.
  • Must be able to understand the positioning of a solution within the company and to build consensus to effectively gain buy-in from all participants.
  • Identify opportunities for further enhancements and refinements to standards, processes and systems.
  • Provide rotational on-call support as required.

Additional Information

Work Hours This position requires the incumbent to be available during core business hours.

Travel Requirements This position do not requires the incumbent to travel.

Mental/Physical Requirements This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.

EEO Statement Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

job.title: React UI Developer
job.body:
Description:

Lynker Technologies has an opening for React User Interface Developer position with NOAA's Greater Atlantic Regional Fisheries Office (GARFO) performing Information Technology Services.

Responsibilities include:

  • Develop new webpages and front end user interfaces for use by the general public and those using NOAA’s services
  • Work with software development teams, help desk team, and other groups at GARFO, (science centers, fisheries management councils, states, other fishery management groups, and the commercial fishing industry) to support fisheries management in GARFO.
  • Work with these same groups to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve fisheries management front end websites, drawing on federal fisheries databases, using agile deployment methodology.
  • Work with internal and external customers to the extent possible, using innovative and new technologies to accomplish work, within best industry standards and GARFO limitations.
  • Write system documentation.
  • Be responsive to system problems identified in the field by end-users utilizing the software.
  • Coordinate testing of software systems with the end-user and other project team members.
  • Support the end-user during system deployment and research and resolve problems with the system after go-live.
  • Attend meetings with the project management team and end user as necessary.
  • Analyze, design and implement information systems solutions for fisheries management at GARFO.
. Requirements:

Minimum Required Qualifications:

  • At least 5 years professional web development.
  • Strong React developer
  • Strong JavaScript developer

Preferred/Desired Qualifications:

  • Desirable skills include experience using SQL, PHP, Cordova, and JQuery

About Lynker

Lynker Technologies, LLC is a growing, Hub-zone certified small business specializing in professional, scientific and technical services. Our continually expanding team combines scientific expertise with mature, results-driven processes and tools to achieve technically sound, cost effective solutions in hydrology/water sciences, geospatial analysis, information technology, resource management, conservation, and management and business process improvement.

We focus on putting the right people in the right place to be effective. And having the right people is critical for success. Our streamlined organization enables and empowers our talented professionals to tackle our customers’ scientific and technical priorities – creatively and effectively.

Lynker offers a team-oriented work environment, competitive salaries and benefits, and the opportunity to work in a culture of exceptionally skilled and diverse professionals who embrace sound science and creative solutions.

Lynker is an E-Verify employer.

Lynker Technologies is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and veterans to apply.

job.title: SDET, Pharmacy Systems
job.body:
At GoodRx, we believe that all Americans should have access to convenient and affordable healthcare. As a nation, we spend about $3.5 trillion annually on our healthcare, but too many Americans struggle to get the care they need, and prices just keep rising. Our marketplaces for prescription medicines and telehealth have helped Americans save $20 billion since 2011. GoodRx is a profitable business funded by top-tier investors; we're based in Santa Monica with additional offices around the country. We're a low-key and tight-knit group that likes to find new ways to fix big problems. If you share our belief that you can do well by doing good, let's talk.

We’re committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company and industry. That’s why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives. We believe that true innovation happens when everyone has room at the table and the tools, resources, and opportunity to excel.

About the Role
GoodRx is looking for experienced software engineers to be part of our Engineering team.
Pharmacy Systems is responsible for the adjudication, payment processing and routing platforms that drive GoodRx claim processing.

The SDET of Pharmacy Systems will be responsible for development and maintenance of automation tests and strategies for backend services and APIs as well as pharmacy claim testing. In this role you will be involved in the design, implementation and deployment of new or existing services and APIs needed to support new product functionality. You’ll also be collaborating with other engineering teams within GoodRx.

The ideal candidate will be able to quickly turn ideas into production-ready solutions in a fast-paced and friendly environment. You should also be comfortable learning new technologies as needed.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with product and engineering teams to review system requirements and technical design documents
  • Perform manual and automated pharmacy claim testing
  • Create, design, implement, and maintain automation frameworks and test scripts
  • Work with world class QA engineer to convert manual tests in to automated tests
  • Devise test strategies to adequately cover requirements, develop high-level test scenarios that implement the strategy, and elaborate scenarios into detailed test cases
  • Conduct testing, maintenance, and validation on all software products
  • Perform regression testing and debugging directly Verify code patches and bug fixes
  • Analyze and document test results and create detailed defect reports
  • Be an advocate for QA and SDETs, help rethink, and improve processes and metrics
  • Be on top of the latest frameworks and tools

Skills & Qualifications:

  • 2+ yrs of SDET experience
  • 2+ years of experience with healthcare transactions such as NCPDP or x12;(NCPDP preferred)
  • Solid understanding of healthcare claims processing
  • Experience designing and implementing RESTful APIs
  • 2+ years of experience with automation frameworks testing Web Apps, Mobile Apps, API’s, using frameworks such as: Selenium, Xcode UI tests, and Appium
  • Hands on experience using source control systems such as GitHub and understand git workflow
  • Hands on experience with cross browser compatibility testing of web applications
  • Use of compatibility testing services such as browserstack or saucelabs
  • Hands on experience working with continuous integration tool (We use Jenkins)
  • 2+ years of Javascript experience
  • Strong knowledge of QA methodology and tools
  • Strong knowledge of writing technical documentation/defects and issues
  • Solid knowledge of SQL and how to turn data into meaningful results
  • Experience with Cucumber/Gherkin is a plus
  • Experience with relational and non-relational database technologies
  • Strong Widows or Linux fundamentals (comfortable in shell environments)
  • Strong debugging/troubleshooting skills
  • Effective verbal and written communicator
  • Knowledge of agile quality and testing methods preferred (BDD, TDD, Unit Testing and Automation)
  • Bachelor's degree required; advanced degree a plus
GoodRx is America's healthcare marketplace. The company offers the most comprehensive and accurate resource for affordable prescription medications in the U.S., gathering pricing information from thousands of pharmacies coast to coast, as well as a telehealth marketplace for online doctor visits and lab tests. Since 2011, Americans with and without health insurance have saved $20 billion using GoodRx and 15 million consumers visit goodrx.com each month to find discounts and information related to their healthcare. GoodRx is the #1 most downloaded medical app on the iOS and Android app stores. For more information, visit www.goodrx.com.

job.title: Service Desk Analyst
job.body:
As we create a colorful, capable and cleaner world through chemistry, we invite you to join our team to harness the power of chemistry to shape markets, redefine industries and improve lives for billions of people around the world.

Chemours is seeking a Service Desk Analyst to join our Information Technology team. This position will be based in Wilmington, DE or Parkersburg, WV and will report directly to the Global Service Desk Manager.

As a Service Desk Analyst, you will have the opportunity to be involved in providing top tier customer support to Chemours employees, contractors and partners.

In this role, you are a customer ambassador. You will ensure that customers’ needs are identified, documented, and resolved in a timely manner. You possess a good basic understanding of multiple IT systems, including PC, Network Infrastructure, Security, Applications and Automations solutions. You are able to recommend process improvements to ensure the end user receives a positive experience.

Effective candidates will have the ability to communicate with impact, have excellent problem-solving skills, and be customer-centered.

The responsibilities of the position include, but are not limited to, the following:

  • Provide all levels of IT support utilizing multiple channels including phone, chat, email and Amelia chatbot

  • Provide technical support of computer hardware and software (inclusive of mobile phones) by diagnosing and resolving issues, performing upgrades, deploying software, and troubleshooting issues for all assigned areas such as software applications, hardware, infrastructure and enterprise applications

  • Understand and maintain standard operating procedures, global knowledgebase

  • Collaborate with other IT Support, vendors and counterparts to resolve issues as quickly as possible

  • Take ownership and responsibility for all incoming incidents/ requests/queries (start to fully resolve)

  • Escalate tickets via 1DESK platform to appropriate parties in IT or HR, ensure root cause analysis where needed

  • Prepare documentation and contribute to Knowledge base

  • Participate in projects as tester or trainer when new technology is deployed

  • Develop automation script and simple application to improve workflow

  • Highlight trends and recurring problems through metrics analysis

The following is required for this role:

  • Bachelors Degree in Information Technology, Management Information Systems, or similar field of study.

  • 1-2 years of experience with application development using Javascript and JSON (Co-Op and Internship experience is okay)

  • OR Equivalent Military experience

  • Friendly presence and helpful attitude, good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others. With great passion for customer services.

  • Able to multitask effectively, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situation.

  • Fast learner and is a self-starter

The following is preferred for this role:

  • Experience with some Ticketing tools (e.g. ServiceNow, Jira or 1DESK) or ITIL

  • Advanced technical knowledge in the support of desktop/laptop and other employee peripherals including Microsoft O365, Microsoft Operating Systems and MS Teams

  • Have some experience working on UX design or Analytics

  • Willingness to learn and work with new leading-edge technologies

Benefits:

  • Competitive Compensation

  • Comprehensive Benefits Packages

  • 401(k) Match

  • Employee Stock Purchase Program

  • Tuition Reimbursement

  • Commuter Benefits

  • Learning and Development Opportunities

  • Strong Inclusion and Diversity Initiatives

  • Company-paid Volunteer Days

WE’RE CHEMOURS. A DIFFERENT KIND OF CHEMISTRY COMPANY.

We are driven by our purpose to create a more colorful, capable, and cleaner world through the power of chemistry.

Built upon a 200-year-old legacy and a world-class product portfolio, we bring everyday convenience to virtually everything people touch—in industries ranging from automotive, paints, and plastics to electronics, construction, energy, and telecommunications. We bring solutions that are better, safer, more reliable, and more sustainable, through the power of chemistry.

OUR APPROACH

We see our people as our biggest assets. Instead of focusing just on what our employees do each day, we look at how they do it. By taking a different approach to talent development, employee engagement, and culture, our goal is to empower employees to be their best selves—at Chemours and in life.

The “ours” in Chemours represents everyone who works here. We’re thousands strong and always looking for the best and brightest to join our team.

OUR CULTURE

Five fundamental, foundational values form the substructure of our culture as a multinational

corporation. They are core beliefs that guide and frame both our behaviors and our aspirations.

Our values are in part what differentiate us from others, making us uniquely Chemours.

They are—Customer Centered, Refreshing Simplicity, Collective Entrepreneurship,

Safety Obsession, and Unshakable Integrity. At Chemours, our values are where everything begins.

We were honored to be named a “Great Place to Work-Certified Company” for 2019-2020 — our second consecutive year . We were also proud to receive a Gold Medallion Award from the U.S. Department of Labor’s HIRE VETS program in 2019.

Chemours is an equal opportunity employer

Chemours is an E-Verify employer

Candidates must be able to perform all duties listed with or without accommodation

Immigration sponsorship (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status) is not currently available for this position

At Chemours, you will find sustainability in our vision, our business and your future. If you want to work on the leading edge of your field and have a desire to make a difference, join Chemours and discover what it means when we say “We Are Living Chemistry”.

job.title: React Developer
job.body:
Cognizant continuously seek talented, creative, outstanding associates when recruiting new employees. We pride ourselves on having extensive experience working with clients in all major markets. Cognizant's delivery model is infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. Cognizant consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions and business results.

Are you ready to be a change-maker?

At Cognizant, we believe those who challenge the way they work today will lead the way tomorrow.

Responsibilities

Design and implement Web-based application development using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery and Angular, Sass, Scss, ES6

Evaluate, suggest, and outline improvements to existing interface flows

Build and maintain scalable web applications using custom, reusable, and responsive UI components

Work closely with design teams and business owners to define, design, and implement features.

Qualifications

8-10 years overall technical work experience

Experience working with application frameworks like Angular/React

3+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, and types.

3+ years of HTML/CSS experience, including concepts such as: layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility

3+ years experience with RESTful APIs and optimizing front end performance

Experience building reusable component-based UI frameworks

Experience working with source control systems such as Git

Knowledge of Relational Database like Oracle/Postgres

Our strength is built on our ability to work together. Our diverse backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It encourages lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our clients. We want someone who thrives in this setting and is inspired to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration.

If you’re comfortable with ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you.

Why Choose Cognizant?

It takes a lot to succeed in today’s fast-paced market, and Cognizant Digital Business has become a proven leader in the industry. Cognizant love big ideas and even bigger ambitions. We stand out because we put human experiences at the core.

We help clients engage customers by envisioning and building innovative products and services. But we don’t stop there. We develop go-to-market strategies and invent entirely new business models, ensuring that every company we work with walks away with both inspiration and a plan.

Everything we do at Cognizant we do with passion—for our clients, our communities, and our organization. It’s the defining attribute that we look for in our people.

job.title: UI Engineer
job.body:
Elements Global Services is an award-winning HR Technology and Services Company revolutionizing the way employers expand and manage employees internationally. Global expansion is becoming more and more a part of the modern workplace, and with that comes things like remote work and spread-out teams. As Elements is a truly global company, we take care of our client’s employees worldwide. From Chicago to Manila, from Johannesburg to Delhi and Honk Kong, we provide top class benefits to all the employees we serve every day. With offices all around the world and teams spread out between multiple time zones, you too can benefit from the “Glocal” team strategy, giving our employees the flexibility, they need to do their very best work the best way they can.


A revolution cannot be done alone, and we need the best and brightest talent to continue our growth into the new modern workplace. We are looking to expand our team by hiring a new UI engineer, a team player who is ready to make the role their own and bring their own ideas and innovations to the table. Reporting to the Vice President of Product & Technology, you will be supporting our Technology Services department by acting as a strategic partner between the product, design, and development teams.


Key Responsibilities

  • Take an active role in the development projects for the website, both large and small, throughout the various phases of the project life cycle. Assess new initiatives to determine the work effort and estimate the necessary time-to-completion.
  • Lead and mentor other team members to develop shared best practices and development standards.
  • Maintain existing code and functionality once it is assimilated into the ongoing operations of the Web business.
  • An interest in sharing knowledge about new technologies with the team and facilitating the implementation of such technologies across projects.
  • Dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; talks and acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
  • Development with cross-browser/cross-device compatibility in a graded browser support environment.
  • Document new development, procedures or test plans as needed.
  • Participate in Web data builds and deployment efforts.
  • Working in an Agile development cycle using advanced Scrum methodologies.
  • Performs other related duties as assigned.

What we value

  • You have 6+ years' expertise writing semantic HTML5/HTML and CSS3/CSS.
  • You have 6+ years' expertise writing clean, unobtrusive core JavaScript code and debugging tools.
  • You have an expertise with LESS and/or SASS CSS pre-processors.
  • You have an expertise with Bootstrap and Adaptive/Responsive development techniques.
  • You have an expertise with single page applications (React/Redux) and microservices.
  • You have experience with object-oriented coding; version/source control, bug tracking, and workflow applications/tools.
  • You have experience with HTML5 APIs (like canvas, local storage, etc.).
  • You have knowledge of any of the two JavaScript frameworks -/ Angular.js / Vue.js or React.js.
  • You have experience with Node.js (Good to have).
  • You have a strong knowledge of AWS services /Azure services (preferred).
  • You have knowledge of ETL tools like Talend, DBT is a plus.
  • You have knowledge of AZURE Machine Learning.
  • You have knowledge of current trends and best practices in front-end architecture, including performance, accessibility, and usability.
  • You have solid problem-solving, technical troubleshooting, and decision-making skills, as well as excellent communication, initiative, and teamwork.
  • You have experience working in an Agile environment Previous experience working with B2B SaaS products a plus. (HR/HCM/Finance a bigger plus).
  • You have fluent English as it is our working language.

What we Offer:

  • Opportunity to work in a fast-growing organization with the ability to make a quick impact.
  • Allow your inspirational ideas to come to life in a highly creative and executional environment.
  • Ability to work in an organization with over 40 nationalities all over the world, which embraces diversity, inclusion, and belonging at its core.
  • The opportunity to challenge in a high performing organization and leave each day knowing you have made an impact.

This position description may not describe all duties, responsibilities, and skills associated with this position. It is intended to portray the major aspects of the job. Other duties or skills may be required.


Elements provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, lay-off, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Our Dallas office is looking for a talented, experienced UI/UX Designer, who has the passion and skills to take our product to the next level. In this role, you would be responsible for the creative content design and usability of our award winning software.

We are looking for someone with impeccable design sense, incredible attention for detail, extremely organized, follows industry trends and who fully understands the digital user experience needs. Knowledge of HTML5, CSS, javascript is required. This role directly reports to the head of product management.

job.title: Senior Product Security Engineer
job.body:
Job summary:
The Red Hat Products and Technologies Customer Experience and Operations (PnT CXnO) team is looking for an experienced Senior Product Security Engineer to join our Product Security team in Westford, MA. In this role, you will primarily work as a security architect and work with our cloud engineering teams on Windows container architecture. You will perform analysis and collaboration with other Red Hat engineers to ensure that Red Hat continues to proactively protect customers from meaningful security concerns. You will process tasks within our container product portfolio which relate to and depend on Microsoft Windows security architecture, and fully analyze, assess risks, and track resolutions during development. You’ll help us reduce the security exposure and risk to customers using our offerings by conducting code audits and known vulnerabilities, and recommending adjustments to product roadmaps. You’ll handle and prevent security vulnerabilities within jointly offered products and services from Red Hat and Microsoft. You’ll represent the security needs of customers within emerging technologies, processes, and offerings, advocating and planning for a solid foundation of security architecture and response within these efforts.
Primary job responsibilities:
  • Perform detailed analysis of security issues
  • Assess known critical and important severity vulnerabilities, and prioritize remediation plans with product teams
  • Communicate flaw information to our software developers, managers, quality engineers, upstream project developers, and peers on security response teams
  • Consult with software developers and product teams on improved security architecture
  • Document vulnerabilities, flaws, mitigation, and their fixes through the entire update release life cycle in the team's knowledge base
  • Ensure proper customer facing security documentation, reference, and other data as used by the common vulnerabilities and exposures (CVE) pages
  • Coordinate with upstream communities and vendors for embargoed bugs, remediations, and common release dates
  • Understand current and emerging threats within Windows and Kubernetes architectures.
  • Promote Red Hat Product Security Incident Response Team (PSIRT) efforts within the community and greater public
Required skills:
  • Bachelor's degree in computer science or engineering or equivalent or relevant work experience
  • Demonstrated proficiency of Windows security architecture
  • Understanding of both Windows and Linux security technologies
  • Knowledge of Kubernetes and OpenShift system architecture
  • Proficiency in multiple programming languages like Python, Java, Ruby, Go and JavaScript, node.js, and the ability to learn new ones
  • Working experience of continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) processes, scanners, and security incident response.
  • Solid understanding of common security vulnerabilities, (e.g. OWASP top ten) including how to detect, demonstrate, mitigate, and resolve them
  • Ability to quickly learn new Red Hat technologies and solutions
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with a multicultural team distributed across multiple countries and time zones
  • Previous experience in product planning with the ability to influence product roadmaps
  • Solid communication, collaboration, and negotiation skills
  • Ability to work with minimum supervision
About Red Hat:
Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community-powered approach to deliver reliable and high-performing Linux, hybrid cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Red Hat helps customers integrate new and existing IT applications, develop cloud-native applications, standardize on our industry-leading operating system, and automate, secure, and manage complex environments. Award-winning support, training, and consulting services make Red Hat a trusted adviser to the Fortune 500. As a strategic partner to cloud providers, system integrators, application vendors, customers, and open source communities, Red Hat can help organizations prepare for the digital future.


Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.


Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.

job.title: Senior UX Researcher: Healthcare
job.body:
Company Overview:
Nuance is the pioneer and leader in conversational artificial intelligence (AI) innovations that bring intelligence to everyday work and life. We deliver solutions that understand, analyze, and respond to people, amplifying human intelligence to increase productivity and improve security. With decades of both domain and AI expertise, we work with thousands of organizations across a wide range of industries.

Check out our team Life at Nuance!

Join our team! At Nuance, we are constantly reinventing how people connect with technology and with each other. Our AI-powered solutions empower organizations to transform “business as usual.” For decades, the world’s leading financial, healthcare, telecommunications, retailers, and government organizations have trusted Nuance to bring them award-winning solutions that deliver more meaningful outcomes and empower a smarter, more connected world. From clinical speech recognition technologies that free physicians to spend more time caring for patients to real-time intelligence that powers billions of customer interactions, we’re deeply committed to helping organizations push the boundaries of what’s possible.
Job Summary:
Nuance Healthcare User Experience is looking for a Senior Designer with a focus in User Research to join our growing team. If you are a self-starter that is motivated by knowing that you work is having a real, measurable impact on the lives of millions of people every day, then Nuance Healthcare is the right place for you. On a day-to-day basis, you’ll collaborate with a highly-skilled group of individuals that utilize the latest in voice-driven technology to deliver the future of healthcare user experiences.

The Senior UX Designer reports to a UX manager, and leads UX Research and Design processes in collaboration with their Product Management and Development counterparts. The Sr. Designer will conduct user research to help to define business and user requirements, then utilize the findings to drive the iterative design and test cycles to deliver highly-valued Nuance Healthcare applications. Product-specific user research initiatives will be conducted in collaboration with Product Management colleagues.

Required Skills:
  • Education: BS or higher in User Experience Design, Interaction Design, HCI, Cognitive Sciences and Psychology or a UX design-related field
  • 5+ years of experience performing research and design for complex B2B workflow applications, healthcare experience preferred
  • Experience with conducting user research studies at all phases of the product development lifecycle, and synthesizing actionable insights that inform product development
  • Proficient in current UI design and development tools including Sketch, InVision, Abstract, Balsamiq, Adobe suite
  • Working knowledge of web application development: mobile first and responsive UI design, HTML, CSS and Javascript frameworks
  • Functional prototype creation for user testing and feedback
  • Use of the Atlassian suite for project communication and collaboration (JIRA and Confluence)
  • Delivery within Agile / Scrum development timeframes
  • Adherence to HIPAA compliance and securing patient health information

Responsibilities:
  • Conduct early user research discovery activities including contextual inquiry, conceptual user modeling, task analysis and user interviews to inform inform new product definition
  • Execute research artifacts that guide product development, including JTBD frameworks, service blueprints and user journey maps, user profiles (personas), workflow diagrams, information architecture schemas, wireframes and finished UI design
  • Facilitate iterative user feedback programs including usability testing and user surveys to drive incremental improvements in existing product
  • Deliver timely research reports and playbacks in support of user research analysis and synthesis activities
  • Maintain priorities and work efficiently within a fluid, fast-paced product development ecosystem
Additional Information:
Nuance offers a compelling and rewarding work environment. We offer market competitive salaries, bonus, equity, benefits, meaningful growth and development opportunities and a casual yet technically challenging work environment. Join our dynamic, entrepreneurial team and become part of our continuing success.
Nuance celebrates diversity and is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action workplace. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, military and veteran status, disability, genetics, or any other category protected by law or Nuance policy. If you need an accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please call 781-565-5086 and let us know.

job.title: Technical Architect - Integration (Remote)
job.body:
At Veeva, we build enterprise cloud technology that powers the biggest names in the pharmaceutical, biotech, consumer goods, chemical & cosmetics industries. Our customers make vaccines, life-saving medicines, and life-enhancing products that make a difference in everyday lives. Our technology has transformed these industries; enabling them to get critical products and services to market faster. Our core values, Do the Right Thing, Customer Success, Employee Success, and Speed, guide us as we make our customers more efficient and effective in everything they do.

The Role

As a Technical Architect you will be key member of the Veeva Commercial Technical Services group providing integration solutions to many Veeva Products (CRM, Vault, Nitro, Andi), advice customers on best practices and ETL process. This position requires a blend of those who enjoy writing code while also wanting to grow in being a technical consultant to our life science customers.
The Technical Architect will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the best Senior Consultants and Solution Architects in the industry and learn best practices for software development and consulting, business analysis, solution design, enterprise software integration and project management.

This is a remote position.

What You'll Do

  • Design and implement cloud-based integrations using REST APIs
  • Design and implement Force.com solution
  • Extend application capabilities through Java based solutions using the Vault Java SDK
  • Manage integration and development projects and resources
  • Develop internal and external tools to help our customers and our consultants
  • Provide subject matter expertise on the Veeva Vault product functionality and APIs
  • Work closely with customers to establish solutions at the business and technical level
  • Travel is less than 25%

Requirements

  • 4-8 years of programming in Java or other object-oriented programming languages
  • 4-year degree majoring in a technical field (Computer Science, Management Information Systems or equivalent)
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Familiarity with API-based development
  • Good verbal and written communication skills
  • Good presentation skills – can stand-talk in front of an audience
  • Desire to go into a technical consulting career path

Nice to Have

  • Technical consulting experience
  • Experience with working within Cloud Based Architecture
  • Development and/or Architect on Salesforce.com, AWS, Informatica, Boomi or Mulesoft platform
  • Integration/Programming experience with REST-based APIs
  • Hands on experience with SSO and SAML
  • Experience with Web services and scripting languages (JavaScript, Python, Node.js)
  • Community involvement or organizational leadership experience
  • Ability to take technical concepts/solutions and educate non-technical audiences

Perks & Benefits

  • Flexible PTO
  • Allocations for continuous learning & development
  • Health & wellness programs
#LI-Remote

Veeva’s headquarters is located in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in more than 15 countries around the world.

Veeva is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin or ancestry, age, disability, marital status, pregnancy, protected veteran status, protected genetic information, political affiliation, or any other characteristics protected by local laws, regulations, or ordinances.

job.title: VP - Agile Delivery- Scrum Master
job.body:
Marsh Digital is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Phoenix Office

VP Agile Delivery - Scrum Master

What can you expect?

  • Marsh Digital offers an amazing opportunity for distinguished digital technologists to transform the company’s digital capabilities while unleashing the power of our industry leading platforms and data assets to deliver innovative products and disruptive business models globally.
  • In Marsh Digital Capabilities and Development, we are all about developing and integrating innovative digital products for our clients. This group is nimble, creative, and empowered to shape the Marsh’s digital landscape.

What is in it for you?

  • If you are looking for an opportunity to be part of an exciting team with a mission to disrupt and deliver the innovative products in the insurance industry, come join us!
  • Be part of an Agile Team driving latest development Practices
  • Competitive Benefits
  • Career Development Opportunities

We will count on you to:

  • Manages moderately complex or complex projects end-to-end to deliver business outcomes, ensuring that the project is completed on time, within budget, and to a high level of client satisfaction.
  • Develops and maintains detailed, robust, high-quality risk plan and project plan including resources, scope, schedule, cost, assumptions, dependencies, etc., keeping plans updated through the project lifecycle.
  • Understands the impact of scope changes and adjusts project plans and communicates accordingly.
  • Interacts and maintains ongoing communication at the appropriate levels within the team as well as with the stakeholders, and ensures everyone on the delivery team understands their roles and responsibility.
  • Negotiates resource requirements with responsible management when faced with conflicts in priorities.
  • Undertakes regular work streams and project meetings, documenting and following up on actions and risks identified from the meetings.
  • Assigns work to entry level professional and support staff, ensuring adherence to departmental standards and procedures.
  • Reviews significant project proposals of high complexity and ambiguous parameters with high visibility and identifiable risk to the Company, validates all project requirements, and provides recommended changes to proposal, as appropriate.
  • Explores and recommends solutions to the project requirements for projects where there is no identified precedent.
  • Participates in recommending new standards and procedures based upon project experience and results.

What you need to have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related
  • 5-7n ears of experience with a proven track record of successfully delivering global and highly scalable customer-facing digital products and capabilities
  • Hands on full stack development experience using any of the stack - JavaScript, Java, Angular, React, Spring Boot, and NoSQL
  • Expert in leveraging continuous integration and robust build/test automation, with a preference for cross platform stacks and containerization (Jira, Git, Jenkins)
  • Strong analytical skills to be able to manage complex problems using a number of techniques.
  • Experience in leading complex software product delivery in an Agile environment
  • Experience in web and mobile UI/UX, API’s, Cloud, Docker Containerization
  • Experience in public cloud technology stack in AWS, and Azure
  • Experience in a leadership position responsible for building, motivating and leading high performing development teams
  • Knowledge of Self-Serve analytical tools like Tableau is highly preferred
  • Have a passion for emerging technologies like Blockchain, AI, Machine Learning etc
  • Scrum Master Certification

Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With over 35,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue approaching US $17 billion and 76,000 colleagues worldwide, MMC helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. Follow Marsh on Twitter @MarshGlobal; LinkedIn; Facebook; and YouTube, or subscribe to BRINK.

Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.

job.title: Cyber Security Data Analytics Architect
job.body:
Job Description

Position Description:

The IT Risk Management and Security (ITRMS) Security Analytics & Information Services (SAIS) solution delivery team is a large team within the Cybersecurity Engineering function focused on building enterprise data analytics capabilities that can perform sophisticated risk calculations, customized visualizations, and reports leveraging large scale data ingest. Safety Assessment Integrated System (SAIS) needs a cyber security data architect who will be responsible for designing, delivering, and maintaining high availability, distributed, cloud and on-prem cyber data analytics solutions. This requires a high degree of collaboration and coordination with internal and external IT groups, partners and vendors.

Responsibilities:

Act as a cyber security data analytics architect with responsibilities that include, but may not be limited to, with the ability to:

  • Normalize data, engineer and upgrade ETL layer(s), document, and execute preventive maintenance, code review, automation and execute queries logic where needed
  • Manage underlying Splunk SaaS v8, Securonix (SNYPR) log forwarding infrastructure configuration and associated agent installments
  • Contribute then execute on strategic architectural development roadmap
  • Responsible for security analytics deployment and server infrastructure analysis, optimization and capacity planning
  • Be responsible for the quality of data sources to include various OS, appliance, and application logs
  • Support Cyber Fusion Center, Global Security, and Risk Management teams for data mining, security and forensic investigations
  • Work with OEM providers to resolve complex integration challenges and operational incidents as Level 3+ expertise
  • Provide recommendations and implement changes to optimize product deployment
  • Create or provide code review for advanced searches, dashboards, visualizations, playbooks, and custom scripting
  • Govern and sustain data catalog, knowledge objects and security use cases
  • Actively lead SAIS service delivery partners to fulfil stakeholder outcomes and follow defined governance processes that guide priority of execution
  • Coordinate and ensure data quality becomes one of the primary goals for the service offering

Position Qualifications:

Education Minimum Requirement:

  • Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and
  • preferred a MS degree.

Required Experience and Skills:

  • Six (6) years of general work experience and two (2) Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience and preferred a MS degree. years of experience architecting, configuring, deploying, and customizing Splunk.
  • Splunk Certified Admin 6.3 or higher
  • Splunk Certified POWER USER 6.3 or higher
  • Strong understanding of all architecture components to include search head clustering, indexer clustering, deployment server and monitoring console.
  • Strong understanding of configuration files and relationship between GUI configuration and backend configuration file impact
  • Knowledge of advanced search and reporting commands
  • Strong understanding of SPL as well as the ability to develop automated search and apps using Python or bash/Perl/shell scripting
  • Demonstrated ability to create complex splunk dashboards, forms, and visualizations using native splunk capabilities as well as REACT framework
  • Understanding of System Log Files and other structured and non-structured data
  • Effective verbal and written communication skills that include the ability to describe highly technical concepts in non-technical terms
  • At least one of the following Cybersecurity certifications is preferred: CISSP, CISM, CRISC, CISA
  • At least one of the following Splunk certification is preferred: Certified Architect, Administrator and Power user.

Additional Technologies:

  • Analytics: Splunk Cloud, Splunk Enterprise, Splunk ES, Splunk Phantom, Splunk Universal Forwarder 5.x/6.x/7.x, Securonix SNYPR 6.0, Securonix Remote Ingestion Nodes (RINS) Forwarding, BMC Remedy, Service Now, RSA Archer, Splunk DB Connect 2.0, Machine learning toolkit, Splunk KV Store, Velocity data, SFT (Secure File Transfer)
  • Operating System: Linux, Windows Server OS environments (many versions)
  • Programming: PyCharm, Python, PL/SQL, SPL
  • Data Management: AWS/Azure/Cloud RDBMS, Hadoop (HDFS), Hive, Teradata, Apache Kafka, Yarn, Spark, Oracle, MapReduce, Db Connect, Informatica, Active Directory, LDAP
  • Visualization: Tibco Spotfire, Tableau, Angular JS, REACT, CSS, XML, HTML 5
  • Network: TCP/IP Protocols, Socket Programming, DNS
  • Collaboration: Jira, Confluence, BitBucket, GitHub

job.title: Application Development Lead
job.body:
Marsh Digital is seeking candidates for the following position based in the Phoenix Office

Application Development Lead

What can you expect?

  • Marsh Digital offers an amazing opportunity for distinguished digital technologists to transform the company’s digital capabilities while unleashing the power of our industry leading platforms and data assets to deliver innovative products and disruptive business models globally.
  • In Marsh Digital Capabilities and Development, we are all about developing and integrating innovative digital products for our clients. This group is nimble, creative, and empowered to shape the Marsh’s digital landscape.

What is in it for you?

  • If you are looking for an opportunity to be part of an exciting team with a mission to disrupt and deliver the innovative products in the insurance industry, come join us!
  • Be part of an Agile Team driving latest development Practices
  • Competitive Benefits
  • Career Development Opportunities

We will count on you to:

  • Envision and develop a library of reusable digital components to help drive down time of market while building and or continually enhancing customer experiences across channels
  • Develop advanced web components and portal in latest web frameworks and provide an intuitive end user experiences
  • Drive major changes in technology development using cloud native architecture patterns in a distributed environment
  • Drive culture change in technology to become a truly Agile team which is self-organizing, DevOps and believes in everything automated
  • Collaborate with Marsh Digital Labs, Platform, and Development teams on new / existing product development opportunities
  • Continuously learn about new technologies and help keep the entire group abreast of industry developments and evolving best practices

What you need to have:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related
  • 8+ years of experience with a proven track record of successfully delivering global and highly scalable customer-facing digital products and capabilities
  • Hands on full stack development experience using any of the stack - JavaScript, Java, Angular, React, Spring Boot, and NoSQL
  • Expert in leveraging continuous integration and robust build/test automation, with a preference for cross platform stacks and containerization (Jira, Git, Jenkins)
  • Strong analytical skills to be able to manage complex problems using a number of techniques.
  • Experience in leading complex software product delivery in an Agile environment
  • Experience in web and mobile UI/UX, API’s, Cloud, Docker Containerization
  • Experience in public cloud technology stack in AWS, and Azure
  • Experience in a leadership position responsible for building, motivating and leading high performing development teams
  • Knowledge of Self-Serve analytical tools like Tableau is highly preferred
  • Have a passion for emerging technologies like Blockchain, AI, Machine Learning etc

Marsh is the world’s leading insurance broker and risk adviser. With over 35,000 colleagues operating in more than 130 countries, Marsh serves commercial and individual clients with data driven risk solutions and advisory services. Marsh is a business of Marsh & McLennan Companies (NYSE: MMC), the leading global professional services firm in the areas of risk, strategy and people. With annual revenue approaching US $17 billion and 76,000 colleagues worldwide, MMC helps clients navigate an increasingly dynamic and complex environment through four market-leading businesses: Marsh, Guy Carpenter, Mercer, and Oliver Wyman. Follow Marsh on Twitter @MarshGlobal; LinkedIn; Facebook; and YouTube, or subscribe to BRINK.

Marsh & McLennan Companies and its Affiliates are EOE Minority/Female/Disability/Vet/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity employers.

job.title: Angular Developer
job.body:
Cognizant continuously seek talented, creative, outstanding associates when recruiting new employees. We pride ourselves on having extensive experience working with clients in all major markets. Cognizant's delivery model is infused with a distinct culture of high customer happiness. Cognizant consistently deliver positive relationships, cost reductions and business results.

Are you ready to be a change-maker?

At Cognizant, we believe those who challenge the way they work today will lead the way tomorrow.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Design and implement Web-based application development using HTML, CSS, Javascript, Jquery and Angular, Sass, Scss, ES6

Evaluate, suggest, and outline improvements to existing interface flows

Build and maintain scalable web applications using custom, reusable, and responsive UI components

Work closely with design teams and business owners to define, design, and implement features.

QUALIFICATIONS

8-10 years overall technical work experience

Experience working with application frameworks like Angular/React

3+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, and types.

3+ years of HTML/CSS experience, including concepts such as: layout, specificity, cross browser compatibility, and accessibility

3+ years experience with RESTful APIs and optimizing front end performance

Experience building reusable component-based UI frameworks

Experience working with source control systems such as Git

Knowledge of Relational Database like Oracle/Postgres

Our strength is built on our ability to work together. Our diverse backgrounds offer different perspectives and new ways of thinking. It encourages lively discussions, inspires thought leadership, and helps us build better solutions for our clients. We want someone who thrives in this setting and is inspired to craft meaningful solutions through true collaboration.

If you’re comfortable with ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you.

Why Choose Cognizant?

It takes a lot to succeed in today’s fast-paced market, and Cognizant Digital Business has become a proven leader in the industry. Cognizant love big ideas and even bigger ambitions. We stand out because we put human experiences at the core.

We help clients engage customers by envisioning and building innovative products and services. But we don’t stop there. We develop go-to-market strategies and invent entirely new business models, ensuring that every company we work with walks away with both inspiration and a plan.

Everything we do at Cognizant we do with passion—for our clients, our communities, and our organization. It’s the defining attribute that we look for in our people.

Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. job.title: Frontend Software Developer
job.body:
At Cesium, we are looking for a frontend developer to build innovative applications for our user community and expand our core UI component library with easy to use Web Components to help both our team and our users roll out ground-breaking apps. This is an opportunity to be a part of the team building a Smart Construction app that's pushing the boundaries on what you can do with real-world 3D data, as well as custom applications like a first of its kind simulation app digitizing the construction industry.
As a frontend developer at Cesium, you'll work with our engineering team and industry partners to implement intuitive workflows to maximize usability for non-technical users.
What you'll do
  • Work on interesting and impactful problems on a fast-paced agile team that emphasizes quality and peer review.
  • Build and ship code. Expect to code every day for most of the day.
  • Grow and maintain our reusable library of LitElement-based Web Components.
  • Primarily work on frontend UI/UX, implement and iterate on interfaces and workflows.
  • Be part of a growing team revolutionizing Smart Construction with the opportunity to expand your skills and role.
What we're looking for
  • Modern web development skills that are well-versed in at least one specific tech stack using libraries and tools like LitElement, React, Redux, Node.js, and similar.
  • A proven track record of developing and shipping web apps or components.
  • A desire for quality, not only in writing well-crafted code, but participating in sprint planning, unit tests, and documentation in the process.
  • While not required, knowledge in geospatial software, git and GitHub workflows, or UI/UX design is a plus.
What else is important to us
  • We want you to learn. We are constantly evolving our platform, pushing into new industries, and striving to improve our personal toolboxes through continuing education.
  • We want you to grow. We are a startup and you'll need to wear many hats. As we grow, we want you to grow professionally and personally along with us.
  • We want you to have an environment of trust and individual empowerment where you can do the best work of your career.
  • We want you to teach. We write blog posts, tutorials, present at conferences, and attend meetups. We also believe strongly in internal mentoring and workshops.
Cesium is a platform for 3D geospatial data - we enable developers and data providers to build dynamic 3D geospatial applications more easily. 3D data is being collected all around us, nearly all the time. We're making this 3D data more usable so we can better understand our world. We've been building Cesium for almost 10 years and it's production tested with companies like Red Bull and Komatsu, government agencies like the NGA, and high traffic events like NORAD's annual Santa Tracker. Our user base is growing every day and you'll help us make sure their experience is impressive. Learn more about Cesium.
If you have a portfolio, website, or work samples, please submit them with your application.
This role can start remote during COVID-19; the role is located in our headquarters in Philadelphia, PA when we return to the office.

Cesium offers:

  • Competitive base salary and bonus
  • Stock options to share in the growth that you help create
  • 100% medical coverage for you and your dependents, and 99% coverage for dental and vision
  • 401K with 100% matching up to 3% and 50% matching for 3-5%. 100% vested from day one.
  • 3 weeks paid vacation
  • 12 paid holidays throughout the calendar year, including a winter break
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Learning opportunities including workshops and Kindle or Audible credits
  • Frequent team social events (virtual due to covid)
  • Center city office with roof deck and just steps from public transit (paused due to covid)
  • Free lunch, snacks, and drinks at the office (paused due to covid)
  • Commuter benefit for public transit and parking (paused due to covid)

Cesium was awarded:

  • 2020 Technology Startup Enterprise Award by the Philadelphia Alliance for Capital and Technologies (PACT)
  • 2020 Startup of the Year in the Geospatial World Awards by Geospatial Media and Communications
  • One of Philadelphia's Best Places to Work in Tech 2020 by Tech in Motion

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and invite candidates from all different backgrounds to bring their unique perspective to Cesium.

job.title: Senior UI Designer
job.body:
As a User Interface Designer, you will work alongside the product management and the engineering team to design and implement innovative solutions for product directions, visuals and experience. We are passionate about making better products and thinking differently about how we approach solutions. We are looking for an experienced and talented UI designer to design and shape unique, user-centric products and experiences. The ideal candidate will have experience working in agile teams, with developers, UX designers and business stakeholders. He/she will make deliberate design decisions and translate any given user-experience journey into a smooth and intuitive interaction.

The ideal candidate should have an eye for clean and artful design, possess superior UI skills and be able to translate high-level requirements into interaction flows and artifacts, and transform them into beautiful, intuitive, and functional user interfaces.

This candidate will be responsible for the entire front-end UI web development of a new direct-to-consumer solution.

Responsibilities

  • Translate design principles and product team requirements into usable, useful, and efficient user experience design.
  • Collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders to design and evaluate new features
  • Articulate journeys with context scenarios, storyboards, and presentations
  • Render user experiences through imagery, typography, space, layout, motion, and color
  • Create visualizations as clear communication tools to make data memorable and actionable
  • Maintain a design system of patterns for the consumption of product teams
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience
  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering
  • Conceptualize original ideas that bring simplicity and user friendliness to complex design roadblocks
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
  • Conduct user research and evaluate user feedback
  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards (like 10 UX Usability Heuristics)
  • Manage design libraries and design systems with adherence to product branding requirements
  • Experience with HTML5, CSS3 and the use of React and Angular Javascript frameworks in interface design
  • Experienced with designing dazzling browser and mobile user interfaces
Job Requirements:
  • Possesses superior communication, planning and organizational skills
  • Must also possess excellent problem-solving skills with good judgment and decision making
  • Ability to build and foster relationships with coworkers and clients
  • Must be goal oriented
  • Ability to work with and meet established objectives, priorities, and deadlines on a consistent basis
  • Ability to innovate and develop out-of-the-box solutions to complex user interaction problems
  • Strong communication and presentation skills

Inovalon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

Qualifications

  • High school diploma or equivalent is required
  • 7+ years of experience as a UI Designer, Interaction Designer, or similar role
  • Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience
  • Solid experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows and site maps
  • Proficiency with industry standard design and rapid prototyping tools (e.g. Sketch, Figma, or similar)
  • Experience in visual photo and illustration tools like Photoshop and Illustrator
  • Experience conducting usability evaluations including think-aloud and performance studies
  • Experience developing technical documentation and visual design systems
  • A portfolio demonstrating leadership and mastery of the human-centered design process
  • Proficiency in visual design and wire-framing tools
  • Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript (React, Angular) for rapid prototyping
  • Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
  • Ability to present your designs and sell your solutions to various stakeholders.
  • Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
  • Up-to-date with the latest UI trends, techniques, and technologies
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process

Write high-quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate. Collaborate with developers, testers, project managers, product managers, and project sponsors. Full Job Description

Cardinal Education is seeking a Robotics Coach for a student in 11th grade! The student is an advanced beginner in Robotics, with extensive experience in VEX robotics. We are looking for a mentor who can help the student set up a workshop in her home with materials provided by the family, and teach facets of hardware and software, to meaningfully pursue an independent study project adapted to the student’s needs. An example of the student's interest is in converting a riding lawnmower to an autonomous lawnmower.
As part of a rapidly-growing enterprise, coaches have the opportunity to make a significant impact from day one. We heavily invest in our coaches to develop exceptional professional and coaching skills.
If you are someone interested in working in the education industry or supplementing your income with rewarding, stimulating work, this is an excellent opportunity for you!

Cardinal Education does not guarantee the requested number of weekly hours; hours are dependent on the candidate’s performance in training and client demand.

job.title: Solution Architect
job.body:
At Starmind, we believe that the combined knowledge and cognitive capabilities of humans far exceed any existing technology's computing power; thus, we developed AI to empower and enhance rather than replace the human mind.

Our platform helps expedite people's advancement by exploring undocumented human intelligence and enabling real-time access to skills, knowledge, and solutions within corporations, communities, and, since we like to think of the bigger picture: the world.

Do you have what it takes to help us shape the future of AI?

Watch this video to find out how Starmind works!


As a Solution Architect at Starmind, you are the bridge between our customers and our tech team. You understand our customers' environment, which allows you to bring back valuable insights for our product, engineers, and AI Team. On the customer front, you work closely with our customer success and our sales team to provide our customers' best experience.

What You Will Do

  • You are responsible from a technical perspective for all our US customers.
  • You consult our customers on how to integrate Starmind seamlessly into their workflows and systems.
  • Together with our AI team, you identify data sources from which Starmind can learn.
  • You will help shape our technology based on your experience as our Solution Architect.
  • You provide insights for internal and external customers into the performance of the system using SQL.
  • You can automate processes using Python or Node JS.

What's In It For You?

  • Being part of a dynamic, young company where input is welcomed and acted upon
  • Working in a multicultural environment with some of the most talented people in the market
  • Being granted a high level of personal responsibility and independence
  • The possibility to have an impact at a large scale, impacting the daily work of thousands of employees

Who You Are

  • You have basic programming skills in Python or NodeJS.
  • You have some awareness of Rest APIs, SQL, and web technologies.
  • You have some experience with Linux based systems.
  • Any knowledge around the O365 suite would be a big plus.
  • You are eager to learn and experiment with new technologies.
  • You are confident in dealing directly with internal and external customers.
  • You are a great communicator.
  • Reliable, responsible, and able to work on your initiative
  • Fluent English is essential.
  • A computer science degree or similar would be great; this is not essential if you can demonstrate practical knowledge in the relevant areas.
  • Maybe you come from a completely unrelated background but found you have a natural ability in software development.
  • You have a good sense of humor and know how to have fun.
  • You're not afraid of a challenge. You see failure as a learning opportunity.

job.title: Developer Advocate
job.body:
Developer Advocate

TigerGraph is the world's fastest graph analytics platform designed to unleash the power of interconnected data for deeper insights and better outcomes. We welcome persons from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build the next generation graph computing and analytics platform.

Brief Overview:

The Developer Advocate role is critically important to the success of TigerGraph. We're looking for a Developer Advocate to collaborate with and cultivate TigerGraph's global developer community with a focus on enabling and empowering developers though technical resources (tools, APIs, libraries, design patterns, and other examples) and human resources (users' forums, meetups, collaboration, and training). The Developer Advocate has been a developer, and continues to be one in spirit.


What You'll Do:

  • Grow and develop the success of TigerGraph's developer experience, as well as the size and richness of the developer community.
  • Participate in and contribute to TigerGraph's online developer's forums.
  • Produce code samples, design patterns, blog posts, videos, and tutorials for developers.
  • Contribute to and get community members to contribute to the expansion and maturing of TigerGraph's open-source ecosystem.
  • Foster and build relationships between TigerGraph's and other developer communities.
  • Collaborate with TigerGraph's product, engineering, and marketing teams to identify customer needs and to jointly meet those needs.
  • Develop and present talks, demonstrations, and workshops for developer conferences, events, and hackathons.

Preferred Skills and Experience

  • Contributing to open-source projects and could set up one of your own
  • BA/BS in Computer Science or equivalent degree and experience
  • Database experience in SQL and/or NoSQL
  • Coding experience in contemporary languages and development environments such as JavaScript, Go, C++, Python, Java, GitHub, Maven, Jupyter
  • Participation in and/or knowledge of existing developer forums
  • Blogging, technical documentation, and developer outreach
  • Presenting to technical audiences
  • +1 Deployment, integration, and operations on cloud platform such as AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform
  • +1 Building full-stack enterprise applications
  • +1 Machine learning and AI
