job.title: North Pole - Full Stack Software Engineer (Remote)
job.body:
Help Santa Claus ensure he has all the supplies he needs for making toys for the world. He works with teams of elves but even for him it can be hard to discover which elves are making which toys, finding alternatives if there's risk a toy won't be built in time, and collaborating with Rudolph and the other reindeer. This is where Craft can assist.

Whether Santa or enterprises, Craft's technology helps enterprises be smarter, and our vision is to build the digital intelligence layer of the enterprise technology stack. Our approach to delivering this vision starts and ends with the team we can attract, and how well we can empower the most creative and effective team of people in the technology sector. Elves too.

Craft is an enterprise intelligence company helping organizations accelerate data-informed business decisions. Our unique, proprietary data platform tracks thousands of real-time signals across millions of companies globally, delivering best in class monitoring and insight into global supply chains, among other company cohorts. Our clients, including Fortune 100 companies, government agencies, asset management groups, and others, use our technology for supply chain intelligence, market intelligence and related use cases. Through our modular, secure, customizable portal, our clients can monitor any company they are working with and collaboratively drive critical actions in real-time.

We are a well-funded technology company with leading investors from Silicon Valley and elsewhere.

We're not your typical SaaS startup. Our CEO is a seasoned entrepreneur and Juilliard-trained cellist. Our team is equally composed of musicians/artists/teachers and people into sports and the outdoors. The Craft team is globally distributed across the US, Canada, UK, and Belarus, with a physical HQ in San Francisco, and members in cities such as Seattle, LA, Salt Lake City, and Boston. We fully support and encourage remote workers!

We are an equal opportunity employer who values and encourages diversity and belonging at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Craft is seeking a motivated and skilled Full Stack Software Engineer, with experience building integrated, scalable, and robust SaaS applications and APIs.

In this role you will

  • Build beautiful, well-tested features and services using technologies like React, Node.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, GraphQL, and AWS. We value learning and growing together instead of knowledge of every specific technology
  • Work in small, empowered feature teams with teammates across Design, Product, and Data Science to drive complex features from start to finish, across the full stack, including but not limited to the Craft Enterprise Portal, Craft Company API (currently 300+ endpoints)
  • Have unlimited opportunity for taking ownership of features and areas with increasing scope, and for technical and leadership growth
  • Provide thoughtful, constructive code reviews in an environment of mentorship. We can all learn from each other regardless of title.
  • Advocate for modern engineering best practices, and use metrics to measure change
  • Be encouraged to learn more about how a SaaS company works beyond engineering, to form stronger connections across disciplines, which ultimately leads to designing and building best-in-class products and services

We'd love to hear from you if

  • Have a proven track record of successfully built products and services, typically 4+ years experience
  • Show curiosity through asking questions, digging into to new technologies, and always trying to grow
  • A "Builder" of new products, not an "Optimizer" of existing products
  • Have experience working with databases like Postgres or MongoDB, and knowledge of AWS/Cloud, Terraform
  • Good knowledge of multiple frameworks, and/or specialized systems
  • Experience implementing complex software systems and services
  • Strong team player, great listener, able to facilitate discussion and assimilate diverse opinions towards clear decisions
  • Self-starter, independent, likes to take initiative

A Note to Candidates

Studies have shown that women and people of color tend not to apply for jobs unless they feel they meet exactly all items in the job description. We are most interested in finding the best candidates and they may come from a nontraditional background. We encourage you to apply, even if you don't match everything listed in the job description.

Meet Your Manager

Alex D'Angelo has over 16 years of professional software development experience. In his words: "I build collaborative, effective engineering teams and help develop leaders, all in service of making great products people love. I foster a supportive environment, where being open and vulnerable leads to deeper connections, growth from taking risks, and a stronger team overall. I'm also a huge fan of the Muppets and experimenting with baking bread."

Interview Process

We want you to have a great interviewing experience and see this as a conversation. To help you prepare, the outline typically (but subject to change) looks like

  • Recruiter (20 min) - non-technical phone call to discuss Craft, your background and answer questions.
  • Hiring Manager (30 min) - non-technical video call to do a deeper dive into your background, the role and opportunity.
  • Home coding exercise (< 30 min) - a small problem in a language of your choice. We're interested in the discussion, not watching you type, and keep it short to respect that you have responsibilities outside of the job search.
  • Technical (60 min) - Video call reviewing the exercise, & deep dive on the design of a recent project of your choice.
  • Final Interview (90 min) - Video call covering culture & product.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary + equity at a well-funded VC-backed startup
  • Unlimited vacation time
  • Option to work remotely
  • Excellent covered health, dental, and vision insurance + 401K
  • Monthly allowance for gym/wellness, Audible/books, internet, cell phone, and snacks
  • High-end Apple laptop, and ergonomic workstation allowance
  • Fun coworkers
For this specific role, Craft can only accept applications from US citizens or permanent residents.
Meta: Craft - Today
Company: Craft
Employer: Craft

job.title: UI/UX Design Lead *clearable* (up to 25% profit sharing benefit)
job.body:
Job Description

What You’ll Get to Do:

(BIT Systems Inc, a CACI Company, is looking for a talented user experience/user interface (UI/UX) designer to join our ODIN team and up our game.

More About the Role:

On ODIN, we put a premium on the design aesthetic of our web sites and software applications. As a member of our high performing software development team, you will help create stunning user experiences by designing UIs for both simple and complex applications and web pages. User experience is the difference between our mission users adopting cutting edge capabilities or languishing with underperforming tools. In this highly visible position, you will work with a variety of customers to create a diverse set of front-end designs for a myriad of applications. You also will be responsible for creating user interview questions and synthesizing the results of the interview process. Don't worry, you won't be bored.

This position will include maturing web applications from user requirements and back-of-the-napkin sketches, to wireframe designs in Figma or InVision, to implementing the designs in HTML and CSS. It will also include working on larger software efforts to lead the UI/UX implementations being implemented by other developers. For the ideal candidate, design thinking is second nature. This candidate should be proficient with design/illustration technology such as Adobe CS, InVision, and Figma, and the latest web technologies and UI JavaScript frameworks like React, AngularJS, Meteor and Material UI.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Use proven design patterns, innovative approaches and design thinking to build intuitive UIs that are a joy to use
  • Provide web user interface (UI) and user experience (UX) expertise in support of new application development and application transformation
  • Support the entire product lifecycle to include systems engineering and requirement analysis, technical design, system integration, implementation and deployment
  • Work directly with end users and stakeholders, translating customer needs into deployed software capabilities
  • Participate in a responsive team where communication skills and the ability to solve problems are critical to our success
  • Lead design meetings with the customer and stakeholders

You’ll Bring These Qualifications

  • Typically requires a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Digital Design, Human Factors Engineering or a related technical field or equivalent and experience working with a balanced product team.
  • Minimum of 2 years experience in UI/UX design or related technical fields
  • Education and Experience equivalents are considered on a case-by-case basis
  • A willingness to learn and the ability to translate and prioritize user requests and requirements and balance with stakeholder needs
  • These Qualifications Would Be Nice to Have
  • Excellent technical acumen and self-motivated with creativity to tackle hard-to-solve problems
  • Ability to work independently and within a distributed team environment
  • Strong interpersonal, teamwork, problem solving, organizational and multi-tasking skills
  • Comfortable working with a diverse set of contractors and customer personnel
  • Strong understanding of UI/UX best practices
  • Cross-browser development expertise
  • Understanding of agile development practices, including Agile Scrum
  • Experience with configuration management processes and tools
  • Knowledge of Intelligence Community (IC) processes, policies, and guidance

Security Clearance:

  • This position DOES NOT require a clearance to start, however, you must be able to obtain and eligible to be processed for a TS/SCI with C.I. polygraph clearance

job.title: Director, Client Architecture
job.body:
CVS/Aetna Digital is a highly energetic, highly collaborative team that operates like a startup within the CVS/Aetna Enterprise. CVS/Aetna Digital’s mandate is to transform health and wellness via products that enable consumer engagement and best-in-class experience through innovative and transformational technology. As the innovation arm to Aetna and CVS Health, we are responsible for digital transformation as well as the development and execution of the digital roadmap. A key part of the responsibility is to build an integrated platform that enables the delivery of products and services that drives engagement and revolutionize health and wellness. We want you to be part of the team that will build this next generation platform!We leverage a fully cloud-native technology stack that’s API driven and utilizes some of the latest frameworks (containerization, microservices, service mesh). You will have the opportunity to work on cutting edge technologies and participate in hackathons. Employing your knowledge and expertise in application development, design patterns, and software domains, you will join a product team that is building a disruptive, industry leading, cloud platform that will transform the healthcare industry and improve the lives of hundreds of millions of people. Aetna Digital is looking for a Director of Front-end Architecture that will interface with several disciplines within various business units including Design, Product, Engineering, as well as external partners & vendors towards the creation of a secure, unified customer facing experience. This leadership role requires a talented professional with a deep technical background and a passion for architecting secure, modern applications without compromising the end user experience. • Lead a talented, dedicated team of client architects on the Aetna Health portfolio to deliver value and drive innovation for Aetna’s member facing web and native mobile applications• Mentor and coach architects to maximize on their strengths and address areas of improvement• Partner with stakeholders, including Product Management, Engineering, Security, and Design team members to influence application architecture and product direction• Work with senior leadership as a representative of Aetna Digital in other technical business areas within CVS Health in architectural decision making.• Work with senior management on strategy and direction• Identify new opportunities to deliver value and increase the team’s scope• Define Client Architecture’s roadmap and establish new processes to deliver impactful outcomes to Aetna Health • Participate in technical architectural discussions• Keep abreast of current industry and technologies trends to capture ideas for innovation

Required Qualifications
10+ years of recent and related experience in application and system architecture methodologies as well as a rich understanding of architectural design patterns7+ years of people management experience, ideally senior engineers or architectsStrong understanding of web and mobile application architecture Deep experience w/various technologies: Swift, Kotlin, JavaScript (pref React, Angular, Node.js a plus), Microservices, Micro-frontend, Kubernetes, Istio, CSS, HTMLFull stack technical experience preferred, with experience in AWS and other cloud environments and servicesTrack record of leading and mentoring technical professionals by building a collaborative architecture approach in an Agile organizationA disciplined approach to software architecture and problem solving Superior communication and presentation skillsAbility to build strong relationships and partnerships with technical and business stakeholdersBalance “big picture” thinking with technical “in the weeds” considerationsSelf motivated/driven with a disciplined work ethicDetail-oriented and organizedPassion for learningExperience in Agile development methodology (SAFe software development principles a plus)

job.title: Software Developer
job.body:
*Open to remote candidates*

At VelocityEHS our goal is to deliver the most complete, the most user friendly, and the quickest and easiest-to-implement EHS, sustainability and risk management platform available. VelocityEHS is seeking an experienced Software Developer to design, build and maintain software for SaaS applications and services.

The VelocityEHS work environment is dynamic, innovative and entrepreneurial. We have a results-oriented culture that demands intelligence, teamwork and follow-through. If you have these qualities and can learn quickly and apply what you learn to what you do, then this is the job for you – check out the details below and apply now.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARENT LIMITED TO:

  • Be a leader by example to the Software Development Team
  • Maintain software development processes
  • Maintaining high level of product quality
  • Follow overall architectural principles, frameworks, and standards
  • Help design solutions that are enterprise scalable and maintainable
  • Provide input into long-range product requirements, best practices, and operational guidelines, with focus on continuous improvement of platform reliability and serviceability
  • Ensure that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence

What success looks like:

  • SaaS software platforms are developed as scalable, high performing and maintainable solutions using best practices and current technologies
  • Scalability methodologies are well understood and implemented in a consistent and robust manner
  • You play a key part in your scrum teams’ successes

SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

Minimum Skills & Qualifications:

  • High attention to detail
  • Experience with Agile development methodology (e.g., Scrum
  • Experience in multiple programming languages and platforms
  • Advanced knowledge of C#
  • Advanced knowledge in modern JavaScript (React, Angular)
  • Experience in SQL and ORMs
  • Experience with REST APIs design and development.
  • Proficiency with test-driven development (TDD) and strong understanding of clean code concepts.
  • BS in related field and at least 4 years of experience in the Information Technology arena
  • Experience working with cross functional teams including business analysts, UI/UX designers, software developers, and QA analysts
  • Ability to work in an environment with honest and open discussion of all issue

PREFERRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

Preferred Skills & Qualifications:

  • Knowledge of containers (Docker)
  • Experience with cloud architecture
  • Experience with CI/CD
  • More than 3 years of experience in a SaaS organization

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

VelocityEHS is the largest and fastest growing environmental, health, safety (EHS) and sustainability software company in the world. More than 8 million people rely on our innovative on-demand (cloud-computing technology) safety and compliance management solutions to do their jobs safely and protect the environment.

At VelocityEHS, success is an everyday occurrence. Everyone who walks through our doors has an opportunity to make an impact. Our people make the difference at VelocityEHS – that's why we're not just looking for people with the right skills, but for those with the right drive, the right passion and the right character to make our entire team better. We still operate with the same start-up mentality that has made us the leading cloud EHS company, and offer each and every employee the opportunity to grow and reach their full potential.

We’re driven by the work we do to keep others safe, but we also like to have fun while doing it. We believe in producing great results, but also in enjoying the ride. Work-Life balance means two things at VelocityEHS – having time for your life outside of work, and taking steps to bring more life into the workplace. Between all the variety of workplace events, volunteer opportunities and other group activities available, we never forget that dynamic people need and deserve a place to work.

Finally, we understand that taking care of our customers starts with taking care of our employees. Our benefits include excellent medical and dental plans, matching 401(k) saving plan, and RRSPS saving plans, generous PTO and more. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

Click here to Apply!

job.title: Instructor
job.company: Washington Technology Industry Associati - Seattle, WA 98109
job.body:
About Apprenti

Apprenti is a registered apprenticeship program for the tech industry powered by the WTIA, Washington’s tech industry association. Apprenti trains future tech workers with an emphasis on underrepresented groups including women, minorities, and veterans. Apprentices typically receive three to five months of full-time training followed by one year of paid on-the-job training with one of the program’s hiring partners. The program is funded by the U.S. Department of Labor, corporate and private funders. More information about Apprenti can be found at ApprentiCareers.org. Apprenti is a non-profit 501(c)(3) organization.

Position Description

Under the supervision of the National Director of Education, the Instructor will primarily deliver, and secondarily develop, training programs that are not available through our existing external training provider partners. This individual will have broad autonomy over coursework and presentation within the overall program framework as supplied by and coordinated with the Principal Instructor. In order to protect the proprietary course materials of our existing training providers, this position will have minimal contact with Apprenti programs other than those developed by the instructional team.

The successful candidate will be proficient in HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and Java.

Expected Duties

  • Consistent with directives of the Principal Instructor, develop curricula and complete course materials for identified instructional programs for a mid-2021 launch; maintain currency of existing curricula (20%)
  • Deliver instruction to apprentice cohorts using virtual delivery tools (web conferencing, learning management systems, GitHub portfolios, and other tools as appropriate); provide backup coverage to other instructors as needed due to illness or other absences (60%)
  • Coordinate data analytics and feedback with Education Research Manager for program iteration and continuous quality improvement (10%)
  • Other duties as assigned (10%)

Required Qualifications

  • Previous teaching experience in technology industry subject matter (adult education preferred; primary/secondary instruction also considered) OR prior work experience within the past 10 years in the technology sector in a role relevant to software development
  • Proficiency in Java, JavaScript (including appropriate frameworks such as React, Angular, Node, Express), HTML, and CSS
  • Comfort teaching in a virtual environment
  • Excellent written and verbal English skills
  • Comfort with ambiguity, making decisions with incomplete information, and a high level of adaptability in a fast-paced environment with geographically distributed staff under minimal supervision
  • Passion for learning, teaching, and constantly keeping up with industry trends and developments
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without need of future sponsorship

Preferred Qualifications

  • Graduate degree in a STEM field
  • Proficiency in at least one other significant programming language (Python preferred; C# or others also of interest) and/or data language (SQL, AWS, Azure, Salesforce Apex)
  • Experience working with diverse populations, including persons with disabilities, neurodiverse students, and those without traditional educational backgrounds
  • Conflict management skills or training
  • Access to an appropriately professional studio or teaching space; if none available, we will identify coworking space or other appropriate venues
  • Instructional design skills, including formatting and layout of assignments and other presentation tools
  • Experience and comfort with Canvas, Zoom, and video production/editing software of choice to prepare and manage lecture recordings and sample labs

job.title: Product QA Technician
job.body:
Summary

Posted: Dec 9, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:200210649
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. You bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish. We are looking for an experienced Product QA Technician to join our Services Product and Design studio. Ideal candidates have deep knowledge of Apple’s hardware and software products, technical problem-solving experience, and outstanding communication skills, to partner with cross-functional teams on upcoming product launches.
Key Qualifications
  • 7+ years as a QA engineer or technical project manager working on digital media software and content.
  • Deep knowledge of Apple’s ecosystem of media products and services.
  • Experience configuring pre-release hardware and software for testing and demos.
  • Shown ability to build and run test suites, file bugs and regressions, and communicate status.
  • Experience with JavaScript, Python, or other programming language.
  • Obsessive attention to detail.
  • Proven ability to influence at all levels, with outstanding oral and written communication.
  • Availability to travel occasionally.
  • Bonus points for international experience, production design skills, or UI/UX background.
Description
As part of the Product Operations team, you’ll work across Apple’s suite of media products and services (including Apple Music, TV, Books, Podcasts, Maps and News), across our iOS, macOS and tvOS platforms. You’ll collaborate closely with Product, Design and Engineering teams, take product requirements documents, functional specs, and design comps, and test against editorial and content use cases. You’ll need to be comfortable working in QA and staging environments, ensuring new features, bug fixes, and enhancements do not negatively affect our current ecosystem or previous versions. You’ll then assess and communicate impact on cross-functional partners including Business, Editorial, Production, Localization and Marketing, to ensure the end product meets everyone’s expectations. You excel in translating the technical to a non-technical audience, and vice versa. While your primary focus will be on Product QA, you’ll also be tasked with providing technical setup and support for internal product demos, press briefings, or launch events. You will be able to configure and troubleshoot hardware, software, profiles and accounts, for a myriad of use cases, and at a moment’s notice. This role is cross-functional and multi-faceted, and you should be capable of changing pace without missing a beat. You’ll be just as comfortable building out a complex test plan or dissecting an automation script behind the scenes, as you are under the spotlight in high-pressure situations, ensuring a product demo is executed flawlessly. You’re also supremely process-driven, and can take the lead in organizing the team’s day-to-day priorities into efficient and sustainable workflows.
Education & Experience
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.

job.title: Staff Software Developer
job.body:
At VelocityEHS our goal is to deliver the most complete, the most user friendly, and the quickest and easiest-to-implement EHS, sustainability and risk management platform available. VelocityEHS is seeking an experienced Software Developer to design, build and maintain software for SaaS applications and services.

The VelocityEHS work environment is dynamic, innovative and entrepreneurial. We have a results-oriented culture that demands intelligence, teamwork and follow-through. If you have these qualities and can learn quickly and apply what you learn to what you do, then this is the job for you – check out the details below and apply now.

PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE BUT ARENT LIMITED TO:

  • Be a leader by example to the Software Development Team
  • Assist with coaching employees on the Software Development Team
  • Maintain software development processes
  • Maintaining high level of product quality
  • Follow overall architectural principles, frameworks, and standards
  • Help design solutions that are enterprise scalable and maintainable
  • Provide input into long-range product requirements, best practices, and operational guidelines, with focus on continuous improvement of platform reliability and serviceability
  • Ensure that we are continuously raising our standard of engineering excellence

What success looks like:

  • SaaS software platforms are developed as scalable, high performing and maintainable solutions using best practices and current technologies
  • Scalability methodologies are well understood and implemented in a consistent and robust manner
  • You play a key part in your scrum teams’ successes

SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

Minimum Skills & Qualifications:

  • High attention to detail
  • Experience with Agile development methodology (e.g., Scrum)
  • Mastery in multiple programming languages and platforms
  • Advanced knowledge of C#
  • Advanced knowledge in modern JavaScript (React, Angular)
  • Advanced knowledge in SQL and ORMs
  • Experience in cloud architecture
  • Experience with REST APIs design and development.
  • Knowledge of containers (Docker)
  • Experience with CI/CD
  • Proficiency with test-driven development (TDD) and strong understanding of clean code concepts.
  • BS in related field and at least 7 years of experience in the Information Technology arena, at least 1-year leadership experience in this field
  • Experience working with cross functional teams including business analysts, UI/UX designers, software developers, and QA analysts
  • Ability to create an environment for honest and open discussion of all issues. You involve the right people, from your team and others, to resolve critical issues.

PREFERRED SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS/WORKING CONDITIONS:

Preferred Skills & Qualifications:

  • More than 5 years of experience in a SaaS organization
  • Ability to provide (informal) coaching to team members to support their understanding of the technology and aid in their technical development
  • Understanding of software architecture and able to guide team members in best practices and approaches
  • Ability to mentor developers and agile team members in defined processes and look for opportunities for improvement.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION:

VelocityEHS is the largest and fastest growing environmental, health, safety (EHS) and sustainability software company in the world. More than 8 million people rely on our innovative on-demand (cloud-computing technology) safety and compliance management solutions to do their jobs safely and protect the environment.

At VelocityEHS, success is an everyday occurrence. Everyone who walks through our doors has an opportunity to make an impact. Our people make the difference at VelocityEHS – that's why we're not just looking for people with the right skills, but for those with the right drive, the right passion and the right character to make our entire team better. We still operate with the same start-up mentality that has made us the leading cloud EHS company, and offer each and every employee the opportunity to grow and reach their full potential.

We’re driven by the work we do to keep others safe, but we also like to have fun while doing it. We believe in producing great results, but also in enjoying the ride. Work-Life balance means two things at VelocityEHS – having time for your life outside of work, and taking steps to bring more life into the workplace. Between all the variety of workplace events, volunteer opportunities and other group activities available, we never forget that dynamic people need and deserve a place to work.

Finally, we understand that taking care of our customers starts with taking care of our employees. Our benefits include excellent medical and dental plans, matching 401(k) saving plan, and RRSPS saving plans, generous PTO and more. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We thank you for your interest, however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. No agencies please.

Click here to Apply!

job.title: Sr. Accessibility Specialist
job.body:
Job Description

About the UX Team

Come and join the largest and fastest-growing UX team in Thomson Reuters! We are a highly-diverse, multi-disciplinary team of over 70 smart, self-driven UX professionals that take great pride in our work, and love the challenge of turning complex problems and constraints into elegant solutions that meet our users’ needs. Our dedicated, open workspace is ideal for promoting an agile, collaborative, supportive environment where diverse thinking, innovative design, and experimentation is welcomed and encouraged. Our work focuses on a large portfolio of cloud-based, data-driven applications that gross over $3.5B annually, and range in size and scale from months to multiple years.

About the Role

As a Senior Accessibility Specialist, you will be working to ensure all customers can access and use our products, defining policies and guidelines for Thomson Reuters as well as collaborating with the team to influence WCAG standards, evaluating and providing accessible solutions for web-based and mobile products, educating and promoting the practice of building accessible products, as well as mentoring others in methods and techniques for addressing accessibility barriers.

What We Need in You

  • BA/BS in information science, information design, computer science, human-computer interaction (HCI), instructional design, quality assurance, learning technology, assistive technology, related field, or equivalent industry training/experience.

  • A full understanding of Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) guidelines and specifications. Must be fluent in WCAG 2.1 guidelines, know WAI-ARIA, UAAG, and ATAG specifications.

  • Experience improving and remediating accessibility using web-based technology including HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

  • Ability to mentor others in methods and techniques for addressing accessibility barriers on web applications and mobile devices and in a variety of forums.

  • Experience leading accessibility evaluations and usability testing for accessibility.

  • Ability to develop tools/resources to help provide implementation directions and requirements for UX Design and Front End Development teams.

  • Experience with assistive technologies and accessibility-related software including JAWS®, NVDA, VoiceOver, TalkBack, ZoomText, MAGic®, Dragon® NaturallySpeaking, or other speech recognition software.

  • 7+ years working in a fast-paced and highly collaborative development environment with experience in large, complex software or web applications.

  • Ability to work collaboratively and productively both with diverse teams and independently.

Knowledge and Skills

  • Be an expert in both consulting and conducting comprehensive accessibility testing against the WCAG 2.1 (AA) Success Criteria and the updated Section 508 federal requirements using the following methodologies: visual analysis; screen reader reviews; color sampling; keyboard only; gesture only; and code reviews.

  • Experience working within constraints of user-centered design principles and tools.

  • Experience with Agile software development practices.

  • Strong understanding of JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

  • Experience with incorporating accessible features in web applications and/or mobile applications using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

  • Experience and understanding of VPATs / ACR review and creation.

  • Knowledge of creating accessible documents and document remediation - examples include PDF, PowerPoint, MS Word, Excel

  • General awareness of Section 508, AODA and EN 301 549

  • Strong project management, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills.

  • Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills.

  • Strong presentation skills.

  • Can-do attitude.

What You Get to Do

  • Interact with and provide direction to UX, technology, content, and product development teams.

  • Cooperate with other departments to ensure consistency and quality across the platform.

What’s in it For You

At Thomson Reuters, our people are our greatest assets. Here are some of the benefits we offer for your personal and professional growth:

  • Learning & Development:

    • Exposure to a wide breadth of leading-edge technology

    • Career growth - the ability to work on multiple projects and/or with various teams

    • Professional growth and development opportunity through various training programs, conferences, networking events, in-house speaker series, etc.

    • Access to Hackathons, Unconferences, Harvard Manage Mentor, and more, we offer learning opportunities for everyone

  • Benefits/Perks:

    • Health benefits

    • Savings/investment plans

    • Paid time off (including time off to volunteer and extended parental leave)

  • Flexibility: We've been named as one of Forbes, Best Companies for Work/Life Balance

  • Global Opportunities: We have employees in over 90 countries, working across 3 different industries

  • Your wellbeing: We offer a program that focuses on making our lives healthier

What Makes this a Unique Opportunity

Thomson Reuters participates in the W3C (World Wide Web Consortium), which creates the standards for the web, including accessibility standards. The UX Accessibility team participates in the WCAG working groups (Web Content Accessibility Guidelines), which is part of the W3C. You will have the unique opportunity to join these groups and be a thought leader in cutting edge evolution of accessibility standards.

If this sounds like you, please contact us. We look forward to meeting you!

Assistive Technology users strongly encouraged to apply.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

Locations
Toronto-Ontario-Canada;Ann Arbor-Michigan-United States of America;Carrollton-Texas-United States of America;Eagan-Minnesota-United States of America

Job Description
  • This Executive Director role will lead a global team of technologists delivering strategic program initiatives as part of a multi-year transformation plan for Global Real Estate. This role will be responsible for designing and delivering next-generation application portfolio, infrastructure and data and reporting management.
  • Key Objectives:
    • Establish GRE as a global industry leader by using technology to drive innovation, increase flexibility, and excel in a competitive environment
    • Leverage technology to drive efficiencies, maximize employee productivity and create a positive working environment for collaboration
    • Improve data consistency and quality to enable better decision making, and increase transparency and accountability
    • Enabling cost reduction to Firm (all lines of business) by optimizing existing space management / utilization, ongoing property management functions and enhanced real estate portfolio management
    • Enhancing direct employee experience in workspace selection and usage

Responsibilities of the role include:
  • Lead a global team by generating a vision, establishing direction, motivating members, creating an atmosphere of trust, leveraging diverse views
  • Evolve product vision and technology roadmaps by working closely with business, transformation leaders & technology leaders
  • Technical responsibility for application architecture and design. Evolve product architecture and how the platform interacts
  • Provide strong technical leadership for engineering and product teams
  • Active participation in an Agile development process, including working closely with the business and product teams
  • Timely project communications - monthly updates, project updates, RCA updates, agile experiments, team metrics etc
  • Project management experience including managing small teams, influencing decision-making outside of immediate span of control, and accomplishing key objectives and results
  • Manage a team of Software Engineers equipped to deliver end-to-end features
  • Managing cross-team and vendor dependencies throughout the software lifecycle
  • Participate in Architecture & Engineering forums, perform design reviews
  • Participate in dev modernization and adoption of emerging/modern technologies across the application suite
  • Continuous improvement of our DevOps, tooling and processes to enable us to deliver more value
  • Align with the security standards and guidelines to ensure systems are secure and protected against threats
  • Driving normalization/standardization of technology disciplines, collaborating with firm wide CI/CD engineering service owners and Practice Enablement.

Qualifications:
  • This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
  • BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
  • Experienced senior IT professional with a proven Financial Services and/or Real Estate Technology track record, with more than 15 years' experience in combinations of successful application development and technology operations management
  • Experience with Big Data and emerging technologies; Portfolio management, Conflict Resolution; Negotiation; Budget / Financial / Resource Management
  • Demonstrated ability and success in interacting and influencing senior leadership on areas and strategies concerning the selection and deployment of technologies
  • Mastery of application, data, and infrastructure architecture disciplines
  • Knowledge of industry-wide technology trends and best practices
  • Experience with Java eco-system and associated tooling (Core & EE, Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Cloud), UI/UX (React JS, Angular or equivalent), Web Technologies (JavaScript, HTML 5, CSS, JSON, REST, SOAP)
  • SCM / DevOps / CI/CD tools & process (GIT/Bitbucket, Maven, Ant, Jenkins, Sonar), Testing tools & frameworks (Jasmin/Karma, JUnit, Selenium, Cucumber, Mockito), Agile Methodology and Tools (JIRA)
  • Experience with Micro Services & Event Architecture
  • Experience with Integration patterns and messaging technologies (JMS, Mule, Kafka, RabbitMQ)
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms, Container/Orchestration (Docker, Kubernetes, Cloud Foundry)
  • Strong Communication Skills demonstrating the ability to present and explain ideas and concepts.
  • Experience building and managing global Software Engineering teams.
  • Experience in engineering solutions for metrics gathering/publishing and event collection/correlation across distributed architectures, automation, monitoring, intelligent alerting, random fault injection (Chaos Engineering), and self-healing
  • Experience providing leadership for large data volume applications.
  • Expertise in working in in large, collaborative teams to achieve organizational goals
  • Keen understanding of financial control and budget management
  • Organizes and prioritizes critical issues and required information to facilitate efficient decision making; provides oversight and guidance to team projects of highest priority and importance
  • Able to distill widely variant feedback into root cause issues and provide actionable feedback to other senior stakeholders. Excellent technical and business presentation, writing, and verbal communication skills
  • Track record of driving strategy, organizational and operating model change
  • Strong facilitation, process and influencing skills
  • Proven entrepreneurial style

job.title: UX/UI Designer
job.body:
About Us:

KiwiCo is an innovative eCommerce company that sparks kids’ creativity and curiosity through offline and online materials and inspiration. We offer kids seriously fun and deeply engaging ways to explore, create, and learn. Our core offering is a subscription service that delivers hands-on projects to kids of all ages. We also have an online store and additional creative content. We take great pride and ownership in the products and experiences we design and in the community of parents and kids we serve. Our offices are located in Mountain View, CA.


The UX/UI Designer role:

KiwiCo is looking for a creative and strategic designer who is passionate about designing great online user experiences. Our site plays a key role in shaping a potential customer’s view of the company, and the UX/UI Designer is responsible for designing - and improving upon - any pages, features, and flows.

Responsibilities also include staying true to our design aesthetic through the visual design of the website and marketing assets. Emails, ads, and landing pages are the first touch points we have with a potential customer, and it is important for the UX/UI Designer to be able to express the KiwiCo brand across these marketing assets.


Responsible for:

  • The UX, UI, and visual design of the website by balancing the needs of our users, our design aesthetic, and the objectives of the business
  • Collaborating with the Marketing/Tech teams to assess product requirements and translate them into compelling designs that optimize the user experience
  • Building rapid high fidelity prototypes, landing pages, and marketing assets
  • Creating iterative designs that meet project objectives and incorporate feedback, analytics, and user testing
  • Confidently presenting design ideas and recommendations to the team
  • Keeping abreast of current design tools, techniques, and technologies

Requirements:

  • BA/BS degree in Design (graphic, visual communications, interaction, product, etc)
  • 1+ years of experience in visual, eCommerce, brand, or marketing design
  • A portfolio showcasing UX, UI, and visual design work for mobile and desktop
  • Fluent in design tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, and InVision
  • Thrive in a fast-paced environment with limited resources by being self-motivated and working independently to deliver projects on time
  • Ability to think critically and creatively
  • Attention to detail

Bonus:

  • Experience working at a startup
  • Experience designing mobile applications and/or for eCommerce
  • Knowledge of how mocks translate to HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to deliver feasible designs

job.title: Marcus by Goldman Sachs -Senior Product Manager - Vice President - Richardson, TX
job.body:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:
CONSUMER (MARCUS BY GOLDMAN SACHS)
Marcus by Goldman Sachs is the firm’s consumer business, combining the entrepreneurial spirit of a startup with 150 years of experience. Today, Marcus has $90 billion in deposits, $7 billion in loan balances and 4 million customers across our lending and deposits businesses, as well as the personal financial management app, Clarity Money. Through the use of insights and intuitive design, we provide customers with powerful tools and products that are grounded in value, transparency and simplicity. We are backed by our unique team, comprised of individual contributors from leading agile technology companies, fintechs and consumer financial services companies, allowing us to disrupt the industry, while helping consumers take control of their financial lives.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:
YOUR IMPACT

We are searching for a Senior Product Manager to identify and execute on our vision to disrupt the way that consumers experience the financial services industry. You are a fit for this role if you are a natural born leader with a vision, paired with strong communication and execution skills to help make your vision a reality. You should naturally rely on consumer insights and data to build product plans and achieve business objectives. In this seat, you must be a problem solver who is comfortable getting into the weeds and is passionate about building world-class consumer product teams in a fast-growing startup environment.

As a Senior Product Manager, you will engage with key stakeholders across business, product, engineering and brand teams to develop, prioritize and build the product roadmap for our lending business. You will drive the development process to deliver new features and functionality while identifying and measuring key metrics to ensure a best in class customer experience across our web and mobile properties.

This is an opportunity to make an impact in the industry – delivering value to the customer through delightful UX and thoughtfully curated features. In this role, you will join a team committed to superior customer experience, operating at a fast pace to improve and extend the consumer product line.


RESPONSIBILITIES
  • Inform and drive the “big picture” strategy while also rolling up your sleeves and being an individual contributor on specific workstreams and projects
  • Lead multiple, high-impact workstreams, spanning front-end and back-end development
  • Build trusted relationships with our design, engineering, marketing and other external teams to craft and launch beautiful, easy-to-use features that solve our customers’ most pressing financial problems
  • Continuously leverage data and customer feedback to identify both problem areas and opportunities
  • Collaborate with other product and engineering leads to develop and refine the agile delivery model
  • Articulate product features and requirements to different audiences (from development teams to program leadership)

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • 8-10+ years of product management or related experience
  • Experience leading, mentoring and growing a team of product managers
  • Experience working in enterprise and/or consumer ecosystems and working across diverse geographical locations
  • Highly adaptable and flexible skillset; comfortable working in a fast-paced environment with frequent change
  • Proven track record of delivering complex, high-quality consumer products at scale
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment with heavy emphasis on teamwork
  • Proficient in major design, development, and project management applications (i.e., Sketch, Keynote, Jira, etc.)
  • Excellent attention to detail and communication / presentation skills

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Experience leading teams that have successfully launched new consumer finance products
  • Technical knowledge (including HTML/CSS/JS/SQL)
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:
CONSUMER AND INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT DIVISION (CIMD)
The Consumer and Investment Management Division includes Goldman Sachs Asset Management (GSAM), Private Wealth Management (PWM) and our Consumer business (Marcus by Goldman Sachs). We provide asset management, wealth management and banking expertise to consumers and institutions around the world. CIMD partners with various teams across the firm to help individuals and institutions navigate changing markets and take control of their financial lives.

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2020. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

job.title: Full-Stack Web Developer for Legacy SaaS Products
job.body:
Singlebrook is seeking a full-time, full-stack web developer to work on a variety of legacy SaaS products, which serve tens of thousands of users in many countries.

Who We Are

Singlebrook is a product development company, using software and technology to create a positive impact in the world. We're fighting the good fight for social, racial, economic, and climate justice. Our US-based, distributed team has been building software for almost 15 years, and we've been a certified B Corporation for more than 10 years.

We strive to create a positive, flexible, low-stress working environment. We show our care for our team members with excellent benefits, including a no-deductible health care plan, mobile phone plan, retirement accounts, paid vacation time, gym memberships, and Friday afternoon game time!

Primary Responsibilities

  • Collaborating with internal and external stakeholders to determine development priorities and refine requirements.

  • Working on client- and server-side code to develop new features and improve existing features.

  • Triaging and troubleshooting bugs.

  • Improving test coverage and pursuing other software quality improvements.

Our Ideal Candidate

Inclusion and Welcoming Policy

We are actively looking to diversify our team, and encourage applicants of all ages, genders, races, sexual orientations, and disability statuses to apply.

Personal Attributes

Our ideal candidate is detail-oriented, with strong communications skills, both written and verbal. They enjoy collaborating but are also happy to work independently. They have a positive attitude and are able to empathize with both customers and colleagues. An openness to learning new techniques and technologies is essential to success in this role. As with all programming roles, some amount of dogged persistence is also very helpful.

Above all, the ideal candidate enjoys working with messy legacy code and making it better over time! In some cases, we’ll even be working to replace legacy tech stacks with modern ones.

Experience

We anticipate that our ideal candidate will have four or more years of professional web development experience under their belt, and will have worked with a variety of programming languages during their career. There are no specific educational requirements for this position.

Skills

Programming languages, servers, and frameworks we use, in rough order of current needs, are:

  • ColdFusion/Lucee

  • Front-end Javascript (React and jQuery)

  • Back-end Javascript (Node.js)

  • SQL (varying platforms)

  • Ruby/Rails

  • CSS, Bootstrap

We certainly don’t expect to find any candidates with all of these skills, and we encourage applicants with any subset of them. Just bring a willingness to learn new things!

Location and Availability

This is a remote position, but we also have space in our Ithaca, NY office if you're in the area or looking to relocate. Working hours are somewhat flexible, but should generally be along the lines of US business hours (in any continental US time zone). We also have an informal on-call system which occasionally (but rarely) requires that developers respond to emergencies during their non-business waking hours.

This is a full-time, salaried position. We are looking to fill this position as soon as possible, and applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis.

How to Apply

Please apply with the following:

  • Cover letter detailing your interest in working with us

  • Résumé

  • A sample of your code you’re proud of or an interesting story about coding

Applications not meeting these requirements will not be considered.


This is a remote position.

job.title: Software Engineer
job.body:
Company Description

DNAnexus is the leading cloud-based SaaS company serving the global life science community. DNAnexus’ health informatics platform serves customers across a spectrum of industries — government, biopharmaceutical, clinical diagnostics, healthcare, and academic research in 33 countries with compliant protection of data, privacy, and intellectual property. The platform provides a secure and collaborative environment where genomics, multi-omics, and real world data can be combined with clinical data at scale, providing new insights that can lead to improved diagnostics, new targeted therapies and better patient care.


Job Description

You have worked on systems using a variety of technologies and processes, from interpreted languages and nosql databases to Java and MySQL. You are passionate about the development process and keeping the highest quality code possible. You are passionate about building highly available and scalable systems.

You will be part of a team that is building the data and visualization platform to accelerate translational research involving multi-omic and clinical data. You will be responsible for designing a product that is highly available, scalable, fault tolerant and responsive. You will also evolve this platform beyond operational automation into new and exciting areas.

Responsibilities:

  • Design and build scalable infrastructure specifically targeted to the cloud environment
  • Design, document, and implement new web service APIs for internal and external services
  • Work closely with computational biologists to understand domain-specific needs
  • Work closely with architect and product manager to build features
  • Identify scalability/reliability limits in both our system as well as 3rd party technologies
  • Build and maintain critical system components for scalable distributed system
  • Analyze system performance and health

Requirements:

  • Team-oriented, with strong communication skills
  • Strong computer science background, including low-level systems and algorithmic complexity
  • Demonstrated ability to pick up new technologies and quickly adapt to new paradigms
  • Fluent in Python. Fluency in one of Node.js, C++, Java, Scala also desired
  • Experience using Linux and comfortable working in a Unix shell
  • Experience and depth in databases, distributed systems like Spark, and networking
  • 3+ years of core software development experience
  • Bachelors in Computer Science. Masters or Ph.D preferred

Desired Skills and Experience:

job.title: Senior Backend Software Engineer (Node.js / TypeScript / PostgreSQL / AWS)
job.body:
Job details

Salary
$105,000 - $145,000 a year

Full Job Description

Charityvest is “your personal charitable giving fund”. It offers workplace giving solutions, and personal charity funds for individuals. With Charityvest you can donate stock, make grants to any charity in the United States, and participate in a company matching program.

We are looking for exceptional engineers to join our team to help us grow and modernize the charitable giving industry.

We believe that software production is a craft. We give you the time, space, agency, and creative freedom to hone your craft in building products that people love and rely on.

This position will report directly to our CTO, Jon Koon. Jon is a seasoned technology leader. He spent 7 years at Twitter where he led company-wide web and mobile product initiatives. He was on the ground floor building the new React-based twitter.com.

You'll be joining Jon alongside a talented engineering team of fullstack, frontend, and backend engineers who pride themselves in the quality of their code and their team orientation. In whole they represent over 30 years of experience building fintech and consumer facing software.

Charityvest, Inc. is a nonprofit organization whose purpose is to advance and improve how charitable resources are deployed. It was launched in conjunction with Vennfi, Inc., a for-profit corporation which develops and operates the Charityvest platform. This role joins the team at Vennfi, Inc. to support the growth, development, and operation of Charityvest.

Vennfi recently participated in the Y Combinator Summer 2020 batch and following the program successfully raised 2.3M to accelerate product development, and marketing.

We are based in Atlanta, GA and plan to hire locally, but are open to remote applicants that live within a 3 hour time zone difference.

What you’ll do

  • As one of our early senior engineers, you will play a critical role in establishing patterns and building the foundations for our engineering organization.
  • You’ll be expected to drive initiatives from concept to production ensuring high levels of reliability
  • You will have significant input into the processes, practices, and tools we use.
  • You’ll work directly with designers, product managers, customers, and fellow engineers to ensure your solutions are on target.

Day-to-day

  • Building apis and serverless applications with Node.js and AWS Lambda
  • Establishing new best practices for building and deploying backend and distributed systems
  • Writing fault tolerant integrations with 3rd party payment apis
  • Configuring alerting, logging, and other observability systems to monitor and troubleshoot production systems
  • Writing unit and integration tests to ensure sensitive financial operations are done correctly and securely
  • Automating build, test, and deployment pipelines with Github actions and AWS Codepipeline
  • Database modeling and migrations for PostgreSQL
  • Improving the developer experience to accelerate yourself and fellow engineers

Requirements

  • You consider yourself a "product-centric" engineer and take pride in building something people love.
  • You are self-sufficient in initiating and prioritizing your own work
  • You understand how to balance the needs of engineering, product, marketing, and sales.
  • 3+ years experience doing backend development with Node.js and PostgreSQL (or similar RDBMS).
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Familiar with best practices in engineering, architecture, security, and design for both backend apis, web, and mobile apps.
  • Familiar with best practices around microservices and distributed systems
  • Nice to have: Advanced JavaScript experience: TypeScript, Monorepos, Webpack
  • Nice to have: Experience with AWS: Lambda, SQS, Cloudfront, S3, ElasticSearch, CloudWatch
  • Nice to have: Experience working in a financial technology company (accounting, investing, banking, etc)
  • Nice to have: Experience with React.js

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Equity
  • Flexible vacation
  • Flexible remote and work from home policies
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Plans
  • 401k
  • Paid parental leave
  • Swanky office at Ponce City Market in Midtown Atlanta (when it's safe to return)

We believe generosity is good for the world, and would want any employee to align with the inherent value of generosity as a human virtue.

We are committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by law. Everyone is encouraged to apply.

Full Job Description

This position is open as a 3-month 1099 contract arrangement, with a possibility of extension. Ideally this position will be based in either Dallas, Austin, or Colorado Springs, but we are also open to 100% remote (note: candidates must be US based for remote work).
**Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.**

Who we are: At Hypergiant, our work is driven by individuals pushing the boundary and always professionally challenging our clients to think differently. We're seeking individuals who are both analytical and creative and can help us fuel our motto: Tomorrowing Today. We're based in Texas and have a strong track record of working with some of the biggest brands around the world in industries spanning retail, oil & gas, energy, aviation, healthcare, and more. We provide large enterprises with cutting-edge advice, bespoke technology solutions, and deployment expertise needed to harness the value out of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our goal is to work with forward-thinking organizations and to help them understand how Artificial Intelligence will affect their business and their industry.

We are looking for a Senior Front End Developer who can build and maintain web apps and open-source libraries that can be shared across projects. Write high-quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate. Collaborate with developers, designers, testers, project managers, product managers, and project sponsors. Company Description

At Fannie Mae, futures are made. The inspiring work we do makes an affordable home a reality and a difference in the lives of Americans. Every day offers compelling opportunities to modernize the nation's housing finance system while being part of an inclusive team using new, emerging technologies. Here, you will help lead our industry forward, enhance your technical expertise, and make your career.


Job Description

As a valued colleague on our team, you will contribute to developing data infrastructure and pipelines to capture, integrate, organize, and centralize data while testing and ensuring the data is readily accessible and in a usable state, including quality assurance.

THE IMPACT YOU WILL MAKE

  • Identify customer needs and intended use of requested data in the development of database requirements and support the planning and engineering of enterprise databases.
  • Maintain comprehensive knowledge of database technologies, complex coding languages, and computer system skills.
  • Support the integration of data into readily available formats while maintaining existing structures and govern their use according to business requirements.
  • Analyze new data sources and monitor the performance, scalability, and security of data.
  • Create an initial analysis and deliver the user interface (UI) to the customer to enable further analysis.

Determining causes of operating errors and taking corrective action
Ability to frame ideas as systems and analyzing the inputs, outputs, and process

Skilled in creating and managing databases with the use of relevant software such as MySQL, Hadoop, or MongoDB

Full Job Description

VoiceBase is a rapidly growing, second generation Customer Experience Platform that provides fast, easy, flexible analytics for phone calls and ALL customer interactions within today’s data-driven enterprises. We help enterprises make better decisions by using Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, and Artificial Intelligence to predict customer behavior. We operate at scale, provide enterprise grade security, and are PCI certified. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies, call centers, and voice application developers.

We need an experienced JavaScript developer who is proficient with React.js. You will be developing UI components, implementing and executing them following well-known Redux workflows, and ensuring that these components and the overall application are robust and easy to manage. A commitment to collaborative problem-solving, balanced design when it comes to features and usability, and quality products are important.

You will be a core member of the Software Development Team and report to the Director of Analytics.

This position is unable to provide Visa sponsorship and is remote anywhere in the US.

job.title: Lead Technical Program Manager
job.body:
Classy's Product Technology team is hiring a Senior Technical Program Manager that will join one of our agile scrum development teams, and be responsible for scoping and delivering platform service layers for the Classy Online Fundraising Platform. The ideal candidate is very experienced in running complex projects with multiple dependencies and aggressive timelines. You will identify bottlenecks, escalate issues and bring a mature risk management process to the team. You are expected to be versatile and able to thrive in a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment. You are not hindered by managing competing priorities and are able to bring order to ambiguous scenarios. You will be data-driven and analytical. You can clearly & effectively communicate (written as well as verbally) across the org and up to senior leadership. We want to talk to you if you have a strong desire to be part of a team that is highly collaborative and focuses on delivering high quality software on-time.


What you'll accomplish:

  • Work with other program and product managers to identify risks and opportunities across multiple projects within the department
  • Strategize, implement, and maintain program initiatives that adhere to organizational objectives
  • Work closely with pod leads, cross-functional teams, and assigned project managers to plan and develop scope, deliverables, required resources, work plan, and timing for new initiatives
  • Analyze, evaluate, and overcome program risks, and produce program reports for management and stakeholders
  • Participate in continual product improvement efforts and work with team members to implement best practices and procedures to ensure we are always learning
  • Work with limited supervision, and take ownership of projects to achieve schedule, financial, and technical goals as assigned

What you bring (Required):

  • Bachelor's degree in software engineering or related field
  • 3+ years in a technical leadership or program management role
  • Certifications such as Scrummaster and/or PMP
  • Exceptional leadership, time management, facilitation, and organizational skills

  • Outstanding working knowledge of change management principles and performance evaluation processes
  • Experience working on technical projects delivered within cost and on-time as part of a software product development team
  • Strong interpersonal skills and professional demeanor
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills
  • Effective team player with high level of customer empathy - must want to be part of the team and do right by those who choose to use our software platform

What would be awesome to have (preferred):

  • Bachelor's degree in an engineering discipline or Technical School for Programming with 3-5 years experience
  • Experience in computer programming skills (e.g., Java, Go, Node.JS, JavaScript)
  • Experience working with SaaS applications deployed to AWS
  • Strong analytical and trouble-shooting skills
  • Nonprofit or online fundraising experience and/or Payment Processing experience

Our amazing perks!

  • Unlimited PTO
  • 10 half-day Fridays a year
  • 20 hours paid volunteer time off
  • Monthly parking pass, public transit pass, or rideshare allowance
  • Supplemental Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance, available day one
  • 401(k) plan
  • Dog friendly office
  • Fitness membership discounts
  • Love the active life? We have company and team outings and participate in team sports
  • Monthly employee development courses
  • New expansive office in downtown San Diego overlooking Petco Park baseball stadium and the ocean

About Classy

Classy is a social enterprise that creates world-class online fundraising software for nonprofits, modernizing the giving experience to accelerate social impact around the world. Recognized as one of the most valuable tech startups in San Diego, Classy is trusted by organizations of all sizes, from the fastest-growing nonprofits like Team Rubicon and The Trevor Project, to some of the world's largest social organizations, such as The Salvation Army, Robin Hood Foundation, and Shriners Hospitals for Children. Working for Classy means you're an integral part of our mission—to mobilize and empower the world for good—and our unique culture. You'll learn, contribute to amazing customer experiences, and flourish alongside colleagues who are determined to make a lasting social impact. For more information, visit www.classy.org or follow Classy on Twitter @Classy.


Dedication to Diversity

Classy is working toward building a more diverse and inclusive environment that is representative of individuals of all backgrounds, experiences, and lifestyles, allowing all employees to feel comfortable being their true, authentic selves in a space that enables productivity and meaningful work.

UX/UI Software Engineer-Front End (JoinOCI-SDE)-200014F1

Preferred Qualifications

Cloud Engineering Infrastructure Development

At Oracle Cloud Infrastructure (OCI), we build the future of the cloud for Enterprises as a diverse team of fellow creators and inventors. We act with the speed and attitude of a start-up, with the scale and customer-focus of the leading enterprise software company in the world.

Values are OCI’s foundation and how we deliver excellence. We strive for equity, inclusion, and respect for all. We are committed to the greater good in our products and our actions. We are constantly learning and taking opportunities to grow our careers and ourselves. We challenge each other to stretch beyond our past to build our future.

You are the builder here. You will be part of a team of really smart, motivated, and diverse people and given the autonomy and support to do your best work. It is a dynamic and flexible workplace where you’ll belong and be encouraged.

Oracle's Cloud Infrastructure team is expanding its efforts to make our Virtual Networking services easier to use. Our customers run their businesses on our cloud, and our mission is to provide them with best-in-class compute, storage, networking, database, security, and an ever-expanding set of foundational cloud-based services.

The ideal candidate will be passionate, self-motivated, able to multitask effectively, and have strong communication skills. This individual will be fairly autonomous and be expected to contribute to a wide range of high-impact projects across the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure console. Daily tasks include UI development, testing, CI/CD, participating in scrum activities, and integrate with User Experience, Product, Support and Project Management, and Service Teams.

Desired Qualifications:

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related fields or equivalent experience
  • 1+ years of experience in UI development
  • Experience with Javascript, ReactJS, Webpack, CSS
  • Experience interfacing with JSON REST APIs
  • Experience with Typescript, Node.js/npm, Enzyme, Jest
  • Experience with container-based deployment (e.g. Docker)
  • Familiarity with designing and implementing form-factor independent UI
  • Working experience within a Linux-based environment

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with continuous deployment tools (e.g. Teamcity, Jenkins)
  • Experience with source control (GIT, Maven, SVN)
  • Ability to design and implement UI components that provide an intuitive and seamless customer experience
  • Ability to translate wireframes into prototypes and production-ready interfaces
  • Ability to quickly pick up new languages and technologies
  • Experience with Agile Methodologies, specifically Scrum
  • Self-driven, able to work independently on a project even while the design is evolving
  • Strong desire to stay on top of new technologies and services

Design, develop, troubleshoot and debug software programs for databases, applications, tools, networks etc.
