job.title: Principal Software Engineer
job.body:
Job Description

Principal Development Engineer - Voice Application


Who is Genesys?

Every year, Genesys® delivers more than 70 billion remarkable customer experiences for organizations in over 100 countries. Through the power of the cloud and AI, our technology connects every customer moment across marketing, sales and service on any channel, while also improving employee experiences. Genesys pioneered Experience as a ServiceSM so organizations of any size can provide true personalization at scale, interact with empathy, and foster customer trust and loyalty.


Why Genesys needs you

We are investing 1 billion dollars in R&D over the next 4 years and need the right individuals to turn that investment into innovation. Genesys is bringing that innovation to customers through multi-cloud deployments in AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud.


Connections matter, at certain times with greater urgency. Whenever the moment, our technology facilitates those connections creating experience as a service. Our team members own their critical services and words like scalability, resiliency, and automation are at the heart of every line of code we write.


What you’ll do

Genesys Application Development team is responsible for the design, implementation and delivery of robust and scalable Genesys solution on a Multicloud platform. You will be working on Architecture, Design, Development, Testing and Delivery of Genesys Engage Cloud Application services. Contributing to the development and maintenance of automated delivery pipeline of Genesys Voice microservices in Pure Engage Cloud.

  • Creating and evolving SIP based voice microservices.
  • Evolving core SIP communication server.
  • Implementing REST APIs.
  • Creating and enhancing monitoring metrics, alerts and dashboards.
  • Design, implementation and testing of Genesys voice components and APIs.
  • Service deployment and troubleshooting.
  • Collaboration with cross functional teams (engineering, QA, customer care, operations and NOC) to achieve reliability and quality of developed functionality and establish robust service delivery process and efficient issue resolution process.

Who you are

  • Bachelor or master’s degree in Technical/Computer Science or Engineering Knowledge of SIP communication protocol and standards
  • Previous experience developing SIP-based communication systems
  • Knowledge of programming languages (C++, JavaScript)
  • 5+ years of relevant experience.
  • Knowledge of Node.js is a plus
  • Knowledge of Redis/Kafka is a plus
  • Knowledge of Kubernetes is a plus
  • Knowledge of AWS/Azure is a plus
  • Knowledge of Prometheus/Grafana is a plus
  • Previous experience with WebRTC is a plus
  • Previous experience with Genesys solutions and products is a plus
  • Knowledge of scripting programming languages (Python/bash)
  • Familiarity with development and troubleshooting software on Linux and Windows Server
  • Excellent communication skills

Genesys is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.


About Us:

Genesys® powers more than 25 billion of the world’s best customer experiences each year. We put the customer at the center of everything we do and passionately believe that great customer engagement drives great business outcomes. More than 10,000 companies in more than 100 countries trust the industry’s #1 customer experience platform to orchestrate omnichannel customer journeys that eliminate silos and build lasting relationships. With a strong track record of innovation and a never-ending desire to be first, Genesys is the only company recognized by top industry analysts as a leader in both cloud and on-premise customer engagement solutions. Connect with Genesys via www.genesys.com, Twitter, Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn, and the Genesys blog.

job.body:
Software Engineer Front End

<br>

Job Description

<br>

CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry. We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.

As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.

We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).

Ten-X is the leading end-to-end transaction platform for commercial real estate, powering more than 90% of online CRE sales. Our platform empowers brokers, sellers and buyers with data-driven technology and comprehensive marketing tools to expand market visibility and decrease time to close.

As a Software Engineer you will design, develop, and troubleshoot software applications for existing and new products that drive Ten-X’s internal site and client facing external site and mobile products. Experience with a wide range of technologies, from scripting languages to server configuration and management, to architecting scalable infrastructures, as well as being comfortable working in an agile, collaborative, fast-paced environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design, develop and support high traffic, real-time enterprise applications

  • Collaborate with all business partners to design and define our class-leading products

  • Implement product features and refine specifications

  • Continuously improve working processes, code quality, and tool and technology adoption

  • Provide mentoring and guidance to other team members when needed

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree coupled with 2+ years’ experience; OR a HS diploma (or equivalent) coupled with 6+ years’ experience

  • 2+ years of production development with modern ReactJS / NodeJS /JavaScript

  • 1+ years’ experience in unit testing with MochaJS, JEST or Jasmine

  • Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations

job.title: Sr. Network Engineer (F5, ASA, and Palo Alto) - TS/SCI required
job.body:
Travel Required: Less than 10%
Public Trust: None
Requisition Type: Regular

GDIT is seeking candidates to support the US Army Intelligence and Security Command (INSCOM). Under the I2TS3 task order INSCOM ensures reliable, uninterrupted availability of Command, Control, Communications, Computers, and Information Management (C4IM) including: networks, hardware, software, engineering, and specialized tools at the point of customer need to support INSCOM's mission. INSCOM and its MSCs provide the enabling layer to connect the Army and its tactical formations to defense and national intelligence agencies via tactical networks. The ability to provide mission critical intelligence is dependent on the successful use of its information technology (IT) networks worldwide.

Job Description

The F5 engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration and maintenance of the F5 BIG IP infrastructure supporting the INSCOM network.

Responsibilities:

  • Serve as a subject matter expert in supporting F5 load balancers with Big-IP LTM, DNS, AFM, APM and ASM
  • Perform daily operational tasks submitted by customers through ticket system
  • Prepare network or infrastructure Visio topology diagrams, write Standard Operating Procedures, maintenance plans and provide status reports as required, participate in data calls and other operational and maintenance tasks
  • Troubleshoot network problems, network device configurations and coordinate with various department administrators to facilitate connectivity issue resolution
  • Design technical solutions
  • Participate in the development and support of GISA and INSCOM technical requirements
  • Champion a collaborative, team-based environment, sharing standard methodologies and success and building positive relationships
  • Can deliver technical presentations to include whiteboards at CxO level through to detailed technical staff.
  • System administrator skills with UNIX, Microsoft or application knowledge
  • Proven grasp of LAN and WAN networking protocols and technologies, including switching, routing, and security (e.g., Layer 4-7, firewall, DDoS, etc)
  • Industry and F5 Networks-targeted technologies i.e. Application Delivery Control, Application Access Control, SSL intercept/inspection, and Web Application Firewall Security.
  • Various scripting and programming languages and operating systems (tcl, python, Assembly, C, Javascript, Node.js, Linux OS, etc.)

Qualifications

Requires 5+ years overall IT experience working in a large enterprise environment with the internal processes of a federal governmental structure and its mandates

  • Excellent attention to detail
  • Excellent communications skills and ability to interact with clients
  • Experience with Cisco network technologies
  • Significant experience with supporting and maintaining F5 Big-IP load balancers to include set-up, maintenance, upgrades and replacement of the latest generation of F5s
  • Extensive experience with Big-IP LTM and ASM modules in a large shared environment
  • Demonstrate an ability to craft and understand iRules
  • Experience with TCPDump, Wireshark and analyzing network traffic
  • Demonstrate a solid understanding of the OSI and TCP/IP network models and provide examples
  • Experience working in a large SDLC environment
  • Experience analyzing security impacts and risks to websites, explain crafting ASM policies with examples.
  • Experience in custom SSL, ciphers, and LTM traffic performance optimization
  • Experience with supporting and maintaining wireless networks
  • Intermediate knowledge of networking and systems administration; and the ability to troubleshoot problems

Certification(s):

  • IAT II 8570 Baseline Certification - Sec+CE or equivalent
  • One of the following Computing Environment Certifications:
    • F5 Certified Solution Expert

Clearance:

  • TS/SCI

High School Diploma/GED with 10 years of related experience, or Associate’s Degree with 8 years of experience, or Bachelor’s Degree with 6 years of experience, or Master’s Degree with 4 years of experience

We are GDIT. The people supporting some of the most complex government, defense, and intelligence projects across the country. We deliver. Bringing the expertise needed to understand and advance critical missions. We transform. Shifting the ways clients invest in, integrate, and innovate technology solutions. We ensure today is safe and tomorrow is smarter. We are there. On the ground, beside our clients, in the lab, and everywhere in between. Offering the technology transformations, strategy, and mission services needed to get the job done.

GDIT is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

As a digitally-focused management consultancy, we do more than strategy. From strategy and design to architecture and development, we deploy senior, cross-functional teams to work hip-to-hip in the trenches with client teams.

Who we are

Trilogy Education Services, a 2U, Inc. brand, partners with the world's leading universities to help companies bridge the digital skills gap. We work with experienced instructors, innovative employers, and top institutions to power boot camps that prepare today's workers for tomorrow's jobs.

Our programs have been in existence since October 2015, and since that first class, we've launched an additional 300 classes with 50+ university partnerships.

Job description

Are you an experienced UX/UI designer who is passionate about education and making an impact? Do you love empowering others to find life-changing opportunities? Then this may be the position for you!

We believe learning a new skill, like UX/UI design, should be exciting and engaging — and that starts with the instructor. You'll notice that prior teaching experience isn't a prerequisite to being an Instructor. If you bring knowledge, strong communication, and a positive energy to the classroom, you're going to help students along their transformative path to a successful and rewarding career. We'll provide the training, lesson plans, and tools to support you on your journey of impacting lives in the classroom.

Nuspire is a leading managed security services provider (MSSP) founded over 20 years ago to revolutionize the cybersecurity experience by taking an optimistic and people-first approach. Our deep bench of cybersecurity experts use world-class threat intelligence and 24x7 security operations centers (SOCs) to detect, respond and remediate advanced cyber threats.

Position Description:

Nuspire is in the beginning stages of designing an exciting new modern security posture framework. We are currently seeking Full Stack Developers experienced at designing and implementing frontend and backend solutions within a cloud native environment. You will have had varied experience across multiple languages and frameworks. The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for the end-to-end life cycle of feature development, testing, and deployment.

job.title: Senior Front End Engineer
job.body:
Senior Front End Engineer

<br>

Job Description

<br>

CoStar Group is the world’s leading provider of information and marketing solutions for the Commercial Real Estate industry. We are a NASDAQ listed company with a market cap of over US$30B and sit alongside other notable names such as Amazon, Facebook, Google and Apple.

As a technology company, we are the trusted partner for all commercial real estate professionals empowering many of the most well-respected landlords, development companies, brokerage firms, banks, lenders, investors and government agencies.

We do this by actively researching the commercial real estate markets and providing data, analytics, innovative tools and powerful marketing platforms in the U.S. and Internationally to help our clients transact with one another. CoStar continues to win multiple awards including one of Forbes most innovative companies (2017) and Fortune’s fastest growing companies (2018).

Ten-X is the leading end-to-end transaction platform for commercial real estate, powering more than 90% of online CRE sales. Our platform empowers brokers, sellers and buyers with data-driven technology and comprehensive marketing tools to expand market visibility and decrease time to close.

As a Senior Front End Software Engineer you will design, develop, and troubleshoot software applications for existing and new products that drive Ten-X’s internal site and client facing external site and mobile products. Experience with a wide range of technologies, from scripting languages to server configuration and management, to architecting scalable infrastructures, as well as being comfortable working in an agile, collaborative, fast-paced environment.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Design, develop and support high traffic, real-time enterprise applications

  • Collaborate with all business partners to design and define our class-leading products

  • Implement product features and refine specifications

  • Continuously improve working processes, code quality, and tool and technology adoption

  • Provide mentoring and guidance to other team members when needed

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

  • Bachelor’s degree coupled with 3+ years experience; OR a HS diploma (or equivalent) coupled with 7+ years’ experience

  • 3+ years of production development with modern ReactJS / NodeJS /JavaScript

  • 2+ years’ experience in unit testing with MochaJS, JEST or Jasmine

  • Expertise with software development best practices, including standards, code reviews, source control, builds, testing and operations

  • Experience building front end frameworks using modern bundlers

  • Should be comfortable converting mocks into high quality HTML/CSS

  • Experience with responsive web design, media queries and delivering functionality that works with range of client devices/browsers from desktops and laptops to mobile platforms.

  • Experience with UI design patterns, security, performance and usability.

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

  • Deep understanding of OO patterns and principles

  • Experience with Spring Boot, SocketIO, Elastic Search, MongoDB, Kafka is a plus

  • Experience with Microservices

  • Experience with application integration between multiple large-scale system

  • iOS mobile app development

  • Experience in Agile environment

  • Hands on experience with AWS, Kubernetes and Docker

WHATS IN IT FOR YOU:

Working at CoStar Group means you'll enjoy a culture of collaboration and innovation that attracts the best and brightest across a broad range of disciplines. In addition to generous compensation and performance-based incentives, you'll be supported in both your professional and academic growth with internal training, tuition reimbursement, and an inter-office exchange program.

Our benefits package includes (but is not limited to):

  • Comprehensive healthcare coverage: Medical / Vision / Dental / Prescription Drug

  • Life, legal, and supplementary insurance

  • Commuter and parking benefits

  • 401(K) retirement plan with matching contributions

  • Employee stock purchase plan

  • Paid time off

  • Tuition reimbursement

  • On-site fitness center and/or reimbursed fitness center membership costs (location dependent), with yoga studio, Pelotons, personal training, group exercise classes, as well as Segways and bikes available for use during the day

  • Complimentary gourmet coffee, tea, hot chocolate, prepared foods, fresh fruit, and other healthy snacks

Be part of a team of professionals enjoying the opportunity to learn, do, and grow in a rewarding atmosphere. But don't just take our word for it - see why our team chose to work at and stay at CoStar Group:

job.title: SEO Senior Specialist
job.body:
Company Description:

Merkle is a leading data-driven, technology-enabled, global performance marketing agency that specializes in the delivery of unique, personalized customer experiences across platforms and devices. For more than 30 years, Fortune 1000 companies and leading nonprofit organizations have partnered with Merkle to maximize the value of their customer portfolios. The agency’s heritage in data, technology, and analytics forms the foundation for its unmatched skills in understanding consumer insights that drive people-based marketing strategies. Its combined strengths in performance media, customer experience, customer relationship management, loyalty, and enterprise marketing technology drive improved marketing results and competitive advantage. With 9,600+ employees, Merkle is headquartered in Columbia, Maryland, with 50+ additional offices throughout the US, EMEA, and APAC. In 2016, the agency joined dentsu. For more information, contact Merkle at 1-877-9-Merkle or visit www.merkleinc.com.

Job Description:

The SEO Senior Specialist will be responsible for various internet marketing activities, including organic search campaign development, search engine optimization, on-page optimization, and performance analysis and reporting. They must possess exceptional hands-on technical SEO knowledge, as well as client communication skills. SEO Senior Specialists must have superior analytical, problem-solving, organizational and time management skills as they will be expected to work on multiple projects simultaneously under strict timelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • Set and execute SEO strategies to improve a website’s organic rankings to grow site traffic
  • On-site optimization of on-page elements, appropriate use of redirects, identify areas of opportunity to improve internal linking structures, website copy optimizations, review and validate the effective use sitemaps
  • Conduct keyword research to identify keyword and content gaps for brands and provide detailed recommendations to increase visibility within search engines to drive relevant traffic to a client’s website
  • Analyze and compile relevant data across various reporting platforms to measure the effectiveness of SEO efforts and provide performance insights on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis
  • Work with a team to develop and execute site migration strategies for complex websites
  • Keep abreast of the latest SEO tools and techniques and communicate learnings across internal teams and client stakeholders to create awareness and buy-in
  • Skilled in creating and delivering competitive insights and strategies to facilitate growth for our clients
  • Collaborate with different teams, such as website developers, web analytics, content, UI design, and branding/PR teams on the execution of projects
  • Provide SEO analysis and recommendations on the structure of sites and pages to improve visibility and signaling to search engines
Qualifications:
  • 1-2+ years of Search Engine Optimization experience and an eagerness to learn
  • Excellent time management and communication skills required
  • Tactical/Technical implementation experience working with complicated websites
  • In-depth knowledge of various website analytics platforms and the use Google Search Console to identify and troubleshoot issues on an ongoing basis
  • Experience and understanding of the effective use of technical SEO tools such as Botify, Screaming Frog, Ahrefs and Lighthouse to identify issues and opportunities
  • Experience and understanding of the effective use of keyword reporting platforms such as SEMRush, Brighedge and Conductor to identify issues and opportunities
  • Core understanding of JavaScript, HTML and CSS
  • Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Business or other related field preferred
Additional Information:

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Merkle fosters a diverse environment that encourages original thinking about our business and empowers us to communicate with a global world of customers. We embrace differences of opinion and diversity of thought as they help us challenge and refine our solutions. Merkle, as a best-in-class marketing agency, welcomes big ideas, and believes they can come from anywhere.


More Information:

Our Culture: Merkle’s energy and personality lives through everything we say and do. Learn all about what defines our people and our vibe.

Students & Recent Graduates: Start your career at Merkle and get on the path to success.

Experienced Hires: Leverage your expertise, challenge the status quo and grow your career at Merkle.

job.title: Software Engineer, Node.js
job.body:
About Starry:

Starry is proud to be an Equal Opportunity workplace. Just like the internet service we provide, we do not discriminate. We welcome people from all over the world to share their knowledge and perspectives. At Starry, you can discover the many careers and opportunities that are made possible when you connect people to the limitless possibilities of the internet.

Our mission focuses on two things. First, we're making the experience of accessing the internet simple, transparent, and delightful. Second, we're bringing that experience to underserved communities around the world. We approach our mission with a cutting-edge wireless technology, customer service designed to delight, and a culture of innovation and intellectual curiosity.

What you'll do:

As a full-time JavaScript Engineer on the Cloud Services team, you would be responsible for the development of RESTful web services via Node.js, in addition to building diverse distributed networking applications, development tools, internal applications, and third-party API integrations.

  • Develop Node.js applications (REST, HTTPS, TCP, UDP)
  • Implement and maintain test suites (100% coverage is always the objective)
  • Collaborate on data architecture and implementations using MongoDB, Redis, Elasticsearch, and other NoSQL databases
  • Participate in an Agile environment, providing leadership through example

What we're looking for:

  • Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent professional experience
  • Demonstrated understanding of the JavaScript language and specification
  • 2 years minimum professional experience using the core platform APIs in Node.js to build distributed production applications
  • Link to Active Github account with relevant JavaScript/Node.js work included on the resume
  • Working knowledge of TCP, UDP, and other networking protocols
  • 1 year minimum experience with git and Github
  • TDD experience preferred
  • Proficiency in HTML and CSS a plus
We work hard, so we take care of each other and try to enjoy ourselves along the way.
All full time Starry employees receive:
  • 100% employer paid low deductible health plan, dental plan, vision plan, AD&D and life insurance
  • 401(k) retirement plan and stock options
  • 12 weeks of 100% paid parental leave for new mothers and fathers after one year of employment
  • Professional development assistance after six months of employment
  • Catered meals on a weekly basis for employees working in the office
  • Casual dress, community clubs, annual fitness reimbursement, stocked kitchen and other perks and discounts

Happy Interneting!

Qualified Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States. Qualified Applicants will not require employer sponsored work authorization now or in the future for employment in the United States.

Disclaimer: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee.

job.title: Full Stack Software Engineer
job.body:
Finder is thrilled to be back in growth mode! Our business model has proven itself to be agile, resilient, and a genuine value-add to our readers, which means we're full-steam ahead towards growing our business and our audience. That's where you come in!

The Role

Finder is one of America's fastest-growing comparison sites, with a global presence and headquarters in Sydney, Australia. Our readers can compare over 100 categories with Finder.

We're looking for an experienced Full Stack Software Engineer to join our team. This role will be working with leading edge technology with a headless, block-based, dynamic CMS. You will be joining a team of extremely talented and world class software engineers. Working closely with the product management, design and engineering teams, you will design, assemble and deliver new technology and products that grow finder's capabilities and continue to grow the commercial interests of the company.

The bar for success in this role is high, but you will gain valuable experience, coaching and mentoring to achieve success - we set our crew up to succeed! This role is for you if you are:

  • Comfortable working an engineering outcome from inception through to delivery including deployment and successful operation in a production environment.
  • At home across the technology stack - top to bottom, from the user interface through the messaging, service and data tiers as well as monitoring, working with and tuning the deployment in production if required.
  • A collaborative team players with a positive outlook and strong communication skills who excels in dynamic environments.

Main Responsibilities:

  • Guide projects and deliver on deadlines with a cross-functional team
  • Deliver on time and at a high standard of quality
  • Identify, improve and automate processes and workflows
  • Championing and embodying great software engineering principles to deliver a better experience for our users and an engaging technology-led engineering environment
  • Problem-solving skills and the ability to create solutions
  • Work either autonomously or with other members of the team to deliver outcomes

Essential Requirements:

  • Experience working with a cross-disciplinary team of Software Engineers, Product Managers and Designers based remotely in different time zones
  • 3+ years experience in software engineering (or equivalent)
  • Experience with Agile development methodologies
  • Experience and ability to perform DevOps work when required including monitoring, alerting and support
  • Software and Systems Architecture and solution design
  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment and Continuous Delivery practices
  • Ability and desire to work across the stack to deliver an outcome, including working with node.js, JavaScript, PHP, React, MySQL, Akka and Docker (experience in some but not all is not required)

Nice to have (but not essential):

  • Experience with message queues, event processing and event sourcing
  • Effective branching and merging techniques such as GitFlow and Trunk-Based Development
  • App design
  • High performance, low latency computing
  • Massive Use, Global Scale platforms
  • Financial Regulation in Australia, the USA and/or Europe
  • Security concepts and certification experience including SOC-2, PCI or ISO27001

Application process:

If this sounds like the opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Finder is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital or disability status.

job.title: Staff Full-Stack Engineer, Anti-Evil
job.body:
"The front page of the internet," Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousands of communities. Come for the cats, stay for the empathy.

As a Reddit Staff Full-Stack Engineer, you will create healthy and happy experiences for hundreds of millions of users around the world using Reddit on their phones, computers, and even scripts/bots. This is a unique opportunity to leave your mark on one of the most influential and trafficked corners of the internet. Anti-Evil's Consumer Safety team at Reddit is on a mission to empower redditors to define and enforce safety standards for their communities and personal experiences.

You'll own the full-stack development for one or more projects and tackle tough design and product problems alongside other world-class engineers. This role calls for strong collaboration with product managers, UX designer, iOS engineer, Android engineer, web frontend engineer, and backend engineer.

Join us and help build the future of Reddit!

Responsibilities:

  • Build a world-class user experience.
  • Design engineering architecture for feature systems spanning web/app frontends, APIs, microservices, and databases.
  • Contribute to backend and API services.

job.title: Web Developer (Remote)
job.body:
Love music? Come sit with us. At our core, we help creative people make better music with cutting edge technology.

Output is seeking a Web Developer to join the Web Development Team to play an active role in the creation, execution, management and maintenance of Output's various web properties and services. The Web Developer will work closely with nearly every department including marketing, product, operations, and design, ensuring each department's needs are met on Output.com. A successful candidate must be self-motivated, detail-orientated, technically savvy, and energized to research and learn new technologies that may benefit Output's web practices.

Responsibilities

  • Build web pages in WordPress and other platforms.

  • Take ownership of projects/features as they arise.

  • Work alongside the design team to build and edit web pages.

  • Work alongside the marketing team to edit and consult on web-related work.

  • Work with web development to plan and execute revisions to the company's sites.

  • Ensure company site is fully functional at all times and quickly fix issues.

  • Follow the instructions of senior web development staff.


Requirements

  • Fluency in PHP, JS, Sass/CSS, RESTful API integration.

  • Professional experience with WordPress themes & plugins, WooCommerce, Gutenberg blocks.

  • Experience in building functional front-facing webpages, with a keen eye for design/details and SEO best practices.

  • Experience reading design documents (PSD, Zeplin, Sketch, etc.) and extracting assets.

  • Proficiency with front-end coding and debugging. Understands and applies principles of page optimization, such as media queries, asynchronous loading, and caching.

  • Strong understanding of ES6, jQuery, HTML5, CSS3, AJAX, CSS frameworks (eg Bootstrap), version control (Git/Github).

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.

Output has made a name for itself as one of the fastest growing, creative, and influential music-making software companies in the world. The likes of Kendrick Lamar, Bjork, Rihanna, James Blake, Imagine Dragons, Justin Timberlake, Nine Inch Nails and many more use our software to write music as well as hit shows and films like Stranger Things, Game of Thrones, and Black Panther.

We are a strong group of like-minded music makers and music lovers sharing the common goal of helping music makers around the world be creative. We're bonded by music. We're motivated by challenging and fulfilling work. And we always do it while having fun.

We are currently working remotely and will continue to do so until it is safe to return to our office in Los Angeles. Once we are able to return it will be on a voluntary basis. We have successfully launched new products, achieved record sales, and continue to thrive as a team working from home. This has opened us up to hiring permanent remote positions around the country. Our culture has always valued our employee's work-life balance and we offer 5 weeks of PTO, excellent health care, and a community of music enthusiasts- with access to our music studios (once it is safe to return).

job.title: Software Engineer
job.body:
AgentSync is built on the Salesforce platform, effectively leveraging every aspect of the current platform and pushing the edges of what is possible within the ecosystem. We treasure stability, scalability, and customer experience as first-order principles, striving to create thoughtful, delightful user interfaces and seamless workflows. Behind the scenes, we build secure, scaled integrations into licensing database sources of truth (e.g. NIPR, FINRA), obscuring the complexity of licensing data through translation into an understandable, reportable data model.

As a software engineer on the team, you will help drive our transition onto a scalable, secure stack built outside the Salesforce ecosystem. You'll be a thought partner and innovation driver, participating in the overall design of this new infrastructure and the products we will be building against it.

You are motivated by:

  • Tackling greenfield problems and operating against ambiguous problem statements
  • Learning the complexity of a new surface area and reimagining the experience on behalf of users
  • Working on products with real impact that fundamentally transform how users access data and manage their day-to-day processes
  • Bringing best practices around development and delivery to a growing and evolving team

We are looking for:

  • A strong track record of problem solving and a 'roll up your sleeves' mentality
  • A strong technical background with 5+ years of experience building product
  • A passion for the user experience, from how best to structure an API to serve a user need through to input on the UI
  • A systems mindset that considers the edge cases, failure modes, and life cycle of a build
  • The ability to write quality code in a programming language (e.g. Python, Java, JavaScript)
  • Front-end experience using frameworks such as React or Vue
  • Experience designing and deploying services on AWS using Terraform, Ansible, or CloudFormation
  • A background in computer science, engineering, or relevant work experience
  • The desire to work on a collaborative, learning oriented team from a diverse set of backgrounds

About us

Launched in 2018, kea is changing the way restaurants operate. We raised an $11M Series A in August and we're building an amazing team to drive the world's restaurant commerce. We've experienced 1000% year-over-year revenue growth, and plan to continue that trend by providing even more value for our customers through our technology. There are tens of thousands of restaurants out there that need kea, and we're building for them.

About the Role

kea is looking for an experienced product engineer to join our team to build enterprise software using Node.js. In this role, you'll be the tech lead for our full-stack work. This involves partnering with both product and backend engineering to drive two of our most important products: an enterprise portal for restaurant owners to interact with their AI and a platform for integrating with restaurant backend systems.

You'll be responsible for translating product and design documents into working products, making long-term technical and architecture decisions, and setting up the organization for future product engineers. We are a young and small startup, most work will be greenfield.

What your day-to-day looks like

  • Prototype and architect frontend applications, design reusable components, and develop best practices for product engineering
  • Collaborate with the product managers, product designers, and engineering leads to develop product engineering specs
  • Collaborate with engineering leads to ensure that platform apis will provide the necessary services to the product interfaces.
  • Iterate on the software development process: how do we code, test, review, and deploy our products more optimally

What Sets You Up For Success

  • 5+ years of full-stack engineering experience
  • Experience with modern Frontend JS frameworks (Node.js, Angular, React, etc.)
  • Experience with multiple modern application server programming languages (Python, Java, Javascript, etc.)
  • Strong opinions on frontend and full-stack engineering, weakly held
  • A degree in Computer Science, a related engineering field, or equivalent experience.

What we offer

  • Generous stock option plan
  • Full healthcare coverage
  • Flexible time off
  • Ownership, responsibility, and empowerment in what you do
  • Incredible teammates and a caring workplace culture

We are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We welcome candidates of all backgrounds to apply and look forward to meeting you!

job.title: Senior Full Stack Engineer (Strategy)
job.body:
Storj Overview


Storj Labs Inc. is pioneering decentralized cloud storage with the world's first decentralized cloud storage network, Tardigrade. We make object storage secure, resilient, and more affordable than other leading cloud storage providers. Our mission is to enable the decentralized future, and our vision is to be the storage layer for the decentralized internet. Accomplishing this goal means building a team equipped and empowered to propel us forward.


Storj is headquartered in Atlanta and has team members around the globe. As a remote-first company, we’ve built a culture based on transparency, inclusion, and open communication. Storj hosts regularly scheduled week-long gatherings (optional in-person when travel is safe) for collaborative work and team building.


Our people are our most important asset. We strive to provide them with meaningful professional engagement and generous benefits. Storj promotes empowerment and progress through company-wide and individualized training opportunities, proactive diversity efforts, and peer mentorship. Our comprehensive employee benefits include generous healthcare and insurance coverage, FSA and transportation reimbursement plans, a 401(k) plan, competitive equity, unlimited PTO, and six-weeks paid parental leave.


Storj is looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer to join our Strategy team. Core responsibilities include high-scale experimental web app development (e.x. Gitback.org), product testing, and VIP customer support. You will be working closely with the Founder and Chief Strategy Officer in these development and testing phases. We’re a small team and are looking for someone who can take ownership, be collaborative, and help push our team forward to exceed our goals.


Responsibilities:


  • Design, develop, and deploy features for Storj’s Strategy team web apps
  • Assist in the development of front-end interfaces from Figma mockups using Vue.js
  • Assist in back-end development of web apps and experiments using Go, REST APIs, SQL, etc.
  • Assist VIP customers and partners with integrations and support

Must-Have:


  • Experience in JavaScript, CSS, HTML5, Node.js, and Git

job.title: Senior UX Designer — Marketing Tech
job.body:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Department: Design Tech

In Design Tech, we think comfort zones are the enemy of creativity. A dynamic team of designers, engineers, researchers, our team blends beauty with tech to create a world-class product interface for our exchange. We are inspired by design, fueled by data, and obsessed with the user, both retail and institution.

The Role: Senior UX Designer — Marketing Tech

At Gemini, UX designers are responsible for designing best in class solutions that meet customer and business needs. Designers work closely with product managers, engineers, stakeholders and other designers on products and features for the Gemini ecosystem. UX designers create flows, wireframes, prototypes and other deliverables to communicate their ideas. They are responsible for seeing projects through from QA to launch.

Our growing design team is looking for a Senior UX Designer to join the Gemini Marketing Tech team. This team is focused on bringing on new customers as well as engaging with current ones. This role will partner with product management and engineering to work on projects related to customer segmentation, engagement and conversion. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record designing in areas like e-commerce, customer conversion, segmentation, and subscriptions.

Responsibilities:

  • Translate business requirements, data, and research into elegant design solutions for complex product problems in an emerging space
  • Create deliverables such as user flows, wireframes, presentations, and prototypes that define the user experience
  • Use existing design patterns to develop final UI solutions
  • Design and conduct qualitative user studies to validate and iterate on ideas
  • Align designs with the larger Gemini ecosystem's design patterns and components
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team that includes engineers, product managers and other designers in order to develop and implement solutions
  • Build consensus through design by focusing conversations, clearly presenting work, and aligning on decisions

Qualifications

  • 3- 5 years experience (relevant education can be factored in)
  • A high quality portfolio of relevant projects that have shipped
  • An in-depth understanding of user-centered design activities including rapid ideation, wireframing, qualitative research, prototyping and, workshop facilitation
  • Comfortable working at different levels of fidelity from sketches to final designs
  • The ability to clearly present and communicate design work
  • Be detailed oriented - you can flesh out edge cases, file bug tickets, provide feedback to developers, etc.
  • Have the ability to self-organize, prioritize and deliver good work on time
  • Strong design sensibility for things like hierarchy, typography, motion, and color
  • Be able to use industry standard tools such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe CC, Google Suite
  • Solid understanding of relevant technologies such HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Swift, iOS, Android.

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:

  • Competitive base salaries across all departments
  • Ownership in the company via profit sharing units
  • Amazing benefits, 401k match contribution, and flexible hours
  • Snacks, Perks, Wellness Outings & Events

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

job.title: Senior Engineering Manager: Frontend
job.body:
Have you ever wondered what happens inside the cloud?

Based in New York, DigitalOcean is a dynamic, high-growth technology company that serves a robust and passionate community of developers, teams, and businesses around the world. We believe that today's entrepreneurs are changing the world through software. Our mission is to empower these entrepreneurs by bringing modern app development within reach for any developer, anywhere in the world.

We want people who are passionate about helping developers build and deploy real world applications.

We are looking for a senior manager to lead our front end development team focused on building incredibly intuitive user interfaces. Reporting to the Director of Engineering, this person will lead a team that works across engineering and other functions to create a frictionless user experience for all of DigitalOcean's offerings.

DigitalOcean is loved by developers for its simplicity. This is an opportunity to lead a team focused on the DigitalOcean cloud UI experience. Consistency, simplicity and speed are all important components of this experience. With a strong brand and experienced engineers partnered with a great design team, you'll have what you need to run high-volume real world experiments that drive business results.

What You'll Be Doing:

  • Leading a team composed of individual contributors and a manager to deliver an amazing user experience for DigitalOcean products
  • Own the management of front end infrastructure work across UI Engineering
  • Develop a vision and roadmap to continue to provide a wonderful UI experience as DigitalOcean and it's product offering grows
  • Driving a high-performance culture within your team that iterates frequently and learns continuously without sacrificing product quality.
  • Setting performance goals for team members; evaluating performance; providing coaching and facilitating professional development.
  • Providing technical leadership - best practices, testing, performance, reliability.
  • Recruiting and hiring world-class engineers.
  • Measuring the software development process to help the team increase deliverability and improve forecasting

What We'll Expect From You:

  • Passion for customers and the products we build for them.
  • Experience managing a high-performing cloud product development team of front end engineers or a mix of front end and back end.
  • Experience managing managers
  • Experience working closely with Product Managers and UX designers.
  • Experience with CI/CD and a 24x7 production environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead positive change; empower people; cultivate product technology visions and innovative solutions.
  • The ability to adapt and handle multiple competing priorities.
  • Excellent verbal and written communications skills with the ability to work closely across teams and manage dependencies.
  • Development experience with CSS, HTML, Javascript, and modern frameworks (React, Ember, etc.).
  • Experience with responsive and accessible app development a plus.

Why You'll Like Working for DigitalOcean:

  • We value development. You will work with some of the smartest and most interesting people in the industry. We are a high-performance organization that is always challenging ourselves to continuously grow. We maintain a growth mindset in everything we do and invest deeply in employee development through formalized mentorship, LinkedIn Learning tracks, and other internal programs. We also provide all employees with reimbursement for relevant conferences, training, and education.
  • We care about your physical, financial and mental well-being. We offer competitive health, dental, and vision benefits for employees and their dependents, a monthly gym reimbursement to support your physical health, and a commute or internet allowance to make your trips to your office or your desk easier. We offer generous parental leave with transition time built-in upon return to work. We offer competitive compensation and a 401k plan with up to a 4% employer match.
  • We support our remote employee experience. While we have great office spaces in NYC, Cambridge and Palo Alto, we're very distributed—we use a number of communication tools to connect across the company—and all remote employees have the opportunity to visit our offices and meet their teams face-to-face at team offsites. We also have an annual company offsite, Shark Week, to get quality in-person time with the entire company at least once a year. We also allow employees to outfit their workstations to meet their needs—whether remote or in office.
  • We value diversity and inclusivity. We are an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.body:
In partnership with ExxonMobil, Synthetic Genomics, Inc. (SGI) is growing algae biofuels to one day power planes, propel ships and fuel trucks—ultimately offering the potential to cut emissions in half. SGI’s research spans from developing genetically engineered algae strains to cultivating acres of energy-rich algae at our state-of-the-art farm in California’s Imperial Valley. At the center of this research is SGI’s Research Informatics Platform, which is responsible for the automated collection and analysis of IoT sensor data and sophisticated laboratory measurements. SGI’s Research Informatics Platform provides a common operating picture that fosters cross team collaborations and provides an increased understanding of the factors driving performance variation across the scales from lab to farm.


To improve automation and reduce time to actionable insights within the Research Informatics Platform, SGI is looking for a Full-Stack Senior Software Engineer to join its development team. We are looking for creative problem solvers with both a passion for innovation and a focus on delivering technical solutions. As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for a variety of software development projects ranging from enhancing and maintaining our Platform’s sensor network and data infrastructure, to extending and integrating scientific applications.


Responsibilities

  • Enhancing and maintaining our sensor network and data infrastructure using Javascript, Node.js Python and AWS cloud technologies
  • Partner with members of the Research informatics team to extend and integrate scientific applications
  • Collaborate with multi-disciplinary team to transform user needs into design inputs and software requirements
  • Use best practices for code development, optimization and unit testing
  • Maintain awareness of industry trends and evaluate applicability of new software technologies
  • Lead technical discussions on complex technologies with the team, and present to
  • Participate in technical discussions with the team, and communicate on complex technologies in cross-disciplinary environment


Qualifications

  • BS in Computer Science or related technology discipline preferred
  • 7+ years of software development experience
  • 2+ years of full-stack web development experience
  • 2+ years of experience with AWS infrastructure capabilities
  • 2+ years of experience with database development


Key Skills

  • Strong back-end development experience with Node.js and Python, RESTful web services, and ORM tools as well as front-end development experience with Javascript frameworks such as Vue.js, React, or Angular, and CSS and HTM with a solid understanding of asynchronous programming.
  • Experience with AWS cloud infrastructure capabilities (Lambda, Kinesis, Web Services, Serverless/Cloudformation)
  • Strong database experience preferred including database design, optimization, as well as ETL implementation
  • Proficient with source control management repositories (such as git) and CI/CD practices
  • Experienced with Linux/Unix command line
  • Passionate about writing readable, reusable, extensible code.
  • Demonstrated success in collaborating in a fast-paced team environment and delivering high-quality software products

job.title: Senior Software Engineer
job.body:
PubNub powers apps that bring people together in realtime for remote work, play, learning, and health. Thousands of companies use PubNub's Realtime Communication Platform and its APIs as the foundation for online chat, live events, geolocation, remote control, and live updates, at massive global scale. Since 2010, PubNub has invested in the tools and global infrastructure required to serve customers like Adobe, DocuSign, Peloton, and RingCentral, delivering SOC 2 Type 2 security and reliability while meeting regulatory needs like HIPAA and GDPR. PubNub has raised over $70M from notable investors like Sapphire, Scale, Relay, Cisco, Bosch, Ericsson, and HPE.

If you like hyper scale systems and engineering projects that redefine limits, PubNub is for you.

PubNub is proud to be an EEO employer.

Responsibilities

We are looking for exceptional C developers to use creative thinking and raw innovation to drive the development of the core aspects of our Pub/Sub network.

As a seasoned engineer you should be able to take complex problems and break them down into smaller parts which other developers could understand. You will work on a number of projects around our core realtime messaging APIs, which drive many of the features we support.

You will:

  • Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable C code
  • Work collaboratively with product management and other stakeholders to drive the architecture and design of various next-gen features of PubNub.
  • Implement performance and quality modules
  • Identify bottlenecks and bugs, and devise solutions to these problems
  • Champion adherence to best-practice development methodologies across the entire team.
  • Facilitate automated testing so teams can innovate at a rapid pace while delivering extremely high quality.
  • Interview, mentor, listen-to, and collaborate with other engineers.

Requirements

Foremost, you should enjoy working collaboratively and you must be comfortable working with a strong team to help grow a fast-paced business.

You will develop secure and scalable microservices from scratch as well as add new functionality to existing services. You will interact closely with Product Management to collaborate on features that will help grow our business and provide customer satisfaction.

Ideally, you understand the problems that come with very high scale and easily understand how the many moving pieces of a distributed system should fit together to provide reliable and maintainable services at scale. You know how to build clean interfaces that operate at low latencies and high throughput, and hide complexity of underlying APIs.

To be specific, a strong candidate should have:

  • Minimum 6 years experience in enterprise grade software
  • Strong proficiency in C, with fairly complete knowledge of the language specification
  • Thorough knowledge of the standard library as specified by ISO and ANSI
  • Experience with event-driven libraries like libevent
  • Good understanding of memory management in non garbage collected environments
  • Knowledge of low-level threading primitives and real-time environments
  • Familiarity with system call wrapper library functions
  • Knowledge of writing native modules for high-level languages such as Node.js, Python, Go, etc.
  • Experience with low-level details of TCP, including tuning at the user and kernel levels.
  • Working knowledge of networking concepts, protocols and security (TCP/IP, UDP, HTTP, DNS, TLS etc)
  • Knowledge of component data sheets and specifications
  • Familiarity with language tools, such as Lint, Valgrind, etc.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration
  • Attention to detail and ability to work independently on complex problems
  • BS or MS in Computer Science or a related technical field
  • Location: West Coast United States is preferred, but open to all US Remote

Bonus Qualifications

  • Past experience in public cloud deployments (e.g. AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.)
  • Experience working with large scale applications and projects
  • Containerization and Orchestration tools and platforms (Kubernetes, Mesos, CloudFoundry, etc.)
  • Previous experience with Test Driven Development with heavy use of unit testing frameworks.
  • Previous start-up or small company experience preferred

job.title: Senior Design Technologist
job.body:
Currently it takes the same amount of time to process an average American mortgage as it does to walk nonstop from Manhattan to San Francisco. Talk about getting your steps in. This is the kind of technology – or lack thereof – that the mortgage industry is dealing with daily. Papercuts are a real concern. We have even heard rumors of fax machines and whiteout. Still no actual dinosaur sightings, but we are ever vigilant.

Ready to roll up your sleeves and help us conquer the last frontier of fintech? At Xpanse, we are working to disrupt an $11 trillion industry. Yep, you read that right - $11 trillion with a "t". If the US mortgage industry was its own sovereign nation, it would be the third largest in the world by GDP.

Suffice to say, we are building to scale. What are we building?

Our SaaS platform will power the mortgage industry and its relationships with the tens of thousands of third-party providers that are integral to the mortgage process. Leveraging automation, real-time intelligence, big data, and analytics we are changing the way borrowers, lenders, servicers, and service providers take care of business.

But disrupting an industry is a team sport, so we are looking for the best and brightest to join us. Our team is growing rapidly in the Greater Seattle Area and looking for Senior Design Technologist to join our team.

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING

  • Rapidly build and iterate on appropriate-fidelity prototypes that express design intent, using the best and most appropriate tools and techniques for the task.
  • Develop functional prototypes to prove and sell concepts to development teams, senior leadership, and partners.
  • Use your technical expertise to bring UX concepts to life across a range of fidelities, from simple click-through prototypes to full-fidelity experience reference applications.
  • When relevant, you will deliver code on the target platform and know when doing so is not necessary or practical.
  • Partner with engineering to ensure that interactive techniques and technologies translate through to shipping products and services.
  • Combine UX Design and engineering expertise into a single discipline, to develop, prototype, and test innovative user experience solutions.
  • Presenting work to peers, product teams and executive leadership.
  • Create solutions that inspire others to invest in new ideas across the Business to Business and Business to Consumer product portfolio.

WHO YOU ARE

  • Well versed in a balanced mix of development and prototyping platforms and tools and will select the best and most appropriate for the task.
  • Understand the strengths and weaknesses of each delivery platform and can identify opportunities and work creatively within the constraints it imposes.
  • Be able to work creatively through and around perceived limitations and/or challenges imposed by the delivery platform to create delightful experiences for customers.
  • You have domain knowledge (or a deep curiosity and motivated interest to learn) in financial services in general and in the mortgage industry in particular is highly valuable, though not required.
  • Have strong front-end proficiency, be a creative problem solver and have a keen eye for good functional design.
  • Feel comfortable reading, writing vanilla JavaScript, extending your own libraries and creating task automation jobs to speed up team development.
  • You are equally passionate about design as you are about technology.
  • Able to handle multiple projects in a fast-paced environment with a high-level of autonomy.

BACKGROUND/SKILLS NEEDED

  • 6+ years' experience as a front-end technologist, engineer or UX prototyper.
  • Excellent written/verbal communication, presentation, interpersonal and analytical skills.
  • Understanding and fluent usage across a broad spectrum of technologies including (but not limited to): JavaScript/NodeJS, HTML/CSS, XML/JSON, and Responsive/Adaptive Design.
  • Understanding of performance and how to mitigate latency issues.
  • Proven ability to simplify and distill complex problems into intuitive and elegant experiences.
  • Ability to participate in the full lifecycle of design and development - including ideation, prototyping, development, backwards compatibility, failovers, validation, and user-testing.
  • Proven front-end development experience across multiple devices, webviews, and browsers.
  • Ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.

Xpanse is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.body:
WHO WE ARE

Kinship, Mars Petcare's newest division, is a hotbed for future innovation, data science and analytics, and at the forefront of emerging technology for pets, pet owners and veterinarians. At Kinship, we move quickly to shape the future of pet care. We are Optimistic, Purposefully Inquisitive, Open to all, and passionate about what's possible. We're a coalition of bright minds, big ideas, and bold businesses united by our love of pets..

Part of Mars, Incorporated, a family-owned business with more than a century of history making diverse products and offering services for people and the pets people love, the 85,000 Associates in Mars Petcare are dedicated to one purpose: A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS. With 75 years of experience, our portfolio of almost 50 brands serves the health and nutrition needs of the world's pets and The WALTHAM Centre for Pet Nutrition has advanced research in the nutrition and health of pets for over 50 years. Mars Petcare is also a leading veterinary health provider through a network of over 2,000 pets. We're also active in innovation and technology for pets, with WISDOM PANEL™ genetic health screening and DNA testing for dogs, the WHISTLE™ GPS dog tracker, and LEAP VENTURE STUDIO accelerator and COMPANION FUND™ programs that drive innovation and disruption in the pet care industry.

A BIT ABOUT OUR TEAM

WISDOM PANEL is the world leader in companion animal genetics, supporting the bond between people and pets by providing world-leading insights powered by DNA. WISDOM PANEL is seeking a Senior Software Engineer who will be an extraordinary addition to our Engineering team, working in support of product and infrastructure development.

HOW YOU'LL HELP EVERYONE PET PARENT LIKE A PRO

We are looking for a senior software engineer who will:

  • Push the limits of genetic technology to improve the life of our pets
  • Leverage modern technology to drive innovation in petcare
  • Utilize advanced data processing and analytics

THE PRO WE'RE LOOKING FOR

As Kinship people, we have three pillars that set out how we aim to be-in our everyday work, and in how we approach each other. We call these our Cultural Pillars. In all of the roles that we hire for, we look for people who are Optimistic, Purposefully Inquisitive, and Open to All.

And for this role, you'll need these skills:

  • Mentoring / managing other software engineers.
  • Advanced modern Javascript experience with one or more frameworks (Ember, React, Vue, Angular) Ember preferred.
  • Expertise using industry standard methodologies to build software (Github, Gitflow, Continuous Integration / Delivery)
  • Experience building RESTful APIs in Ruby / RoR (JSON::API is a plus)

If you also had these experiences, you'd knock it out of the dog park:

  • 8-10 years of experience professionally building software with a proven track record solving complex engineering problems.
  • Confident establishing new application architectures and strategies.
  • Experience building fullstack software, both isomorphic and heterogenous in nature.
  • Superb communication skills and ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to be self-motivated, proactive, work independently, and perform multiple tasks under minimal supervision.
  • Knowledge of modern CSS / SASS / UI frameworks (Flexbox, Bulma, Semantic, etc)
  • Excited by new languages and technology (Elixir, Rust, Flutter, React Native, etc)

JOIN OUR PET PROS

Check out some of our Pro Perks on our website!

  • Unique opportunities for a customizable career within pet care
  • A super collaborative, flat work environment with direct access to our senior leadership team
  • Global hubs to work from a
  • Dog-friendly workplaces
  • Medical, dental, vision, 401k, and pet benefits for you and your family
  • Unlimited paid time off
  • Flexible work opportunities
  • Parental leave for the birth or adoption of your new child
  • Discounts on pet products, services, nutrition and veterinary wellness plans

job.title: Senior UX Designer — Payments and Transfers
job.body:
Help us Build the Future of Money

Gemini Trust Company, LLC (Gemini) is a licensed digital asset exchange and custodian. We built the Gemini platform so customers can buy, sell, and store digital assets (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Zcash) in a regulated, secure, and compliant manner.

Digital assets and blockchain technology have the power to transform the world for good. This truth, along with our core values, form the bedrock of our company and culture. At Gemini, no job is too small and no project too big as we endeavor to build the future of money. We are a mission-driven, team-based, inclusive, and determined community of thought leaders who invest in each other and the long game. Join us in our mission!

The Department: Design Tech

In Design Tech, we think comfort zones are the enemy of creativity. A dynamic team of designers, engineers, researchers, our team blends beauty with tech to create a world-class product interface for our exchange. We are inspired by design, fueled by data, and obsessed with the user, both retail and institution.

The Role: Senior UX Designer — Payments and Transfers

At Gemini, UX designers are responsible for designing best in class solutions that meet customer and business needs. Designers work closely with product managers, engineers, stakeholders and other designers on products and features for the Gemini ecosystem. UX designers create flows, wireframes, prototypes and other deliverables to communicate their ideas. They are responsible for seeing projects through from QA to launch.

This role will work with our payments and transfers team, focusing on adding new currencies, payment methods, and transferring assets. This designer will partner closely with product management and engineering to come up with solutions that allow customers to move seamlessly through these crucial journeys. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record designing in areas like e-commerce, payment methods, checkout flows, subscriptions, etc.

Responsibilities:

  • Translate business requirements, data, and research into elegant design solutions for complex product problems in an emerging space
  • Create deliverables such as user flows, wireframes, presentations, and prototypes that define the user experience
  • Use existing design patterns to develop final UI solutions
  • Design and conduct qualitative user studies to validate and iterate on ideas
  • Align designs with the larger Gemini ecosystem's design patterns and components
  • Collaborate with a cross-functional team that includes engineers, product managers and other designers in order to develop and implement solutions
  • Build consensus through design by focusing conversations, clearly presenting work, and aligning on decisions

Qualifications

  • 3- 5 years experience (relevant education can be factored in)
  • A high quality portfolio of relevant projects that have shipped
  • An in-depth understanding of user-centered design activities including rapid ideation, wireframing, qualitative research, prototyping and, workshop facilitation
  • Comfortable working at different levels of fidelity from sketches to final designs
  • The ability to clearly present and communicate design work
  • Be detailed oriented - you can flesh out edge cases, file bug tickets, provide feedback to developers, etc.
  • Have the ability to self-organize, prioritize and deliver good work on time
  • Strong design sensibility for things like hierarchy, typography, motion, and color
  • Be able to use industry standard tools such as Sketch, Figma, Adobe CC, Google Suite
  • Solid understanding of relevant technologies such HTML/CSS, JavaScript, Swift, iOS, Android.

It Pays to Work Here

We take a holistic approach to compensation at Gemini, which includes:

  • Competitive base salaries across all departments
  • Ownership in the company via profit sharing units
  • Amazing benefits, 401k match contribution, and flexible hours
  • Snacks, Perks, Wellness Outings & Events

Gemini is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

Full Job Description

Student centric. Fast-paced. Collaborative. Innovative. These are all words our employees use to describe the Bellevue University work experience. Our reputation as a growing, progressive University requires us to recruit and retain only the most dynamic and qualified individuals in their fields. We aspire to be nationally recognized as the respected and trusted source of learning needed to thrive and succeed in the face of a rapidly changing world. We offer learning experiences that have the ability to create positive change for individuals, for strategic partners and for our nation. To accomplish our strategic plan, we are committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and understanding that promotes open communication, personal and professional development, long-term employees and long-term success. We are committed to fostering a workplace that is not only challenging, but also rich with opportunity and reward.

Bellevue University offers quality liberal arts and career-oriented programs at undergraduate and graduate levels to a diverse student body through in-class and online venues. We are currently accepting resumes/vitas for Adjunct Faculty - Bachelor’s level Graphic Design.

Primary Area of Interest: Graphic Design (print and web)

The ideal applicant will have practical, hands-on experience with industry standard software (Adobe CC), print design (layout, typography, etc.), web design (HTML, CSS, basic JavaScript, and UX/UI design), and have a minimum of two years of experience in graphic design (print and/or web). job.title: Tech106, Tech107 & Tech113 - Senior Software Engineer (AI)
job.body:
Department: Situational Awareness

Reports to: Vice President, Engineering

Location: Seattle, WA or Atlanta, GA


Company Description

OnSolve: Always On. Solving Problems.

OnSolve is the market leader in real-time, mass notification and collaboration solutions used by the world’s largest brands and thousands of government agencies to deliver critical information in any situation. Mass notification and collaboration is an essential element of emergency response and business continuity planning, keeping teams on track and coordinating during critical events.

The company’s cloud-based software communications and Critical Event Management (CEM) platforms provide seamless and easy-to-deploy solutions for the exchange of critical information and Artificial Intelligence (AI) among organizations, their people, devices and external entities, with use cases designed to save lives, enhance revenue, and reduce costs. Visit us on the Web at onsolve.com.


OnSolve is an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

Job Summary

OnSolve is establishing a team of talented engineers to automate how businesses detect and react to global threats with a goal of improving organizational safety and reducing the impact on operations. We're looking for people who pride themselves on being innovative and agile, while simultaneously willing and able to build highly reliable software in a team-oriented environment. As a software engineer you will play a critical role in building an industry leading critical event management platform. You will work closely other engineers and researchers to build bleeding edge solutions that delight our customers and help them save time, money, and lives.


Responsibilities

  • Design and architect software that can track millions of assets and potential threats.
  • Contribute to new engineering processes and systems that will allow the team to scale in the future.
  • Collaborate with other engineers to design and code highly scalable machine learning applications that process large volumes of data.
  • Building features that make it easier for Chief Operating Officers (COO) and Chief Security Officers (CSO) to monitor the safety and security of their business and react to ongoing threats.
  • Work cross functional with internal teams, product support, product management, delivery management to meet deadlines.
  • Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications

  • BS or advanced degree in computer science, engineering, or related technical field or equivalent professional experiences
  • 5-7+ years of experience in software design and development using a diverse set of programming languages, frameworks and systems.
  • Familiarity with one or more of the following: PERL, Java, C#, Python, NodeJS
  • Knowledge of cloud services in AWS, for example EC2, S3, etc
  • Experience with a Linux environments
  • Demonstrated knowledge of SQL relational databases and nosql databases
  • Experience with developing RESTful web services
  • Familiarity with distributed source control management system such as GIT
  • Experience with Scaled agile development methodologies
  • Knowledge of web protocols and related technologies on the transport layer. e.g. HTTP, Websockets and JSON/XML/Protocol Buffers
  • Knowledge of data structures and algorithms
  • Experience with automated testing

Preferred Qualifications

  • Knowledge of or experience working with geospatial data formats, algorithms, and technologies. (PostGIS, GDAL, geojson, vector tiles, etc…)
  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms and systems
  • Experience with ElasticSearch, Graph Databases, etc
  • Experience with performance tuning and optimization
  • JavaScript/TypeScript and React experience

Compensation & Benefits

  • Health, Dental, Vision, Life and additional supplemental insurance
  • 401K
  • Paid time off and personal days
  • Paid holidays

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.
