Description

This role will be engage software development in an Agile SAFe framework in a DevSecOps environment with a focus in front-end web development with JavaScript and various web technologies. This is a software development position on a team building and maintaining web-based applications to meet mission requirements. An individual in this role is also expected to perform automated testing and unit testing using a JavaScript test framework (such as Jasmine or Karma), while performing automated deployments of software modules using a Continuous Integration Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) tools pipeline. Primary Responsibilities • Participate in software programming initiatives to support innovation, new development and enhancement, primarily leveraging JavaScript (or TypeScript), JavaScript frameworks such as ReactJS or Angular, as well as HTML5 and CSS3 • Package management and tooling using npm • Developing and directing software system validation and testing methods using JavaScript test frameworks (such as Jasmine or Karma) and Katalon • Participate in the development of documentation. • Coordinate closely with customers, Scrum Masters, and cross-functional areas to communicate project statuses and initiatives. • Analyze data to effectively coordinate the installation of new systems or modifications to existing systems. • Support the Agile software development lifecycle. • Use of industry leading tools like GitHub, Jenkins, Unix bash scripting • Perform systems software development, including deployment of build artifacts across different environments leverage GitFlow constructs • Communicate key project data to team members and build team cohesion and effectiveness. • Develop and execute project plans. • Leverage Atlassian tool suite like JIRA and Confluence to track activities • Apply best practices and standard operating procedures • Create innovative solutions to meet the technical needs of customers. • Duties also include participating in daily scrums, performing software requirements analysis, risk identification, risk mitigation, and collaboration across Agile teams. • Flexible cross-training to also provide systems engineering, software development, training, security, and testing is also desired. Basic Qualifications • Experienced with web application development, particularly front-end development with JavaScript • Significant experience with at least one of: Angular or ReactJS • Significant experience with modern web development and using npm and node.js for local development tasks • Significant experience with general web architecture • Significant experience with working in Linux and Windows environments • Significant experience with JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, Jenkins, Github, JIRA, Java, and Confluence. • Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills Candidate must have Bachelors with 8-12 years of prior relevant experience or Masters with 6-10 years of prior relevant experience. Additional years of experience can accepted in lieu of a degree. Candidate must have an active TS/SCI with polygraph.

ISP and cellphone reimbursement
LTD, STD disability and life insurance
Paid health, dental, and vision for employee and family.
$5000 annual training expense reimbursement
Computer purchase plan

Job Description

Alion is looking for a user experience (UX) or user interface (UI) front-end designer that will work closely with a team to design and build web-based applications that meet our Department of Defense, Federal and commercial customers’ requirements regarding security assessments of various types. The candidate will be part of a team that interfaces with the product owners and customers to develop intuitive, user-friendly web applications. Candidate will:

  • Participate in agile/scrum software development process
  • Elaborate on requirements, use case specifications, design overviews, design details and coding approaches for new software features, with a focus on the UX/UI
  • Develop designs for new user interfaces and enhancements for existing interfaces
  • Work with product owners to develop storyboards, wireframes, etc.
  • Consult with the software engineers on UX/UI and recommend solutions
  • Support maintenance of development and testing environments and system hosting our production deployment of the software

The ideal candidate will be a strong team contributor who is will be eager to learn and has a background in meeting customers’ software/application requirements in an Agile environment. The candidate must be a self-starter who can be productive in both on-site and work-from-home environments.

Position requires analytical and problem-solving skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into the software applications.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree in design, graphic design, applied arts, digital art, information technology, computer science, related field, or STEAM program.
  • Experience with fulfilling technical and business requirements for intuitive and user-centered solutions incorporating knowledge of human computer interaction design
  • Experience with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, Bootstrap
  • User Interface design portfolio
  • Ability to quickly research and learn new technologies as needed
  • Ability to analyze functional requirements and attention to detail necessary to arrive at technically sound design decisions
  • Ability to work in a collaborative environment with other engineers, testers and subject-matter experts
  • Ability to proficiently document work completed, issues or other items necessary for the team’s awareness

ADDITIONAL QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Knowledge of the Adobe suite of products including Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, and Dreamweaver, or their equivalents.
  • Understanding of Section 508 of American Disabilities Act, as it pertains to software UI design
  • US Citizenship

job.title: WordPress Developer
job.company: Awesome Motive - West Palm Beach, FL
job.body:
As a WordPress Developer, you're responsible for Making Stuff Go. You will build infrastructure to create new features, improve existing code, squash bugs, and help us rapidly scale our platform.

Interested? See "How to Apply" below to learn more before applying.

To love this role, here’s the type of person you are:
  • You’re a self-starter who loves taking initiative and seeing things through from conception to completion. Our developers often "own" features/tasks and are responsible for scoping, development, and testing.
  • You're an excellent communicator, fluent in both verbal and written English, who makes sure nothing slips through the cracks. We believe communication is critical and there is no such thing as over communicating.
  • You have the curiosity and desire to learn and grow your skills.
  • You're passionate about leaving your mark on the web for all to see and are excited to work on tasks that impact millions of users.
  • You take pride in the quality if you and craftsmanship of your work rather than just doing it to get it done.
  • You're a team player who is comfortable working along side and helping other developers, and you don't take critical feedback personally.
  • You're happy jumping between front-end and back-end development tasks, or tackling tasks which require both.
  • You're happy working on tasks of all sizes - from small bug fixes and enhancements to large features/rewrites.

Common responsibilities include (but are not limited to):
  • Triaging bugs and small enhancements that come into GitHub.
  • Scoping, writing, and testing new product features and addons.
  • Refactoring legacy code with a particular attention to backwards compatibility.
  • Providing feedback and peer review for other developers (Github PRs).
  • Communicating with the team and supporting your peers using chat, audio, and video.

Here are some skills that will come handy:
  • Professional experience with WordPress plugin development, architecture, and standards.
  • Advanced proficiency with PHP and MySQL, including modern PHP practices (OOP, autoloading, namespacing, traits, interfaces, etc).
  • Strong familiarity with JavasScript (vanilla JS, jQuery, ES6, etc).
  • Ability to use and extend build tools like gulp and webpack.
  • Familiarity with package managers such as Composer and NPM.
  • Experience working with third-party APIs (Eg Stripe, Drip, Zapier, etc).
  • Competent with version control through git and GitHub.
  • The ability to iterate and ship ideas quickly.
  • Exceptional troubleshooting skills.
  • Ability to keep complex ideas and features simple. (Simplicity is a core value!)
  • Previous freelance or remote work experience.

Bonus points if you also have:
  • Advanced proficiency in JavaScript frameworks like VueJS or React.
  • Experience with e-commerce platforms or related APIs (WooCommerce, Stripe, PayPal, etc).
  • Experience with DevOps or infrastructure management.
What we offer

Working for a fast-growing bootstrapped company is a rare opportunity, one we consider a lifestyle choice rather than a job choice. Our positions are challenging, but also come with amazing advantages and fulfillment to those who earn them. Here’s what we offer.
  • Competitive Salary.
  • Health, Dental and Vision Insurance benefits for full-time U.S. employees.
  • Work from your home. We’re spread out all over the world – United States, Canada, Ukraine, India, Pakistan, Singapore and more.
  • Unlimited PTO after 90 days of employment. We encourage employees to take the time they need for vacation, to stay healthy, and to spend time with friends and family.
  • Paid maternity and paternity leave.
  • We happily provide or reimburse software you’ll need as well as books or courses that promote continued learning.
  • We give you the opportunity to solve challenging and meaningful problems that make a difference.
  • Custom Branded laptop at your five year anniversary.
  • We cover all costs of company travel (including our annual all-company retreat and mini-team meetups).
  • Ability to work with some of the best people in the business through frequent, if not daily, interactions.
  • And in case you were wondering: no politics, no b.s., and no jerks.

Location

This is a remote position - our team is spread around the globe! Our home base is in Florida, USA, so company operating hours are 9am - 5pm ET (UTC -5). While full coverage is not a requirement, you must be available during a portion of the day.
Requirements
  • Personal Computer with Internet Access
-Availability to participate in audio/video meetings between the hours 9 am - 5 pm EST.

Inclusion Statement

At Awesome Motive, we strive to have the broadest possible view of diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background, experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. Awesome Motive is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.
How to apply?

If all of this sounds interesting, then please submit your application!

Please clearly include the following in your cover letter:
  • Your experience with WordPress plugin development.
  • What is your favorite WordPress hook/function and why.
  • Tell us a bit about yourself and why you should be considered. Details about your experience, qualifications, personality, etc are very helpful.
  • Profile links with code samples (GitHub, GitLab, WordPress.org, etc).
  • Other profile links if available (Your website, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc).

Also note, don't forget to proofread before submitting. Check spelling, capitalization, etc. This is your chance to make your application stand out :)

We won’t be able to individually respond to all applications, but if we feel you’re a strong match, someone will be in touch shortly. Qualified candidates will be asked to do a simple code challenge.

Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!

job.title: Machine Learning Developer
job.body:
Realty Income, The Monthly Dividend Company®, one of four San Diego based S&P 500 companies dedicated to providing shareholders with dependable monthly income. Our company is structured as a REIT, and its monthly dividends are supported by the cash flow, almost 6,000 real estate properties owned under long-term lease agreements with regional and national commercial tenants. To date, our company has declared almost 600 consecutive common stock monthly dividends throughout its 50-year operating history and has continually increased the dividend since Realty Income's public listing in 1994 (NYSE: O). Our company attracts individuals who value integrity, perseverance, and teamwork. If you appreciate working on a truly collaborative team in a professional environment in a company that encourages a work-life balance, make sure to apply today!

As Realty Income’s Machine Learning Developer, you’ll assist in the design and development of machine learning and deep learning systems, tests, and experiments, and help implement cutting edge machine learning algorithms. Reporting to the Associate Vice President of Strategy, you will spearhead this newly developed role. You can anticipate a day in the life to include- design and development of cloud-based applications, tools, and APIs for scalable big data. Machine leaning and other web-based software applications essential to the analytical and investing needs of the company will also be chief. You should come equipped with experience in building complex web applications using tools such as React.js, Node.js, and PostgreSQL, as well as have a high competency in statistics and programming (e.g., Python, SQL, Spark).


Your Contribution to the Team Includes

Build a powerful analytics platform using a React/Node.js/PostgreSQL stack

  • Design and develop high-quality web services using React.JS
  • Maintain, analyze, and enhance existing services
  • Work with data scientists and business stakeholders to design and develop a variety of features, reusable components, and products
  • Analyze design requirements
  • Be responsive to change/feature requests and develop creative solutions from dev to production

Proactively engage in front-end performance optimization

  • Proactively analyze website performance and implement solutions for improvement
  • Collaborate within and across teams regarding different layers of technical infrastructure
  • Create unit and integration tests to ensure code quality
  • Implement continuous improvement changes
  • Triage and fix reported bugs
  • Communicate estimates, schedules, issues, and dependencies to technical team
  • Bring new ideas about technology to analytics team and executive managers

Assist in the design and development of complex and efficient self-learning models and applications

  • Study and transform data science prototypes
  • Research and implement appropriate ML algorithms and tools
  • Develop machine learning applications according to requirements
  • Select appropriate datasets and data representation methods
  • Run machine learning tests and experiments
  • Perform statistical analysis and fine-tuning using test results
  • Train and retrain systems, when necessary
  • Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks
  • Keep abreast of developments in the field

What You’ll Need to be Successful

  • BS or MS in Computer Science, Information Technology, Software Engineering, Machine Learning, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, or Operations Research
  • Minimum of 2+ years of relevant development experience
  • Expertise in coding robust and secure APIs in React.js/Node.js/PostgreSQL
  • Solid foundation and programming experience in Python, SQL, Spark
  • Experience with model deployment using Docker, preferred
  • Knowledge of database schema design best practices and ORM experience
  • Experience building and deploying applications and services into cloud environments (AWS highly desired)
  • Understanding of data structures, data modeling and software architecture
  • Familiarity with machine learning frameworks
  • Knowledge of math, probability, statistics, and algorithms
  • Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Should be a self-starter who is excited to relentlessly solve many technical challenges
  • Strong oral and written communication skills and presentation abilities, including the ability to communicate complex ideas to large groups and very senior levels of management.
  • Ability to execute in ambiguous situations and take the lead without explicit instructions.

In response to COVID-19, Realty Income has maintained our business operations and have open opportunities, yet made necessary adjustments to our hiring process. We are conducting all steps of the interview process in a virtual capacity. In response to California’s Stay at Home order and other states with similar provisions, our employees will continue to work remotely until these restrictions have been lifted and it is safe to work in an office again. Realty Income has endeavored to be adaptable and strategic in our capacity to maneuver in an unfamiliar situation, and we pride ourselves on our resilience. We immensely appreciate both your flexibility and consideration of Realty Income for employment.

To all recruitment agencies: Realty Income does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, Realty Income employees, or any company location. Realty Income is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job.body:
We are transforming the thinking around customer conversations and the means technology gives us to communicate whenever, wherever and as in depth as we want. As part of North America Customer Digitization team, we are seeking a talented and imaginative individual who is passionate about creating best in class digital experiences to join the Digital Self Service team as an AI Chatbot Designer and Bot Builder.

Citi Retail Services, Branded Cards, and Retail Bank are one of North America's largest providers of private label, co-brand, and citi branded credit cards, serving iconic brands and cards, including Citi Prestige, Double Cash Back, American Airlines, The Home Depot, Best Buy, Wayfair, Caterpillar, Shell and Macy’s. We are in a multi-year transformative journey to reinvigorate and enable our Digital Self Service offerings to match consumer expectations and evolving needs.

The future of banking is all about context and by rethinking existing customer interactions and redesigning integration mechanisms; a new higher levels of customer engagements can be unlocked for greater value and brand loyalty. Successful candidates will be experienced chatbot builders and thrive in using creative, design thinking and continuous agile delivery approaches to solve complex customer challenges in a rapidly and constantly changing business environment. The position will report directly to the Vice President, Intelligent Automation.

Key Position Responsibilities:

Expected be hands on in web services, server-side experience. Candidate will be analyzing business requirements, interact with different business teams and will be a part of the solution design process. Candidate will be working on Javascript and NOSQL etc. and will be a part of the core team Develop bots using the Kore.ai platform Dialogue component management (user intent, entity, service, script, message, confirmation, webhooks) Working with product managers to turn mapping, flows, and responses into a delightful customer experience Work in agile methodologies, design patterns, and software revision control systems Experience in scaling applications and database infrastructure Ready to work in an innovative and creative environment Skillset should have few of the following Javascript and/or related technologies, jQuery, Backbone, Underscore, Redis / CouchDB / MongoDB, Web Sockets Knowledge on Linux / Unix flavors Strong knowledge of code documentation and handover Experience with git version control system 2+ years of solid development experience in chat bot

Key Demonstrated Experience and Qualifications:

Starts with customer empathy and always includes a passion for products, down to the smallest details. Insight into how digital is impacting customer experience and industry.

Interprets and make decisions from champion-challenger test results. Smart risk taking and can crisply communicate analysis and design decisions.

Support development of business cases to support new products, services or enhancements as well as test and learn pilots to eventual deployment of solutions at scale.
  • [Technical Aptitude] Stays up to date regarding current technology capabilities and customer experience best practices, emerging trends, and competitive landscape. Experience in e-commerce, mobile & digital servicing/engagement as well as demonstrated proficiency in leading multiple large-scale enterprise projects from inception to completion.
  • [Education] Bachelor’s Degree or advanced certificate in Engineering, Computer Science/MIS, Computer Applications, or Human Centered Design

ROLE DESCRIPTION
Software Engineer: Full-stack developer w/ front-end experience

ROLE SUMMARY
We are looking for a full-stack developer with front-end development experience to join our Digital Strategy team to develop cloud-based software solutions for Valor Christian High School and its partners. Ideal candidates will have an Agile cloud platform development background with experience in developing scalable school applications, including content management systems (CMS), learning management systems (LMS) and student information systems (SIS). job.title: Data Scientist (Associate Level)
job.body:
ERM is seeking a Data Scientist to join its Geospatial and Climate Services team, based in Washington-DC. The Data Scientist will work alongside specialists in geospatial analysis, remote sensing and climate science to help develop efficient workflows and tools for our quickly growing portfolio of work. Current workflows include identification of risk to infrastructure and assets from climate change, using satellites to monitor worksites, helping clients measure the carbon sink and stock potential of their landholdings, routing linear infrastructure through large sections of Africa and Latin America, assistance in siting of renewable energy assets, among others. The Data Scientist will join a team that works with most sectors, services and geographies to help our clients achieve their sustainable development goals through data-driven decision making. We leverage several “frontier technologies” in our workflows with a strong emphasis on providing integrated products of unique value. Several of these products are now being scaled for both internal and external use, and the Data Scientist will provide key skill sets in helping ERM to scale its products.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Collecting data through means such as analyzing business results or by setting up and managing new studies
  • Transferring data into a new format to make it more appropriate for analysis
  • Creating new, experimental frameworks to collect data
  • Building tools to automate data collection
  • Searching through large data sets for usable information
  • Manipulate and analyze multi-dimensional and time series data
  • Creating reports and presentations for business uses
  • Correlating similar data to find actionable results
  • Automate remote sensing, geospatial, or climate science workflows
  • Develop cloud based tools to assist in workflow standardization and automation
  • Assist with the preparation of methodology sections for reports and proposals.
  • Work within, and guide others in working within quality/budget/schedule expectations and scope-specific assignments.
  • Complete work assignments in accordance with ERM's management system, format and quality standards, and guide others in doing likewise.

REQUIREMENTS:

  • 1-3 years of professional experience.
  • A bachelors or masters in computer science, math, software engineering, statistics, data science or related technical field.
  • Knowledge of programming languages like SQL, Python, R, and Scala. Experience with additional languages such as HTML/CSS, JavaScript, and/or C++ would be preferred
  • Experience using cloud-based solutions such as MS Azure and/or ESRI Image Server
  • Experience optimizing scripts and APIs for efficiency and performance
  • Background using multi-dimensional or time series data
  • Experience in working with gridded data (e.g. NetCDF)
  • Familiarity with business intelligence tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
  • Strong mathematics skills (e.g., statistics, algebra)
  • Advanced ability to perform exploratory data analysis
  • Experience with common data science toolkits
  • Working knowledge of statistics
  • Analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Experience with machine learning and AI
  • Familiarity with data management tools
  • Exceptional technical writing skills
  • Ability to communicate complex data in a simple, actionable way
  • Ability to visualize data in the most effective way possible for a given project or study
  • Ability to work independently and with team members from different backgrounds
  • Excellent attention to detail.
  • Ability to multi-task, maintain flexibility, travel internationally, and work independently with minimal supervision.
  • Demonstrated attributes to become a strong senior consultant – team player, eagerness to learn and grow, self-starter who takes initiative, versatile, and service-oriented mentality.

Who We Are:

As the world’s leading sustainability consulting firm, ERM is uniquely positioned to contribute to the environment and society through the expertise and energy of our employees worldwide. Sustainability is what we do, and is at the heart of both our service offerings and how we operate our business. ERM and our partners are driven by a dynamic vision: By 2021 we will be the clear leader in our chosen markets, we will double in value and we will deliver on our promises to our clients, our people and our investors. For our people, our vision means attracting, inspiring, developing and rewarding our people to work with the best clients and on the biggest challenges, thus creating valuable careers. We achieve our vision in a sustainable manner by maintaining and living our ERM values that include Accountability, Caring for our People, Client Focus, Collaboration, Empowerment, and Transparency.

Please submit your resume and brief cover letter. Qualified candidates will be contacted by email, and requested to complete a video questionnaire. Based on review of these responses, shortlisted candidates will be invited for interviews.

ERM does not accept recruiting agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ERM employees or any other company location. ERM is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

ERM is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics.

Thank you for your interest in ERM!

job.title: Software Engineer
job.body:
CentralReach is a leading provider of end-to-end EMR, practice management and clinical solutions that enable applied behavior analysis (ABA) clinicians and educators to produce superior outcomes for people with autism. The company is revolutionizing the ABA space with cutting-edge solutions including precision teaching, clinical data collection, scheduling, billing, learning management, fully digital evidence-based programming and more. Trusted by more than 90,000 clinicians and educators, CentralReach is committed to ongoing product improvement, market-leading industry expertise, world-class client satisfaction, and support of the ABA community to propel industry practitioners into a new era of excellence.

We are looking for a passionate full-stack developer with strong machine learning experience to join our team! Reporting to our VP, Product Development, you will be a trusted partner, developing back-office and front-end software systems and APIs in an agile environment to integrate with a growing set of practice management software solutions.

As a key member of the Engineering team, you will take ownership of bringing new and improved features and functionality to our entire stack, work independently within a group of developers to drive product development, communicate and coordinate effectively with other independent techies and non-techies alike, to ensure optimal progress towards our goals.

If you have a passion for full stack development and technology in general, enjoy and thrive in an agile, fast-moving, ever-changing startup environment, welcome and take on technical challenges of all shapes and sizes, have excellent interpersonal skill and sense of humor and enjoy rolling up your sleeves and jumping in, then read on!

This role is based out of our Verona, Italy. Local candidates only please.

Key Accountabilities:

  • Develop logistics tools using Web technologies (JavaScript, TypeScript, React, CSS, etc.)
  • Microsoft development stack (C#, SQL Server, Nodejs, MongoDB) on AWS (using Redis, ElasticSearch, Redshift, DynamoDb, Kinesis, etc.).
  • Develop new features using Machine learning/AI

Desires Skills and Experience:

  • Demonstrate solid working knowledge of any mainstream object-oriented programming language, ideally C#, Javascript, Typescript
  • Have a deep understanding of machine learning, including model development/assessment, training and test data sets, and algorithm performance. AWS SageMaker experience is a plus.
  • Have a deep understanding of back end/server/api development, including application and database/data development and architectures
  • Demonstrate solid working knowledge of these mainstream front end technologies ideally Javascript, TypeScript, React, Mobx, & CSS.
  • Possess broad applicable knowledge of data/database technologies including traditional RDBMS's (SQL Server), and NoSql specifically MongoDB.
  • Display working knowledge of the SQL language and/or SQL-based relational database system(s) (i.e. MySql, SQL Server, Oracle, etc.)
  • Experience with healthcare is a plus.

CentralReach was developed for Clinicians by Clinicians. The story of CentralReach begins in 2012 when the company’s founder, a practicing Board Certified Behavioral Analyst, decided there had to be a better way to manage her operations so she could spend more time on what mattered most — working with her clients and patients. To help ABA practices focus on what they do best, CentralReach launched the first iteration of its EMR and practice management platform.

Today, under the leadership of Chris Sullens, an award-winning CEO in the technology space, CentralReach is committed to their mission of providing cutting-edge technology and services to help clinicians and educators produce superior client and patient outcomes. Already a market leader, CentralReach is expected to grow exponentially through its four core tenets: hire and develop great people; build industry-leading products; provide exceptional service to customers and continuously invest in systems, processes and infrastructure.
We value our employees and offer a robust benefits package including health and dental, paid time off, life insurance, disability coverage and a 401(k) matching. We also provide comprehensive onboarding, ongoing training, mentoring and career pathing to help you develop your career. We pride ourselves on our fun and energetic environment that also provides our employees with a meaningful way to make a difference by helping clinicians produce superior outcomes for children and adults with disabilities.

job.title: Product Designer
job.body:
About Weee!

Weee!, headquartered in Fremont, California, is the largest and fastest-growing( 700% YoY growth) Asian e-grocer providing affordable access to hard-to-find and fresh Asian ingredients directly from the source. By partnering with local suppliers and leveraging proprietary demand forecasting technology, Weee! is reshaping the grocery supply chain entirely. Weee! has received $100M+ in funding to date from DST Global, Goodwater Capital, iFly.vc, XVC, VMG, Lightspeed Ventures and Silicon Valley Bank.

Weee! is currently available in SF Bay Area, Sacramento, Seattle, Portland, Los Angeles, San Diego with our 2020 newly added locations of New Jersey, New York, DC, Philadelphia, Boston and Houston. We are gearing up for significant service expansion nationwide slated for the next 12 months.

About the Role

Weee! is seeking a multi-disciplinary (visual, UI, UX) Product Designer to spearhead a series of exciting, high-impact projects in the works. This is a rare opportunity to build the brand narrative for a rapidly growing, venture-backed startup. You will work closely with engineering, product, and marketing to exchange ideas leading to rapid testing and iteration. We make decisions based on data, observing and reacting to how systems are impacted by our choices. If you're seeking to make a meaningful and immediate impact at an innovative, fast-paced, and data-driven startup, we'd love to meet you.

Job Responsibilities

  • Design intuitive, human-centric flows and experiences, anticipating user needs for an underserved market, turning ambiguity into success through experimentation and focused iteration
  • Embrace complex design problems and drive simplicity through solutions that incorporate both qualitative and quantitative data, measuring and analyzing success along the way
  • Own projects from conception to launch and measure success through data and user research, playing a key role in road mapping, feature design, and the quality of our products and services
  • Partner with engineering, product, design, research, marketing, and customer service to build products and features from conception to launch, rapidly ideating, and producing multiple UI/UX concepts
  • Align the user experience with the brand identity and overall business strategy to consistently communicate and elevate the tone, voice, value propositions, and vision

Qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience designing and shipping consumer-facing, e-commerce products on multiple platforms (a portfolio to demonstrate the end-to-end process and outcome is required)
  • Experience conducting user research, validating ideas through prototyping, and tracking and meeting performance metrics
  • Expert-level fluency in design software (Figma, Adobe CS)
  • Fluency in prototyping tools (Figma, Principle, Invision, Framer, etc.)
  • Ability to write and edit HTML, CSS and Javascript a plus
  • Conceptual understanding of front-end frameworks (Angular, React) a plus
  • Additional language skills are a plus

Company Benefit

  • Comprehensive health insurance package, including medical, dental, and vision
  • Quarterly performance bonus
  • Paid time off and company recognized public holidays
  • Free lunch catered by local restaurants
  • Monthly Weee! Points credit and phone subsidy
  • Great growth opportunity and relocation opportunity

job.title: Embedded Software Engineer
job.body:
AMETEK PQS is a world leader in power quality with products ranging from isolation transformers and surge protectors to uninterruptible power supplies and networked power management. AMETEK PQS is the first choice in power protection and energy management. Every piece of electronic equipment in the world works better and more dependably when it's protected from spikes, blackouts, electrical noise, common-mode voltage and other power protection challenges.

We are seeking an expert Embedded Software Engineer who can analyze and solve system-wide problems from the low-level hardware interface to the OS and application level. This position will have development responsibilities ranging from the lowest level hardware interface, to application level development. Projects will be a combination of testing and development for new products, adding features and supporting existing products, as well as internal tools for development and manufacturing.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop software in embedded Linux, FreeRTOS, assembly level Microchip PIC, Windows, and Web with and without technical assistance
  • Utilize Unit Test and Integration Test to verify functionality
  • Serve as the technical lead in software development project, assist software engineering manager with projects as needed
  • Provide technical assistance in developing proposals, timelines, and cost estimates
  • Work within system specifications to implement, verify, and test embedded systems drivers and algorithms.
  • Determine root cause of issues guided by other employees and/or Clients.
  • Documentation, Requirements & Specification definition
  • Participate in code reviews.
  • Create design documentation and test plans.
  • Post product launch responsibilities including customer support.
  • Willingness to work on all aspects of software, from assembly code, bare metal C, to RTOS, application, or cloud development
  • Develop/support software tools as needed for production
Position will be based in Knightdale, NC, just outside of Raleigh
Position Requirements:
Minimum Requirements:

  • Experience is required in software embedded design, coding, and testing.
  • BS EE/CE/CS or equivalent required.
  • 2+ years experience in design and development of real time embedded software applications.
  • Experience with C, and C++ software development and Real Time Operating Systems.
  • Experience with javascript, HTML, and CSS for web development.
  • Experience and familiarity with embedded architectures, drivers or other low level programming and knowledge of networking.
  • Experience with several networking protocols and conventions: HTTP, SNMP, SNTP, Telnet, mDNS, etc.
  • System communication protocols such as I2C, SPI, USART, etc.
Fluency in basic electrical engineering fundamentals
  • Able to make effective use of multi-core and multi-processor systems
  • Familiarity with revision control systems, preferably Git
  • Strong interpersonal and problem solving skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills - fluent in English
  • Ability to learn on the job. Some technologies, tools, frameworks will be new
  • Ability to travel domestically (<10%)

Preferred Skills:
  • Experience with Virtual Machines (VM), ARM processors, hypervisors, and ucLinux is desired
  • Experience with Uboot and linux boot up process
  • Experience developing code for Linux OS
  • Experience with CI/CD and make files
  • Experience with React, Angular, Electron, Node.js
  • Experience with network security, specifically HTTPS, 802.1x, LDAP

job.title: Web Designer/Front-End Developer
job.body:
Can you handle both?

We are looking for a few talented individuals who can design not only beautiful websites, but can also build out those designs on WordPress quickly and efficiently.

Your mission (should you decide to accept it) will be to design the UI/UX, as well as the actual code that will produce all visual elements of our clients’ websites or web applications. Your expertise will help you bridge the gap between graphical design and technical implementation, taking an active role on both sides and defining how the site or application looks as well as how it works.

Responsibilities?

You’ll have several. You’ll be responsible for designing beautiful but usable designs and interfaces for clients. You’ll oversee the recommendation and implementation of WordPress plugins as well as the development of custom user-facing features. You’ll create reusable code and assemble libraries for future use. You’ll work with our QA team to ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs, and you’ll also work with our tech team to optimize any custom applications for maximum speed and scalability.

To pull this off, you’ll need to have a good understanding of Conversion-centric design. We’re not about creating designs that entertain the designer. We’re about creating designs that convert visitors into customers. So, your expertise in building funnels and website conversion opportunities will be critical to the success of our clients.

You need to be a team player who is passionate about learning, teaching, serving and growing. This industry changes fast, so if you like change, strap on and hold tight, because we push change to its maximum every day.

Skills And Qualifications

You definitely need to know your way around Photoshop and Illustrator, plus you’ll need to know how to build a WordPress site with as little custom CSS as possible. The goal is to leverage the power that is built into WordPress and not build every page independently of the CMS. When it comes time to make a site or application really sing, though, you’ll need to demonstrate your proficient understanding of web markup, including HTML5, CSS3, jQuery, and JavaScript.

Ideally, you’d have a great understanding of designing using Thrive Architect, Divi, or WP Bakery. You’ll also need a good understanding of SEO principles and ensure that our clients’ websites will adhere to them.

Oh, and you’ll not only need to be creative, but you’re going to need to be fast. We have the need for speed at Bizzuka, because our clients depend on us to help them increase revenues and decrease expenses by automating lead generation or automating manual processes. The sooner we fix their problems, the more of an impact we can have on their business and the customers they serve.

Our clients expect and deserve the best. If that sounds like something you can get behind, then attach your resume with a link to your portfolio of work.

job.title: Content Designer
job.body:
Role

A Content Designer at Skuid designs with words. The tricky part is using the right words in the right place at the right time for the right audience.

This is a role for someone who geeks out over words, loves to write, savors research, talks to people about their product experiences, gets the work of building processes done, and wants to belong to an empowering team.

You may be a Technical Writer, UX Writer, Product Designer, or Content Strategist in your current role. Fantastic! We’d love to hear from you.

We do not necessarily expect you to come to Skuid from another Content Designer role. We do expect you to have interest in learning the disciplines of technical and UX writing, product and content design, and content and UX strategy. If you’ve been itching for a chance to grow in these disciplines, then this is a perfect opportunity for you!

You’d join Skuid's tight-knit Product Content team. We handle writing in-product content, as well as writing the documentation that supports the product. To fulfill these responsibilities, the Product Content team collaborates with product managers, product designers, and product engineers on a daily basis.

Your user-centered research and content decisions will shape the product for the people who experience - and build with - Skuid. You’ll do work that matters.


Things you’ll do

  • Contribute to the design process by sharing research findings and by writing content for designs.
  • Write in-product content that helps people understand and use Skuid.
  • Write clear and concise documentation in line with our voice, tone, and style guidelines.
  • Collaborate with product designers, product managers, product engineers, and other product people to research, define, design, and implement product decisions.
  • Research and identify user needs and to determine structure, format, and tone.
  • Advocate for well-researched, data-driven, and user-centered design choices.
  • Create and shape processes and systems that support effective design.
  • Listen well - to the people using Skuid and to the people building Skuid.
  • Measure the outcome of content decisions.

Minimum qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience as a technical writer, UX writer, product designer, content designer, or content strategist.
  • Proven ability to produce clear and concise writing.
  • Ability to analyze complex processes and break them down into understandable and teachable components.
  • Drive to learn necessary technologies and techniques, both through independent research and team collaboration.
  • Attention to detail, especially when a task is time-sensitive.
  • Ability to prioritize work and ask for help from team members.
  • Ability and experience translating complex technical concepts into easily understood language and examples.

Preferred qualifications

  • Experience with content and design tools.
  • Experience with SaaS platforms, like Salesforce and Amazon Web Services.
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, Javascript, source control (git), static site generators, and lightweight markup languages like reStructuredText or Markdown.

Are you looking to make a difference in a patient’s life? At AmerisourceBergen, you will find an innovative culture that is patient focused and dedicated to making a difference. As an organization, we are united in our responsibility to create healthier futures.
What you will be doing

This position will be responsible to design, develop, support and add new capabilities to our customer support platform applications built on SAP Commerce solution. Our customer support platform is supporting a large customer base across multiple storefronts.

  • Work on state of the art front end technologies within our eCommerce customer support platform

  • Analyze, Design, Implement React & Redux based front-end components and build the front-end UI

  • Provide architectural insights into newer JavaScript UI framework

  • Work with backend RESTful APIs

  • Scale and optimize the performance of front end applications

  • Measure app performance using APM platforms such as Dynatrace etc.

  • Work closely with business analysts and team members to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions

  • Uses various Tools effectively: JIRA, SLACK, Confluence, Jenkins.


What your background should look like (minimum qualifications)

Bachelor’s degree in Programming/Systems or Computer Science or equivalent related field. Or equivalent work experience. Typically have 5-10 years of application programming and analysis experience.

Must haves:

  • 2 + years of experience with modern JavaScript frameworks, such as React, Angular, or Vue.

  • Solid understanding of fundamental web technologies such as HTTP, REST, AJAX and JSON.

  • Must have strong skills in debugging and performance tuning using Chrome Dev tools, React Dev tools and Redux dev tools Unit-tested code using Karma, Mocha, Chai, Enzyme, or Jest.

Nice to have:

  • Experience on SAP

job.body:
Covid-19 Update: Business is booming and JetFuel is still growing! In an effort to help flatten the curve, we are conducting interviews for all candidates remotely until further notice. The entire team, including new hires, will resume working out of the San Francisco office once it is deemed safe to do so. Stay healthy and stay safe!

At JetFuel, we are building the creator economy by providing creators with the tools they need to grow, monetize and thrive in the digital advertising space. Today, this means building a best-in-class platform that provides monetization opportunities, strategies and data-driven content development tools to drive long term growth for our advertising partners and, most importantly, the creators.

What You'll Do

  • Design delightful products for iOS and React-native mobile-web applications
  • Perform usability research on features, communicate findings, and propose changes to address issues found, transforming user insights into meaningful action for rapid iteration
  • Partner with the Growth, Media, Community, Creator and Advertiser Teams to ideate and execute nuanced features and products for the creator economy
  • Build prototypes of new products and features to match rapid engineering velocity
  • Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and new technologies
  • Provide code documentation and other inputs to technical documents

What You've Done

  • Shipped a significant amount of mobile-centric products with exposure to web design
  • Experience building new platforms and products from scratch, leading iteration through data
  • Demonstrated record of using data and/or user research to inform and evaluate design solutions
  • Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions
  • Experience validating design decisions through user/usability research
  • Experience mentoring and developing engineers with or without a formal leadership title
  • Received meaningful exposure to mobile development challenges, enough to have opinions around technical choices that may cause downstream impacts to your own work

Bonus Points!

  • Experience as a mobile or web-focused software engineer
  • Exposure to Swift, Javascript and other frontend/UI technologies and frameworks
  • Experience leading distributed teams, product engineering teams or ad-hoc project teams
  • Experience working in an early-stage startup environment
Why join JetFuel?

Engineering at JetFuel is truly product engineering, not simply implementing what the business stakeholders request to hit milestones along a product roadmap. As an engineer at JetFuel, you will have meaningful and immediate input and impact across the technical platform and our overall business. Our core values truly reflect our actions, down to the speed of our interview process and commitment to having fun and enjoying the work we do.

Our Core Values
Do It, Yesterday
Be Curious And Try Things
Always Question
Do What Works
Enjoy The Ride

We believe in providing an inclusive environment that fosters psychological safety and freedom to fail, fast. To that end, we are excited and committed to providing a breadth of benefits and perks for our employees. A brief highlight of these benefits can be found below:

Comprehensive health, vision & dental plans
Unlimited vacation policy (we make sure you actually use it as well!)
Flexible work schedule
New work laptop of your choice and budget to set up your work-from-home office
Once we return, a goldfish friendly office!

JetFuel promotes diversity and provides equal opportunity for all applicants and employees. We are dedicated to building a company that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work (and work environment) will be for everyone.

job.title: Conversational Designer
job.body:
Snaps is the leader in connecting global brands and consumers in AI-powered automated conversations. Our award-winning technology helps executives across customer experience, marketing, e-commerce and product teams create, automate and optimize experiences that their customers will love in channels like Facebook Messenger, Webchat, SMS, Google Business Messages, and more. The world’s top brands, including Michael Kors, Tiffany & Co., Live Nation, Calvin Klein, Uber, Lane Bryant and more leverage Snaps’ products to acquire new customers and increase lifetime value through marketing and customer experience automation.

The future is conversational. Snaps is your partner. Check us out!

A Conversational Designer at Snaps leverages their creativity, analytical and technical acumen to produce engaging and impactful conversational experiences. You will become an expert with our authoring, NLP, and analytics platform while helping evolve our process and product to delight users and drive business results for our customers. This is a hybrid position that will require basic experience with JavaScript and SQL, or a strong willingness to learn new skills in a “low code” environment. You’ll be part of our Customer Success and Implementation team, responsible for scoping, designing, launching, and optimizing our conversational experiences.

You will:

  • Assess use cases for automation - including the context, topics, and intents that define the conversation interaction, along with the associated utterances, entities, conditional logic, and conversational flow control patterns.
  • Understand and inform the technical integrations that support new conversational experiences.
  • Design consumer-facing conversational experiences that are contextual, optimized, and personalized.
  • Maintain “ownership” of in-market experiences and optimization process to drive increasing value for users and clients.
  • Translate customer needs and use cases into conversational UX that delivers on stated business objectives.
  • Develop conversational flow diagrams and all other creative prototyping assets.
  • Analyze user and interaction data to inform conversational designs and optimizations.
  • Partner with Sales, Customer Success and Engineering to guide the process of designing, deploying and maintaining the conversational experience.
  • Operate with a 'customer first' mindset and design customer-centric experiences to solve inbound inquiries via multiple channels.
  • Inform the Snaps product roadmap and support new product features through requirements gathering, testing and validation.
  • Stay up to date regarding current conversational design principles, technology capabilities, emerging trends, and competitive landscape.

You're a great fit if you:

  • Are familiar with conversational automation and messaging channels.
  • Possess strong analytical, problem-solving and technical skills.
  • Have experience with business process automation and rules-based logic to guide users
  • Display excellent written and verbal communication skills and love explaining new concepts to people.
  • Think strategically and prioritize action accordingly.
  • Can manage/organize information and processes to identify trends and extract key conclusions.
  • Are passionate and knowledgeable of customer experience best practices.
  • Show excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively.
  • Demonstrate the technical acumen for technical scoping, data analysis, APIs.
  • Have experience in a highly analytical and creative problem-solving role. (Business/Financial Analyst, UX Designer, CSM, Product Manager, Web Developer, etc)

Bonus Points

  • You’ve worked in the bot space or with Natural Language Processing.

Come work at Snaps!

  • Join us on our mission to transform the customer journey and own equity in the company.
  • Support for remote work through, and beyond, the duration of COVID-19
  • We offer the tangible perks you’d expect at a startup: snacks, meals, drinks, and Apple computers.
  • Quarterly team outings once we return to office; virtual events while we’re remote!
  • We are a diverse group of colleagues with backgrounds in design, anthropology, media, mathematics, music, psychology & technology.
  • Unlimited sick & vacation time, and an emphasis on a healthy work-life balance.
  • 401k, health, dental, vision, life insurance, Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA), Health Savings Accounts (HSA), and Commuter Benefits.
  • Annual offsite event: We love the Catskills!
Snaps is an equal opportunity employer. Individuals seeking employment at Snaps are considered without regards to race, sex, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, unemployment status, sexual orientation, or veteran status.

* No recruiters or third party solicitations will be considered. *

job.title: Product Designer
job.body:
EquityZen is an early-mid stage financial technology company, backed by leading venture and private equity investors. We’re looking for a talented Product Designer who is eager to lead our design efforts as we redefine private markets. Join us if you are a data-driven, creative problem solver with a passion for designing elegant user experiences and collaborating across multiple teams.

Our platform enables large, private companies to deliver liquidity to their shareholders while providing investors access to invest in these proven, pre-IPO companies. EquityZen has served over 200 pre-IPO technology companies and is proud to be considered a liquidity provider for 1 out of 2 of the largest unicorns. A testament to EquityZen's secure, paperless, and industry-defining online investment platform, we have successfully completed 14,000+ private placement transactions. Focusing on automating an antiquated offline process has allowed us to lead the charge in building more efficient, cost-effective, and transparent private markets. Watch this short video to learn more: equityzen.com/press.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

Discover insights, opportunities, and requirements while advocating for the best user experience and incrementally improving the product.
Rapidly create prototypes to test hypotheses with users to collect feedback.
Present your work to peers and leadership, asynchronous and in-person.
Promote best practices, a consistent look/feel, and ultimately champion the ideal usability over our portfolio of products.
Contribute to, and continually evolve, our design system.
Think and write about your process and document your decisions.

THE RIGHT STUFF

2+ years in a UX design role at a data-driven, consumer facing company
A strong eye for visual and interaction design with cross-platform experience (desktop, responsive mobile, native mobile, email)
Experience collaborating directly with PMs, engineers, business stakeholders, and end users to develop design concepts
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with both technical and non-technical team members
Highly skilled at creating both lo-fi and hi-fi wireframes as well as interactive prototypes for idea iteration and interaction design
A data-driven mentality with at least intermediate experience running experiments (e.g. A/B tests), researching user behavior, and analyzing data across analytical platforms (e.g. SQL, Excel, Kibana, Mixpanel, Google Analytics, and Optimizely)
Demonstrated experience improving conversion across various stages of the funnel
Good understanding of development languages for designing with technical implementation in mind (e.g. HTML and CSS, Javascript, React.js, and React Native)

BONUS POINTS IF YOU HAVE

Understanding of the financial services/FinTech industries or marketplace business models
Good understanding of development languages for designing with technical implementation in mind (e.g. HTML and CSS, Javascript, React.js, and React Native)
Experience sourcing, recruiting, and hiring other designers
Entrepreneurial experience and drive

Are you looking for a friendly, fast-paced workplace with an emphasis on helping customers and empowering its team members? Become part of our fantastic UX team at Snap Finance!

Snap Finance is a thriving leader in the financial services industry, and our team members are the foundation of our success. Snap knows that happy, empowered, and engaged team members are essential to innovation and business success- and our approach is working.

Snap Finance is seeking a UX Designer who can strengthen our dynamic and talented UX team. As a UX Designer, you will play a critical role in all phases of the design process. Why You'll Love It Here…

AWS MS Engineer - Remote / Telecommute

VoiceFoundry, a TTEC Digital LLC company, is seeking an AWS MS Engineer to join our Managed Services team. This is a remote role located in the US.

Why choose VoiceFoundry to enhance and broaden your career? We are just as passionate about the relentless pursuit of Customer Success by providing ideal solutions to solving our client's business problems by driving customer experience outcomes with our enhanced technical capabilities as you are. Whether you're the Engineer, Architect, Project Manager, Practice Leader or Sales Executive we need your talent to help us in our exciting journey to success!

What you'll be doing:

As part of our AWS MS Engineering team, you will work with our enterprise level clients providing medium to advanced troubleshooting support services in AWS Serverless Concepts and Services. Our engineers will work with established customers to maintain the recurring revenue center in business.

What you'll bring to us:

  • Works with a variety of clients and projects to maintain customer system performance
  • Builds and customizes new features in client systems, including web applications, reporting applications, and troubleshooting tools
  • Answers trouble tickets and provides guidance to customers via email, phone, and video conferences
  • Maintains and updates VoiceFoundry products and tools in an effort to improve and expand our offerings to clients

What skills you'll need:

  • Minimum 1-year experience writing and editing software using vanilla JavaScript, TypeScript, Python, and more specifically, the NodeJS framework.
  • Ability to troubleshoot malfunctioning systems, collaborate with customers and with teammates to solve problems without much guidance
  • Clear communication and a sense of urgency is important.
  • Curiosity is important in helping these engineers to determine the best way to build enhancements into client systems.

Who We Are:

We are passionate about the customer experience. With a deep legacy of over 30 years in the contact center environment, we have the expertise to help you navigate the key technologies in order to deliver an exceptional customer experience, leveraging all things AWS.

We specialize in the design and delivery of Amazon Connect, a cloud-based enterprise contact center solution used around the globe and are uniquely focused on helping businesses improve customer engagement, while maximizing the benefits of the cloud.

Our expertise is focused on AI & natural language automation, chatbots, CTI/CRM, enterprise integration, user experience design, analytics and workforce optimization. Combined with best practices and a proven methodology in deploying Amazon Connect, we have the right mix of expertise and innovative solutions to make your vision a reality

What We Offer:

job.title: Senior Member Technical Staff
job.body:
What you’ll be doing...

Our customers rely on us for the best network and customer experience. This position is responsible for resolving customer inquiries through our Core Bot platform, supporting content, and personalized Next Best Action recommendations/messaging while increasing digital adoption; transitioning calls/chats to digital self-service (DIY) interactions. As part of the National Customer Service Consumer Group, you will work on identifying the strategic direction, planning, and execution of digitally connected experiences powered by AI/ML-driven insights and leading technologies. The work you’ll do every day will help us create simple, customer-centric, digitally oriented customer, and employee experiences for our Home and Mobile customers.

As an intricate part of the Digital and Personalization Strategy and Operations team, you will be responsible for supporting this organization focusing on overall strategy implementation for digital and automation integration, cultural initiatives, agile implementation, quality control, and improvement & optimizing resource utilization. You will work with our partners within the Omni-channel Customer Experience and Digital Operations organization, Customer Service Operations, and Global Technology Solutions teams, ensuring Customer Service requirements are met within our Bot and automation solutions flow ensuring performance expectations are met. Your ability to communicate across all channels is an integral step towards the collaboration necessary in managing these projects.

  • Respond and adapt to a rapidly changing business environment.
  • Effectively communicate strategies and business objectives as well as project plans and expected outcomes to employees and stakeholders and provide regular progress updates to leadership appropriately escalating issues when necessary.
  • Leverage your thorough knowledge of business rules in customer scenarios, both standard and exceptions, to guide the development of customer experiences aligned with the Bot vision and strategy.
  • Leverage your analytical approach & customer experience focus to foster an environment of continuous improvement for all existing experiences (managing performance in order to meet and exceed all KPIs and business financial goals).
  • Strategy implementation across all channels, lead in-depth digital/automation current and future planning.
  • Agile Implementation effectiveness includes identifying learning opportunities to drive execution alignment with channel partners and communicating commitments to achieving on-time project delivery.
  • Actively participate and contribute to group dialog and activities, applying active listening and articulate user, business, and/or technical reasoning for detailed design decisions in critiques or presentations with the ability to incorporate feedback.
  • Work closely with onshore and offshore teams in coordinating the workflow relating to design, development, testing, process, and product release as well as leading ongoing quality/experience audits.
  • Proactively manage our organization's culture initiatives which includes all hands meeting design and execution, volunteer events, team activity coordination, daily communications as well as implementing team time savers such as project champions for meetings and creating a comprehensive repository for team notes.
  • Analyze new and review existing visuals to provide customized design, slides, documents and demonstrate solutions by developing supporting samples, templates, documentation, flowcharts, layouts, diagrams, charts, and maintaining dashboard models.
  • Work with large sets of data to build proper visualizations and setups for consumption by users that are diverse in their level of complex data comprehensionInterface solution.

What we’re looking for...

The Digital and Personalization Strategy and Operations organization is looking for someone who is a team player. Who thrives in a collaborative environment. You’re a detail-oriented, organized, motivated, efficient self-starter who can work effectively with a variety of stakeholders during a fast-paced environment. Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an effort to influence others towards a common goal or objective. Youare able to think and act both strategically and tactically with a sense of urgency when undertaking a variety of tasks. You’re self-driven to resolve problems and overcome hurdles using innovative approaches.

You’ll need to have:

  • Bachelor’s degree or four or more years of work experience.
  • Six or more years of relevant work experience.
  • Two or more years ofproject management experience.
  • Experience with G-Suite products such as sheets, forms, slides as well as Microsoft Excel (Pivot tables and charting) and PowerPoint.
  • Knowledge of Chabot systems such as AIM, Dialog Flow, MIRO, Tableau and processes.
  • Knowledge of Agile methodology.
  • Experience with effective written and verbal communications, organizational and keynote facilitation skills towards an executive audience (up to Director and VP level).
  • Experience in enhancing and creating team culture initiatives.
  • Experience with identifying gaps in resource utilization across all departments.
  • Experience leading the strategic planning process.

Even better if you have:

  • A degree.
  • Ability to comprehend and analyze business needs and designs to translate into technical requirements that meet the needs of the business.
  • PMP certification.
  • Knowledge of wireless products and services.
  • Experience evaluating training effectiveness and reporting outcomes to leadership.
  • Understanding of key initiatives that relate to business priorities with the experience in leading within the sphere of influence, motivating, resolving, and escalating effectively.
  • Experience with the use of graphical rendering solutions such as IBM Cognos, Adobe Suite Qlikview.

  • Proficiency with programming such as but not limited within Java, HTML, JavaScript, Webservices, ASP, XML, and SQL.

When you join Verizon

Verizon is a leading provider of technology, communications, information and entertainment products, transforming the way we connect across the globe. We’re a diverse network of people driven by our ambition and united in our shared purpose to shape a better future. Here, we have the ability to learn and grow at the speed of technology, and the space to create within every role. Together, we are moving the world forward – and you can too. Dream it. Build it. Do it here.

Diversity and Inclusion at Verizon

At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

job.title: Technical Project Manager
job.body:
Technical Project Manager

Linus Health is a Boston-area digital health company that seeks to harness AI to revolutionize the way people approach their brain health. We combine best-in-class neurocognitive and physiological measurement tools with advanced analytics to obtain a more nuanced and precise picture of individuals’ current brain health, as well as their likely trajectories — with the goal of recommending expert-driven interventions that can improve their health outcomes.

We are looking for candidates for the role of Technical Project Manager to coordinate our product, engineering, data and design teams to carry out fast-paced product development, engineering and analytics projects. We encourage you to apply for this position if you:

  • have a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, as well as 3-5 years of business experience, at least two of which should be in a software development environment
  • can coordinate and communicate effectively with team members to ensure tight adherence to project standards and timelines, as well as provide management with regular status updates
  • are technically proficient in matters related to project development and planning, software release management and version control
  • are equipped with the strong organizational skills needed to handle the ebb and flow of production launch schedules and to juggle competing priorities
  • have an eye for identifying metrics to track with the goal of improving processes
  • have the ability to thrive as part of a small, agile and fast-moving team
  • are self-motivated, take initiative and require minimal supervision
  • PMI Certification
  • familiarity with cloud hosting and deployment (AWS)
  • programming experience with Javascript and PYTHON
  • experience using Jira for project management.

Linus Health is pleased to provide the following:

  • an opportunity to work at a company at the leading edge of innovation in digital brain health and remote patient monitoring
  • competitive salary and benefits packages
  • an exciting, dynamic start-up atmosphere
  • a Boston-area based flexible work environment.

Full Job Description

Are you looking to join a growing organization? Ocean State Job Lot is seeking a Digital Designer! To apply, please visit our careers website oceanstatejoblot.com/careers-corporate-office

As an organization, we are keeping the safety of our teams a top priority. This role is currently remote due to COVID-19, however the role will be transitioned to a hybrid remote/in office role based out of our North Kingstown, RI headquarters. We look forward to being your employer of choice!

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Digital Designer is responsible for designing and leading the development of assets for use in all areas of digital marketing including but not limited to email, social media, digital display, and the OSJL website. This role is responsible for creating visually appealing assets that feature best practices for digital design. The Digital Designer displays extraordinary creative skills and works closely with other Marketing & Advertising colleagues and associates in other departments around the organization.
*
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Manage the day to day design and content of the company website
  • Develop and maintain all creative assets such as OSJL website, banners, and landing pages
  • Create wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps to effectively communicate interaction and design ideas
  • Develop and propose updates to content and graphics to maximize performance
  • Introduce new technology and best practices
  • Manage and archive digital assets to ensure channels have access to accurate digital content
  • Design and execute digital content for a variety of channels, including but not limited to email, digital display, social media, and mobile platforms
  • Establish, communicate internally, and promote design guidelines, best practices, and standards for all digital properties
  • Effectively collaborate with technical developers in the website department to ensure the the optimal user experience and interface are created

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:

  • 2-5 years digital design experience required
  • Associate’s or Bachelor’s degree in design or other relevant creative field required
  • Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio required
  • Digital website asset design experience required
  • Expert knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite required; WordPress and Constant Content preferred
  • Deep understanding of traditional and contemporary design standards required (typography, UX/UI, color theory, and brand communication)
  • Experience in creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and site maps required
  • Knowledge of current web trends, techniques, and technologies required
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript for rapid prototyping preferred
  • Motion graphic experience preferred
  • Proficient in Google platform (i.e. sites, slides, drive, docs, sheets)

ATTRIBUTES:

  • Effective Communicator: You possess strong oral and written communication skills and have the ability to build and maintain a culture of trust and respect. You enjoy working with customers and coworkers.
  • Creative: You display extraordinary creative skills.
  • Organized: You are a problem solver, detail oriented, and can easily multitask.
  • Team Oriented: You are capable of embracing the ideas of others (even if they conflict with your own) for the sake of the company and client.
  • Time Management: You understand project management and can work comfortably on all stages of projects including vision, planning, and execution. You prioritize and quickly execute high volume, high quality work across multiple projects at once, and can organize multiple projects around pressure and deadlines.
  • Self-motivated: You can work with a minimum amount of supervision and be capable of strategically prioritizing multiple tasks in a proactive manner. You understand the tools and processes needed to meet larger strategic initiatives.
  • Passionate: You must be passionate about online collaboration and ensuring our clients are successful; we love seeing hunger and ambition.

WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • Work primarily in a climate controlled environment with minimal safety/health hazard potential. Sedentary, and frequent near vision use for reading and computer use.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.

job.body:
Job Summary:

ProPoint Solutions is seeking a Software Engineer to help us build easy to use, highly performant and scalable mobile and cloud software solutions to meet the unique needs of business owners in the personal services industry. This is an opportunity to work in a growing and dynamic organization executing on a vision of transforming an entire industry’s decision-making capabilities.

We are looking for an exceptional candidate that has solid experience in React v16+ and other emerging and traditional technologies such as Node.js, GraphQL, HTML / HTML5, CSS, NoSQL databases, relational databases, and AWS/Cloud Infrastructure.

Note: Unfortunately we will not be able to provide visa sponsorship now or in the future

As a Software Engineer on our team you will:

  • Focus on developing user interface components and implementing them following well-known React.js workflows (such as Flux or Redux).
  • Use cutting-edge open-source frameworks, highly available GraphQL services and the newest techniques in Big Data
  • Coordinate with the team in design, build and delivery of full stack cloud solutions, hosted services and underlying software infrastructure
  • Work within and across Agile teams to design, develop, test, implement, and support technical solutions across an array of development tools and technologies
  • Bring a passion for learning, staying on top of tech trends, experimenting with and influencing the use of new technologies, and participating in internal & external technology communities
  • Manage and run AWS infrastructure, application servers, web servers, databases, batch jobs, file transfers, and monitoring tools
  • Work with stakeholders to understand desired application capabilities and testing scenarios
  • Continuously improve software engineering practices
  • Lead the craftsmanship, availability, resilience, and scalability of your solutions
  • Foster innovation, implementation of cutting-edge technologies, inclusion, outside-of-the-box thinking, teamwork, self-organization, and diversity

Required Skills/Abilities

  • Thorough understanding of React and its core principles
  • Strong experience in object oriented design & development
  • Expertise in writing and consuming web services
  • Ability to work within a team and as an individual contributor in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Ability to collaborate with others to accomplish great things
