job.title: Sr. UX Software Engineer
job.body:
ANCILE, makers of uPerform – the fastest and easiest solution to help enterprises and health care organizations rapidly create, manage and distribute software learning content, is looking for an experienced, passionate, Sr. UX Software Engineer who will be a member of the Software Development & Innovation Group (SDIG team) that manages the flagship product uPerform.

The ideal candidate will have substantial experience developing, testing, and maintaining high quality user experiences for software solutions by applying the principles of UX and agile development. The Sr. UX Software Engineer should possess excellent communication skills (both verbal and written) and can champion a developmental vision to meet and exceed ANCILE’s standards of quality and excellence.

We are most interested in hiring strong technology people with a can-do attitude!

Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Work within an agile development environment with other developers, UX designers, and product owners to scope, develop, and deliver world-class software products.
  • Contribute to UX team excellence including negotiating service interfaces to support the UI; choosing, reusing, and extending UI frameworks, components, and tools; prototyping, UX reviews, iteration, and refinement.
  • Contribute to agile team excellence including sprint planning, story refinement, sprint reviews and retrospectives.
  • Employ influence-based leadership while contributing to technology strategy in collaboration with the Corporate Architecture Group.
  • Support one or more applications by developing software, writing unit tests, and assisting with testing and test automation as necessary.

Required Skills:

  • 5-8 years of experience with and proficient in front-end development languages (e.g. HTML, CSS, and JavaScript), frameworks (e.g. Vue.js), and libraries (e.g. D3).
  • Working knowledge of interaction design and usability.
  • Working knowledge of accessibility standards and implementation.
  • Working knowledge of internationalization.
  • Agile experience.
  • Results-oriented mentality and superior problem-solving abilities
  • Attention to detail and “fit and finish”
  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot unfamiliar code bases.
  • Motivated self-starter, who is highly results driven, takes enormous pride in your work & demonstrates a high degree of enthusiasm for user experience, engineering excellence, and ongoing self-development.

Preferred Skills:

  • BS or MS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent
  • Disciplined with Test Driven Design
  • Experience with AWS
  • Recent experience with tools and methods for data analytics and visualization for healthcare and/or business applications
  • Experience with image/graphics production tools and technologies
  • Experience with educational technologies and instructional design
  • Experience with a CI/CD pipeline, specifically TeamCity

It's exciting to work for a company where innovation, passion and customer focus is at the core of the business. At ANCILE, we creatively explore new ideas, products, and processes – we are never satisfied with the status quo. In fact, we run our company with that principle in mind every day: One of our core values is innovation.

job.title: Front-end Developer
job.body:
FRONT-END SPECIALIST DEVELOPER



TLDR;
We're building something that's not easy, we need the best, you can work from home, we have an annual company trip, and you'll get a deep level of satisfaction. IC role, target is to build and deploy better looking Event management UIs then exist on the market and set a front-end standard for our company (http://www.blackthorn.io).

Location
Overlapping most EST hours

Report to
Director of Platform Engineering

Description
You're exceptional with building application front-ends with a keen eye for UI and UX. You're not a UI/UX designer, but you know a bad experience when you see one with ideas on how to correct them. You're a specialist. You can work with any front-end language, not just React vs Angular. You have a public profile of personal projects you've worked on, simply because you love it. You'll make magic happen with our Events app (https://appexchange.salesforce.com/listingDetail?listingId=a0N3A00000EX3qVUAT)'s attendee facing UIs, for responsive desktop/mobile and our forthcoming mobile app.

You're someone who'll try to do something even if it doesn't make sense all for the sake of comparison and feedback.

Your vision will guide the direction of our company. You should be a progressive and modern thinker.

Why is our work important
Our apps provide our customers what they're looking for with Events and Payments without being hard to set up. Most apps in our space take weeks to implement, ours take hours, and they work more flexibly, achieving significantly more functionality than our competitors.

Trajectory
IC (individual Contributor) or Management. We're a 28 person team growing quickly. We're at the precipice of the classic SaaS hockey stick growth chart and are now starting to scale, so those who produce will be able to define their own path. We deliver a bigger scope of your responsibilities then larger companies and your impact will be directly quantifiable to the success of the company and our customers.

Onboarding Process
You'll work with the our platform team to learn our stack and vision over the course of many months, but will be expected to begin contributing within a few days.


Relation of work to other departments
Your prime responsibility is owning the customer-facing front-end of application stack, primarily around our Events app. You'll work with everyone on the team in solutioning new features, testing with our success team, and will occasionally join customer calls for trickier testing and feature delivery.

What the job will bring you
Set a standard for our front-end. We'll be building new UIs for our products, focusing on our Events UIs, across multiple front-end languages, working with our now-hiring-for UI/UX designer. You'll have ownership over the front-end architecture, under the approval of our CTO.

Responsibilities

  • Build new and modify existing event interfaces. Lists, calendars, overviews/landing/detail pages, and new concepts. Example of today: https://events.blackthorn.io/1UDqJh6/
  • Work closely with our product team
  • Build anything else asked of you without ever just agreeing, always chime in with your opinion of what you're building and voice your technical approach. We're bringing you on to be our most senior front-end technical resource, so we'll look to you for following best practices.

Core Requirements

  • 2+ years of Angular 2+ with proof (Github or part of past work). Not AngularJS.
  • 10+ years as a developer
    • Experience with multiple programming languages
    • Experience working with multiple environments (Windows, Linux, MacOS)
  • 10+ years with HTML/CSS/Javascript
    • Clean and efficient HTML layouts
    • Extensive practical knowledge of CSS
    • Strong fundamentals in core Javascript language and Object Oriented Programming
  • 6+ years building UIs for software applications
  • 6+ years working with APIs
  • Git, Cucumber, Linting concepts, MEAN vs LAMP stacks, React and Angular are all either languages or concepts you've mastered and are now teaching others how to do better with

Personal Requirements

  • Excellent English written and oral communication
  • Detailed and organized
  • Happy working from home
  • Self-learner
  • Happy in a fast-paced environment
  • Ideally in the NYC Metro area, else will overlap all EST hours.

What We Offer

  • An incredible team of smart and supportive people
  • A deep feeling of satisfaction and completion
  • Work from home
  • Health insurance
  • Company trip

Benefits
401k, Healthcare, Maternity/Paternity Leave, Annual Company Trip

Stack
Cypress/Cucumber, Github, Angular, React, Heroku/AWS, Mongo + MySQL, REST APIs, Salesforce, VS Code (primary), Ionic

job.title: Front-end developer, Design Systems
job.body:
MURAL is on a mission to inspire and connect imagination workers globally.

MURAL is a digital workspace for visual collaboration that connects over 50 percent of Fortune 100 enterprises. Our platform and services enable innovative teams to think and collaborate visually to solve important problems. People benefit from MURAL's speed and ease of use in creating diagrams, which are popular in design thinking and agile methodologies, as well as tools to facilitate more impactful meetings and workshops.

Global enterprises including IBM, USAA, E-Trade, Intuit, SAP, Atlassian, Autodesk and GitHub have embraced visual collaboration to align their teams, plan in real-time, speed up decision making, reduce travel costs and accelerate a culture of innovation.

MURAL is headquartered in San Francisco and employs over 200 people working across six time zones around the world like Buenos Aires, Atlanta, and across Europe. We recently raised $118m in a series B round of financing, so we are ready to take MURAL to the next level.

YOUR MISSION

As a Front-end developer on the Design System team, you will support the mission of a community-driven environment for creating reusable and scalable user interface components. You will be joining a team dedicated to quality and innovation to create an inclusive experience for MURAL's users.

In this role, you will:

  • Build and test flexible components to meet the needs for reuse across teams
  • Look for opportunities to componentize existing UI features for contribution to the design system.
  • Ensure stability by providing testing and reviews of the design system's features
  • Support contribution and usage through technical documentation.

YOUR PROFILE

The top candidate will have the following skills:

  • Experience building and delivering reusable components using React
  • Participation with application teams integrating components in production environments
  • Enterprise-level development experience with HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript
  • Experience with web application development tools (Babel, Webpack)
  • Familiarity with testing technologies, unit tests, integration tests, UI tests (Mocha + Karma experience a significant plus)
  • Strong technical skills and problem-solving skills
  • Participate in maintaining documentation for frontend development
  • Ability and motivation to learn!

Nice to haves:

  • Experience with Nodejs, Storybook, TypeScript, and Sass
  • Experience implementing features that follow accessibility best practices and standards

WHAT WE OFFER

In addition to being part of our quest to help people empower their imagination, we offer:

  • Competitive salary and benefits
  • Flexible working hours
  • Ability to work remotely
  • Flexible time off
  • A phenomenal learning environment for you to develop

OUR VALUES

We bring people to our team that care about our mission to inspire and connect creative people globally, and who feel aligned with our values:

  • Make Others Successful
  • Adapt to Thrive
  • Show Up With a Smile
  • Generate Wows
  • Think Global
  • Play to Win and Have Fun

Practicing equality through imagination work.

MURAL is committed to creating diverse and inclusive workspaces where people can make a positive impact on the world and share their vision of how they achieve it. We are dedicated to working alongside multiple communities to help build this dream and bring it to life.

job.title: Solutions Engineer
job.body:
Our strong customer support team is a major reason why companies choose Heap as the source of truth for all their customer data and why our customers love us so much! We're looking to hire an experienced Solutions Engineer to help our customers understand our product and make the most of their data. Our customers use Heap to make important business decisions, and you'll be on the front line helping them, by answering their emails, building reports, leading trainings, and helping with implementation. You'll work closely with our customer success managers, sales, and product to advocate for our customers.

At Heap, this means you will:

  • Form close relationships with our customers. Our customers will consider you part of their team.
  • Become more knowledgeable about analytics infrastructure than anyone else. You will have complete context on our product and become an expert in the larger analytics space.
  • Communicate technical concepts clearly. You will convey sound data principles to a wide-range of audiences: product managers, marketers, data scientists, engineers and C-level executives.
  • Advocate for the best customer experience. Internally, you'll serve as the voice of our customers when defining product requirements with engineers or helping marketers educate the world about analytics.
  • Constantly iterate on our processes. You'll work cross-functionally and manage special projects internally to help Heap scale as fast as possible.

30/60/90 Day Plan

  • Within 30 days, you will:
    • Lead trainings for key customers
    • Answer hundreds of customer questions
    • Triage and prioritize bugs and feature requests
    • Act as internal support for our sales, marketing and engineering teams
  • Within 60 days, you will:
    • Understand Heap's infrastructure
    • Build custom dashboards for our customers
    • Become a champion at dogfooding Heap - you've written your first blog post to share the insights you've delivered internally!
  • Within 90 days, you will:
    • Know Heap like the back of your hand
    • Lead in-depth trainings for any person in any vertical
    • Come up with clever workarounds to push Heap to the limits
    • Help customers with every question, whether it is joining data in Heap SQL or analyzing data within the UI
    • Be able to point to the line of code that is causing bugs and write your own scripts to make the support team more efficient

Most importantly, you're an empathetic person who is comfortable with ambiguity and is an incredibly fast learner. As a strategic advisor for our customers, you'll face novel situations and provide expertise every day.

What we're looking for:

  • Experience with HTML, CSS, JS, SQL, and working with various APIs
  • A passion for helping people
  • (Bonus) Knowledge of the analytics market and data infrastructure

People are what make Heap awesome. Regardless of age, education, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, or any personal characteristics, we want everyone to feel welcome. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive equal opportunity workplace everyone can call home.

Heap has raised $95M in funding from NEA, Y Combinator, Menlo Ventures, SVAngel, Sam Altman, Garry Tan, Alexis Ohanian, Harj Taggar, Ram Shriram, and others. We offer plenty of awesome benefits, and we were named #1 on Glassdoor's Best Places to Work (SMB). We'd love to hear from you!

job.body:
Job details

Salary
$60 - $65 an hour
Job Type
Full-time
Contract
Number of hires for this role
2 to 4

Qualifications

  • Experience:

    • Power BI, Data Factory, SSIS & SSRS, 5 years (Required)

    • database software development , 6 years (Required)

    • Python, 3 years (Required)

    • UI Development, 3 years (Required)

Full Job Description

The ETL Developer will play a key role in the design, development, and testing phases of the SDLC process. Primary duties are to design, develop, and maintain ETL applications using ETL tools. Daily activities include a broad mix of designing and building ETL applications, integration with 3rd providing data and analysis on an ad hoc basis, troubleshooting reporting issues, performance tuning, and interacting with Data Modelers, third party vendors, and Business Analysts/Deliver Managers.

Duties / Responsibilities:
System Development: The ETL Developer will participate in the full project lifecycle in implementing new or enhancing application systems (both in-house and third vendor packages).

  • Performs systems design and analysis, develop code, and testing to ensure successful and seamless communication among the various IT systems users and applications components
  • Develop and support ETL Center of Excellence, ETL processes implementation, ongoing development, and operations.
  • Develop and execute Azure migration strategy for ETL/ELT processes
  • Early identification of development issues and corrective action to mitigate issues is required with these responsibilities.
  • Determine the best tool to develop and maintain the functional or reporting requirement using a ""best-of-the-breed"" development approach.
  • Respond to production troubles and user inquiries
  • Prepare and present technical concepts to internal audiences and management
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • Must be self-motivated and a team player

Knowledge / Skill Requirements:

  • 4+ years overall database software development experience
  • 3+ years of hands-on experience ETL/Data Integration tools (Power BI, Data Factory, SSIS & SSRS)
  • Excellent understanding of database fundamentals – SQL Experience (SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL), database design, and modeling principles
  • Experience in programming languages like Java, Scala, C#, Spark.
  • 2+ years of hands-on experience in scripting languages like python, R.
  • Proficient in one or more following skill sets: React.js, HTML5, CSS3, node.js, REST APIs, Machine learning.
  • Experience in using Microsoft Azure for Data and Analytics solutions (Azure Data Lake, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Analytics/ USQL, Azure Storage, Databricks
  • Excellent in ETL design skills as well as hands-on experience developing ETL mappings
  • Database optimizations and performance Tuning Experience
  • Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git, SVN, and Bitbucket etc.
  • Agile/Scrum/Iterative development methodology experience.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration and deployment
  • Strong communication skills and able to work well in a team setting
  • Ability to multi-task, work on many projects at once, delegate effectively
  • Proven ability to learn new technologies quickly
  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related area

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $60.00 - $65.00 per hour

Experience:

  • Power BI, Data Factory, SSIS & SSRS: 5 years (Required)
  • database software development : 6 years (Required)
  • Python: 3 years (Required)
  • UI Development: 3 years (Required)

job.title: Backend Software Engineer - Node.js
job.body:
Here at Mindera, we are continuously developing a fantastic team and would love it for you to join us. As a Backend Engineer you’ll be part of the development of core platform systems that expose data for desktop and mobile applications.

We’re looking for mid-level JavaScript Backend Engineers with at least 2 years of experience with an appetite for solving complex and interesting problems to world-class standards.

This job will be 100% remote due to the current COVID-19 restrictions.

We are not accepting C2C applications at this time.

Requirements

You’re great at

  • Vanilla JavaScript and/or TypeScript on the back end (Node.js, Heroku, AWS Elastic Beanstalk, AWS Lambda, etc.);
  • Developing performant, resilient and secure services/functions;
  • Protocols and architectural patterns like HTTP, REST and/or GraphQL;
  • Creating testable code and making testing a priority;
  • Being passionate, self-driven and working with little supervision towards a common team or company purpose.

It would be fantastic if you

  • Use code quality tools like linters, type checkers and static analysers;
  • Have experience working with SQL and NoSQL data stores;
  • Know about service oriented architectures, design patterns and data structures;
  • Are used to working with code versioning tools like Git in a continuous delivery process;
  • Care about all the steps your code goes through from your machine to production and know about or are curious of technologies like containers;
  • Are comfortable with agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban;


Experience

  • At least 2 years of Node.js experience and at least four years of overall development experience
  • Development of API clients for use in the browser;

Benefits

We offer

  • Fantastic working environment built on the principles of lean and self-organization;
  • Fun, happy and politics-free work culture;
  • Competitive salaries and benefits;
  • Potential to international travel;
  • Working with high profile clients in consultancy environment;
  • No dress code, corporate speak or middle managers.


About Mindera

At Mindera we use technology to build products we are proud of, with people we love.

Software Engineering Applications, including Web and Mobile, are at the core of what we do at Mindera.

We partner with our clients, to understand their product and deliver high performance, resilient and scalable software systems that create an impact in their users and businesses across the world.

You get to work with a bunch of great people, where the whole team owns the project together.

Our culture reflects our lean and self management attitude. We encourage our colleagues to take risks, make decisions, work in a collaborative way and talk to everyone to enhance communication.

We are proud of our work and we love to learn all and everything while navigating through an Agile, Lean and collaborative environment.

Check ot our Blog: http://mindera.com/ and our Handbook: http://tinyurl.com/zc599tr

Our offices are located: Porto, Portugal | Aveiro, Portugal | Coimbra, Portugal | Leicester, UK | San Diego, USA | San Francisco, USA | Chennai, India | Bengaluru, India

job.title: Full Stack Web Developer
job.body:
Gravy Analytics is disrupting the world of consumer intelligence. We are the only location-based consumer intelligence platform providing real-world information about the places people visit and the events they attend. Our mission is to be the largest and most accurate source of usable and trusted location intelligence that reveals how consumers live their daily lives. Understanding where people go and how they spend their time gives marketers and analysts unprecedented insight into consumer interests, preferences, and trends.


Gravy Analytics works with leading brands across industries – from finance to retail to professional sports - to provide market research, improve customer engagement, and generate more sales. Our location-powered solutions fuel ad targeting, customer relationship management, and competitive insights, enabling businesses to reach more prospective buyers, to better serve their customers throughout the life cycle, and to stay a step ahead of their competition. Processing billions of location signals daily, Gravy Analytics provides the essential data that powers many of our customers' proprietary solutions, as well as our own products and services.


Gravy Analytics is seeking a Web Developer to join our Web Applications team.


Responsibilities:

  • Actively participate in bi-weekly sprint planning meetings to provide estimates.
  • Actively participate in daily stand-up meetings.
  • Create technical design documentation, as needed, for solutions.
  • Work with the design team to implement logic and UI interactions per requirements and design guidelines.
  • Develop front and back end applications.
  • Review code for various applications.
  • Assist with automated E2E (End-to-end) test creation for front end work, write unit / function tests for back end work.
  • Debug and validate issue tickets and customer / user problems.
  • Assist with coordination of development and project documentation tasks.

Experience:

  • 6+ years of experience with frontend Javascript to include development frameworks like Angular, React and others. Most recent experience (2+ years) should be with TypeScript and Angular 7+.
  • 4+ years of experience with backend Javascript (NodeJS) and related technologies. Most recent experience (2+ years) should be with NodeJS 11+ and TypeScript on the backend. Experience with NestJS is a bonus.
  • 6+ years of experience with HTML, XML and CSS. Recent experience with frameworks like Angular Material and Bootstrap required.
  • 3+ years of general experience with database systems including SQL and No-SQL based systems. MongoDB experience required.
  • Must demonstrate understanding of REST principles and web API design. Experience with GraphQL is a plus.
  • Must demonstrate understanding of design patterns and general object-oriented programming.
  • Must demonstrate ability to build or participate in the building of large scale applications using the above patterns, programming style and frameworks.
    • Examples of large scale applications include high-availability portals for hundreds or more simultaneous users to applications which work with extremely large datasets ranging from 100,000 to 1,000,000 or more records displayed in the client browser.
  • Must demonstrate ability to identify and balance separation of application concerns and responsibilities between frontend and backend, i.e., when and how to leverage computational power of backend services to improve performance on the frontend while maintaining high-availability and a minimum increase to backend resources.
  • Experience using browser profiling tools and performance optimization tools strongly preferred.
  • Experience creating or participating in the creation of technical design documentation required. Experience with UML preferred.
  • Experience with javascript mapping libraries like Google Maps and MapBox required. Experience with other GIS libraries is a plus.
  • Experience with Agile project management practices (Scrum, Kanban) preferred.
  • Must be able to work with Git and be comfortable with tools like GitLab or GitHub.
  • Experience with Docker or Kubernetes is strongly preferred.
  • Experience with AWS solutions is a plus.
  • Must be familiar with common Linux command line utilities. Linux power user or admin experience is a plus.

job.title: Web UX/UI & Graphic Designer
job.body:
Company Description:
Oliver Gal was founded with a leading-edge spirit and an ambitious objective: to offer museum-quality art at a revolutionary price. With an ever-changing collection that caters to all tastes and allows everyone to dress their walls and home in products with rich imagery that they love and are passionate about. Our products can be seen daily in top online Retail sites as well as in high-end Furniture and Lifestyle stores all over the world.
We have been growing rapidly to include a team of energetic and super driven professionals that have access to a great work environment, generous work benefits, and cross-collaborative growth opportunities.
If you are looking to build a career, love to work in a casual, dynamic, creative environment, and enjoy working with fun, talented people, who are laser-focused on the company’s goals and who are naturally overachievers, then we are the company for you.
This opportunity is not for the faint of heart, but for the courageous few. We are growing at a fast pace and would like to be joined by those who do not fear change or the unknown. You were either born for this, or you were not. This isn’t a job, this is for passionate and fun people who are looking to build a long-term career with us and be a part of something larger than themselves.
Include salary requirements and resume for consideration!
What we are looking for:
The Web UX/UI and Graphic Designer (WGD) at The Oliver Gal is a talented visual brand storyteller responsible for creating high-quality marketing graphic materials, delivers impactful user interface designs aligned with the brand’s vision and marketing strategy. The WGD oversees conceptualizing original website design ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness as well as creating wireframes, storyboards, user flows, process flows, and sitemaps to communicate interaction and design ideas align to the brand image and UI/UX latest best practices.
The ideal WGD guarantees and ensures a clear and consistent brand message communication throughout the site and brand’s marketing visual content, with the ultimate goal of supporting our sales department’s marketing needs (Trade, Online) and contributing to our revenue and digital marketing goals.
If you are detail-oriented, highly motivated and a passionate brand ambassador, flexible and conscientious, independent, and creative thinker, with a positive “can-do” attitude, committed to working in a fast-paced and multi-tasking environment, and ready to embrace and live by The Oliver Gal's core values, then you are who we are looking for!
About the Job:
  • Responsible for email marketing campaigns, social media content, and marketing calendar creative direction
  • Manages the user interface and website updates to include the landing page, PDP design, site UI/UX design and updates, plus site experience improvements
  • Oversees the branding visual consistency supervision and graphic materials design
  • Responsible for paid search and paid social ads designs
  • Support with general administrative tasks and multiple reporting duties
What you’ll need to bring to the table:
  • Outstanding attention to detail and drive to deliver results
  • Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills
  • Strong understanding of graphic design, and visual communication
  • Strong portfolio and branding skills
  • Able to showcase your portfolio
  • Strong understanding of graphic design, and visual communication
  • Be extremely detailed and organized
  • Capable of multitasking, organizing, and prioritizing projects
  • Ability to work well with others in a collaborative and cooperative fashion
  • Strong graphic design principal background (typography, form, color, composition, imagery, etc.)
  • Ability to adapt to a changing environment
Education and Experience:
  • 3-5 years’ experience in a meaningful graphic design role
  • BA or BFA in Graphic Design and UX/UI design
  • Experience working with Salesforce Commerce Cloud is a plus
  • Proficient in Adobe Products: Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and Bridge
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript is a plus

Compensation & Benefits:

  • Full Time, Onsite [not remote work], Monday-Friday
  • Annual Salary & Performance-Based Bonus Plan
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package: 401K, Health Insurance, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays
  • Opportunities for Development
  • Amazing work environment

  • Centrally located near I-95 and Hollywood Blvd - Hollywood, FL

Overview:
InsuraMatch is looking to hire a versatile Systems Engineer to support a variety of applications, systems, and platforms that provide acquisition targeting, retention modeling projects, predictive analytics, call routing, data architecture, and in-depth data analyses. In this role, you will have a direct impact on the growth of this business and interact with senior executives and be part of a team driving the profit and customer growth of this growing insurance agency.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Actively participate as a member of the InsuraMatch team in collaborating, conceiving and developing scalable, performant, secure solutions
  • Support and contribute to the improvement of the development process
  • Provide tier one support for cloud and physical networks, servers, operating systems, and processes
  • Monitor, manage, and administer server-less, Linux, and Window computer platforms
  • Own critical aspects of our technology operations in areas including Production, deployment process automation, monitoring, and security
  • Provide expert level design and operational practices for AWS
  • Ensure alignment between security architecture frameworks, standards, and overall IT cloud strategy
  • Provide training on various cloud security and cloud technologies and mentor engineers on these topics
  • Create and maintain build scripts, templates and other artifacts for the Infrastructure stack
  • Support the migration of applications to the cloud infrastructure and assist in the analysis, tuning, and re-architecture when necessary to ensure adherence to business requirements

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelors/Masters degree in Computer Science or related discipline, or equivalent work or military experience
  • 2+ years of active systems administration
  • Familiar with Insurance product and services
  • System administration experience in UNIX/Linux and Windows environments
  • Demonstrated experience working with AWS to provide highly-available, secure, and reliable services that take advantage of AWS’s catalog of pre-existing solutions where possible

Required Skills

  • Exposure to the next generation AWS security stack
  • Ability to script in Python and Bash, ability to read Node.js
  • Understanding of SQL query and schema design
  • Familiarity with Serverless Computing principles and practices
  • Detail orientation - attention and desire to work on large data "crunching" projects.
  • Strong written and oral communication skills and a proven ability to communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • Creative thinker with the ability to synthesize information from various sources and apply that information to concrete business problems

Preferred Qualifications

  • AWS Solutions Architect and AWS Security Architect a plus
  • Deep experience with LAMP platforms
  • Expertise with MySQL relational databases
  • Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery
  • Experience moving platforms and services to server-less infrastructure
  • Knowledge of information security best practices
  • Exposure to PII regulations and controls

InsuraMatch, A Plymouth Rock company was created to help consumers make better, more confident decisions about insurance. We understand that insurance is not a one-size-fits-all type of product, so we tailor our recommendations to our customers’ individual needs. InsuraMatch is an independent insurance agent that represents many reputable insurance companies and offers consumers multiple insurance quotes when they shop with us. InsuraMatch has experienced an impressive growth trajectory – doubling our size and expanding our footprint nationally within the last two years

job.title: Full Stack Software Developer
job.body:
About Giant Media/VuePlanner

Our proprietary data targeting stack delivers effective and efficient video advertising campaigns across YouTube, outstream, instream and CTV environments.


Giant Media’s team of account managers, engineers, data scientists, operations and marketing specialists are experts at creating unique and innovative video distribution solutions for brands and agencies alike by using exclusive targeting that is data-centric, brand suitable and contextually-relevant. Brands such as Apple, Toyota, CitiBank and many more have had success with our comprehensive cross-format video solutions.


VuePlanner® is Giant Media’s proprietary technology that powers contextual, data-driven YouTube campaign performance through relevant content identification and quality scoring, pre-bid transparency, and ongoing placement monitoring. Using a combination of machine learning and human curation, VuePlanner produces custom video-level placement lists that integrate seamlessly with both the Google Ads and DV360 platforms.


We’re expanding our engineering team and are adding a Full Stack Software Developer. This role will report to the Sr. Software Engineer based in Kansas City.


What will you do?

The Full Stack Software Developer will work closely with other members of the engineering team to improve and expand our suite of products, and help us continue to innovate in the video and content analysis space. Primary duties include:

  • Developing Web Applications: At the core of every engineer’s job is building out web applications including our VuePlanner product - Dashboards, Video Units, Metrics & Analytics Products, and new products we haven’t released yet!
  • Developing High Scale Innovative Backend Services: Classification Systems, Forecasters, Performance Optimization Solutions
  • Engineering and supporting our Elasticsearch Clusters: You’ll be helping to keep our systems running and bug free as we continue to scale across new verticals and languages.
  • Designing Great User Interfaces: A large part of our Full Stack Developer position is the ability to work with a designer and implement user interfaces on top of our Web Applications using HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

What are we looking for?

  • 2-4 years developing web applications and REST APIs: coding skills in Java (or C#), Javascript, CSS/SASS, experience with Python is also a plus
  • Experience building web applications with SPA frameworks - preferably Angular, VueJS
  • Strong AWS Experience
  • Experience running and developing applications for Docker
  • Large-scale, distributed systems design and development experience with a strong understanding of scaling, performance and scheduling
  • Experience with Elasticsearch clusters and indexes
  • Familiarity with YouTube or large data APIs helpful
  • Bachelor’s in Computer Science or equivalent on-the-job experience
  • Experience designing and building complex web user interfaces a plus

The successful candidate will also demonstrate the following abilities:

  • Communication (written & oral): Must have strong interpersonal skills and the ability to establish, develop and maintain business relationships. Must also have the ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
  • Adaptability: Must love working on a variety of types of projects; demonstrate willingness to learn new things and take challenges head-on in a fast-paced environment with quickly shifting priorities.
  • Passion for technology: Must be excited for new technology and have a positive attitude towards solving real world challenges.
  • Results-Oriented and Data Driven: Must be a data driven decision maker who loves impacting the bottom line.

WHO WE ARE:

The current web3 lending stack gives users the ability to utilize the time-value of their assets through lending protocols like Compound and Aave. DefiHedge builds upon this infrastructure to provide access to previously unfacilitated financial tooling, decentralized interest-rate derivatives.

Interest-rate swaps represent an overwhelming majority of the world's trading volume and with their introduction DefiHedge provides users the ability to take fixed-rate and leveraged lending positions.

Started at EthDenver 2020 and incubated through Gitcoin Kernel, DefiHedge is a community project at its core. With the backing of world-class investors and angels, DefiHedge is looking to fill out its team of forward and independent thinking developers to push towards our initial release.

job.title: Product Software Engineer
job.body:
Job details

Job Type
Full-time

Full Job Description

Hi - we're Topaz Labs. We create AI-powered desktop software that solves photographers' biggest problems: think one-click noise reduction, super-simple masking, and pixel-perfect image upscaling. Our products are used by tens of thousands of paid customers every day, ranging from amateur photographers to major Hollywood movie studios.

We're looking for a Product Engineer to lead implementation for one of our core products. In this high-impact role, you'll work with R&D and design to build an exceptional user experience for our customers. You won't just own a small feature here - you'll lead implementation on a complete product for an obsessive customer base.

Core responsibilities

  • Own the implementation of the user experience and new features for our core photography products
  • Work closely with Design to create a beautiful and functional product
  • Become an expert in one or more technical AORs (plugins, third party libraries, deployment, testing, QA, etc)

This is a mid-level role for someone interested in a working with a high degree of impact and autonomy. The top "soft skills" we're looking for in this role are shipping mentality and work ethic, followed by grit and intellectual humility. As a product engineer, the core competencies of this role are good engineering sense (problem decomposition, architecture, and best practices) and good product sense (user empathy, UX, and UI).

We use QML and C++ to develop our apps. You do not need to be proficient in either to excel in this role, as long as you are willing to do what it takes to learn fast. Experience with JS frontend frameworks like React may be helpful, and experience with image/video processing is a huge plus.

We’re a small but mighty team of 17 experts in our respective fields from all over the world that have found a place to band together to do remarkable things. Come join us if you’re looking for creative autonomy and massive growth opportunity with a rapidly growing company. We’re also proud to offer performance bonus + profit sharing programs, 100% employee healthcare coverage, 15 days annual PTO, paid holidays, and 401k matching.

Job Type: Full-time

job.title: Senior Front End Engineer (Angular)
job.body:
Rhythm is a small, rapidly growing startup SaaS company based in Atlanta, GA. We've embraced the economic and technological benefits of serverless computing and a loosely coupled microservices architecture to deliver high quality, disruptive software to associations and nonprofits.

We are looking for an Angular 9+ developer responsible for developing and maintaining our next-generation user interface across 12+ "apps" on our platform. Our platform is built on AWS, serverless-first and consists of hundreds of Node.js microservices that run across thousands of AWS Lambda functions. With a loosely coupled architecture and aggressive unit, integration, and end-to-end testing coverage, each microservice is tied to a continuing integration & delivery pipeline that allows us to deploy to production dozens, sometimes hundreds, of times per day.


Your primary focus will be the development of Angular components for consumption by our customers and their members. Each "app" in our platform is a separate Angular project, and we use Angular libraries to codify reusable components across our platform. Each Angular application is tied to a CI/CD pipeline that builds that Angular app, runs Cypress automation tests and deploys it to an AWS CloudFront distribution automatically,


We want - no, we insist - that our engineers stay abreast of technological developments, join meetups, and attend one major technology conference every year.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Designing and developing new features and functionality using Angular
  • Integration of user-facing element with server logic designed by Node.js developers
  • If you're down for it - Node.js development on our microservices architecture to support your front-end work
  • Writing reusable, testable, and efficient code
  • Writing Cypress tests to automate user interface testing
  • Performing peer code reviews to ensure code meets quality standards
  • Consulting on new hires and providing feedback on capabilities of engineering applicants
  • Mentoring less experienced engineers
  • Staying up-to-date on new technology and best practices then spreading your knowledge to the rest of the team

Skills and Qualifications

So - is this job right for you?

For you - the ideal candidate - the answer is an easy one:

  • You hate the idea of grinding away on a legacy product built on decade-old technology
  • You want the freedom to solve problems the way you want: using the latest tools and techniques without being bound to a huge monolithic application
  • You want to work in a fast paced environment where you can deploy to production in minutes without a two-week long sprint process
  • You like working with customers and and creating customer joy through your work
  • You want to own your work all the way from design to production to the customer's hands
  • You have strong interpersonal skills and want to continuously improve through giving and receiving feedback
  • A slow, steady smile has spread across your face as you've been reading this

What are we looking for?

  • 6+ years of professional software development experience
  • 2+ years of experience developing solutions using Angular 2.x+
  • Deep experience with CSS, HTML, Javascript, and jQuery
  • Experience with Git/GitHub

Benefits

  • 80% reimbursement of COBRA from the previous employer
  • Medical: Aetna + Kaiser Permanente (16 different options) - 80% reimbursement
  • Dental: Aetna, MetLife, Guardian + Delta Dental (9 different options) - 80% reimbursement
  • Vision: Aetna + VSP (4 options) - 80% reimbursement
  • Life: Metlife (7 options)
  • Short & Long Term Disability
  • 401K/IRA

A bit more about us

Our north star - simple. Delight the customer.

Everything we do, every activity, every bonus plan, and every initiative - centers around creating child-like joy among our customers. Each of us works closely with our customers to deeply understand their needs and capture the nuance in their daily challenges. We use that knowledge to deliver the best, most intuitive experiences we can. What sets us apart is our ability to listen, learn, develop, and delight quickly and consistently. When a customer tells us they feel heard, we know we're on our game.

job.title: Web Designer - STAT
job.body:
About Us

STAT is an online media publication focused on finding and telling compelling stories about health, medicine, and scientific discovery. We attract and engage an influential audience of readers in the life sciences industry — from executives and scientists, to advertisers and professional services in the health care space. At five years old, STAT is a late-stage startup with a fast-paced environment, eager to continue growing it’s national and international reputation.


Job Summary

We’re looking for a Web Designer to join our growing Product team. This position will report to the Senior Product Designer and work closely with our engineering and marketing teams.

The ideal candidate is a user-centric designer who understands the importance of things like visual hierarchy, content-first, and minimalism when it comes to designing for the web. This person should be able to think strategically about an experience and how to best apply the STAT brand to create both a visually engaging and enjoyable experience for our users. In addition to helping in the creation of new site features and functionality, this person will also assist the marketing team with various promotional materials.

The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, process-friendly, and has the ability to work within tight timelines on multiple projects simultaneously. This individual excels at providing both data-driven as well as highly creative ideas to a design project. A firm understanding of modern user-centric design methodologies is a must.


Responsibilities

  • Create designs for new site features according to the product team’s product roadmap
  • Collaborate with the Senior Product Designer to strategize on new projects, receive feedback and iterate on designs
  • Create wireframes as needed, depending on the project
  • Work with the engineering team to review designs and provide direction as needed
  • Work with the marketing team to create various promotional materials, i.e. ads, email graphics, promo materials


Minimum Skills and Experience

  • 3+ years of design experience for websites and/or mobile applications
  • Exceptional design skills and attention to detail
  • Strong working knowledge of industry-standard design tools, i.e. Adobe Creative Cloud and UXPin (or similar)
  • Ability to create wireframes as well as visual design comps
  • A thorough understanding of UX best practices and trends in interaction design
  • A basic understanding of basic CSS/HTML
  • Can stay organized and meet deadlines on multiple projects at once
  • Self-directed and capable of working in a fast-paced environment
  • Has a willingness to adapt, be audience focused with a curious mindset and committed to creating an inclusive work environment

Bonus points for:

  • Practical experience with HTML, CSS, JQuery, and JavaScript
  • Strong knowledge of WordPress
  • Experience with scrum agile web development processes
  • Interest in journalism and life science and health news

EEO Statement:

Boston Globe Media is an equal employment opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, national origin, citizenship or any other protected characteristic. Boston Globe Media is committed to diversity in its most inclusive sense.

job.title: Manager of Technology - Data Science
job.body:
Are you a talented professional who excels at personalized service, enjoys getting involved in your communities and has a desire to work for an award-winning Bank?

Montecito Bank & Trust is seeking a full-time Manager of Technology/Data Science (MOTDS) to join our Technology department. The MOTDS will deliver a World Class Experience by leading the Network and Data Science departments in managing the Infrastructure and Data Science environment. The Manager of Technology/Data Science works with the Bank’s Director of Technology plan and implement the vision and strategy for Infrastructure and Data Science projects in support of the Bank’s core strategies.

Minimum Requirements, Activities & Responsibilities

  • High school diploma or equivalent required, Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • Minimum of five years to seven years of datacenter management required; experience in the financial industry is preferred
  • Experience leading and managing technical teams in highly available and secure environments
  • Requires a strong foundational knowledge of network, virtualization, server and storage design
  • Requires a strong foundational knowledge of current data and software development technologies (e.g., software engineering and source control, website and online banking user interface (UI) design and best practices; mobile as an information delivery channel; general knowledge of integration of digital services through APIs and SSO technologies, etc.)
  • Strong knowledge of web application and database security design and architecture
  • Knowledge of regulatory requirements (e.g. PCI, GLBA)

Essential Functions:

  • Research and recommend technology solutions to enhance the Bank’s internal infrastructure, staying abreast of industry trends and best practices in order to make recommendations and implement solutions
  • Maintain and upgrade existing technology deployments to add capacity, improve resiliency, increase performance, and strengthen security
  • Develop and maintain application server environment including version upgrades, security patches, and bug fixes
  • Oversee the backup and recovery infrastructure including system imaging, snapshots, replication, and offline
  • Automate and integrate systems to increase visibility into the technology infrastructure
  • Partner with key business unit leaders to educate and promote the use of technology as a competitive advantage. From that partnership identify key business use cases that will add tangible value to the business
  • Align data and engineering programs to a common corporate data model and a set of corporate data governance standards
  • Advocate for strong engineering and process best practices to make sure that Data is always accurate, timely, and a trusted source for business decisions
  • Other activities and duties as assigned.

Skills and Capabilities:

  • Ability to think and plan strategically while also executing tactical implementation of complex projects
  • Experience managing critical vendors (e.g. cloud computing, telecommunications, and financial applications)
  • Advanced knowledge of virtualization technologies; VMware/NetApp/Cisco preferred
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Windows Server, Linux, and *BSD
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Active Directory and Group Policy
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Exchange Server, SQL Server, and SharePoint
  • Strong knowledge of HTML, JavaScript, CSS
  • Strong knowledge of SQL databases & related technologies (e.g. SSIS)
  • Experience in a highly audited and regulated environment; ability to create complex documentation and reports for audiences of varying technical skill levels
  • Experience maintaining resilient infrastructure; in-depth knowledge of fault tolerant technologies and methods to increase availability
  • Advanced knowledge of data protection technologies e.g. replication, snapshots, versioning, and live system imaging; experience implementing a multilayered backup and recovery strategy
  • Ability to lead by example in a team setting and work independently while performing duties.
  • Current driver’s license and a vehicle with appropriate insurance coverage if required to drive in the course of performing assigned duties and responsibilities.
  • The incumbent must be able to perform this position safely, without endangering the health or safety to himself or herself or others.
  • Must be capable of regular, reliable and timely attendance.
  • The ability to adhere to safety rules and other reasonable regulations pertaining to the job.
  • Must be able to work effectively either independently or as part of a team.
  • Must be a self-starter, takes initiative, and able to multi-task in a fast paced environment
  • Demonstrate highest levels of customer service and confidentiality with internal and external customers.
  • Must be able to effectively handle multiple, simultaneous, and changing priorities.
  • Commitment to a Service oriented organization delivering a World Class Experience

Interested in applying? Visit our website at www.montecito.bank/careers

  • Review opening using the “Ways to Apply” tab on our Careers web page
  • Once you've selected desired position, click “Apply" on the top right-hand corner of the web page
  • Create a personal log-in to apply

The Lead UI/UX Designer for the University of Rochester Medical Center (URMC) executes and informs the conceptual and stylistic direction of public-facing web sites, mobile applications (apps) and other digital experience projects. A unified visual and functional approach, led by the Lead UI/UX Designer, provides users with a superb digital experience regardless of their point of entry. The Lead UI/UX Designer has successful experience working across departments with other designers, content specialists, application developers, marketing managers, and Web developers. Working within a team, the Lead UI/UX Designer recommends enterprise-wide solutions and strategies, leads approaches to Information Architecture (IA) and User Interface/Experience (UI/UX) design. The Lead UI/UX Designer is hands-on, proactive, possesses a passion for technology, and a strong desire to create digital experiences that users find functional and enjoyable.

Responsibilities:

Leads and manages comprehensive approaches to cross-platform design projects that emphasizes visual content, UI/UX, information architecture and branding:

  • Leads all aspects of the user experience (UX) design process including user research, information architecture, creating wireframes, mockups and interactive prototypes, soliciting and analyzing feedback, user testing, communicating design to developers and stakeholders, and conducting design reviews
  • Visually captures or represents user research artifacts (stakeholder maps, decision and information needs, roadmaps, domain workflows, etc.) to further critical thinking and communication both internally and externally
  • Facilitates brainstorming and/or design sessions
  • Leads projects collaboratively that align missions/goals of Marketing, Advancement, Public Relations, and other internal teams
  • Works closely with front-end developers and project manager to implement UI solutions and ensure the technology fully executes on the vision and requirements
  • Translates client needs and business requirements into design direction for large-scale web projects
  • Understands principles of Information Architecture (IA) and translates wireframes into designs effectively
  • Effectively communicates conceptual ideas, detailed designs, and design rationale both verbally and visually
  • Collaborates with web and application developers to create scalable interface designs
  • Successfully manages projects from conception to execution

Creates and maintains graphic elements within URMC and related:

  • Develops and continually audits the enterprise style guide (e.g., graphics, page layout, typography, interface design, graphics, etc.)
  • Maintains overall UI quality and design systems for consistency and ongoing improvement across all web experiences
  • Drives testing and Quality Assurance (QA) processes to maintain a solid user experience across the site
  • Demonstrates expert knowledge of UI/UX (user interface/experience) practices and methodologies
  • Monitors brand usage across multiple platforms

Documentation and Project Management:

  • Prioritizes tasks to meet project deadlines
  • Documents all projects in the PM system with sufficient detail and keeps projects up-to-date
  • Consistently meets project deadlines
  • Develops qualitative and quantitative measures for user experience and satisfaction
  • Uses data and research to evaluate the content/design impact, and plans for continuous improvement

Designs for cross-platform and cross-browser compatibility, ensuring ADA compliance, adherence to W3C web design guidelines and Section 508/WAI accessibility issues using an array of tools/languages to create and deploy web sites:

  • Monitors site for acceptable Accessibility and Usability Standards
  • Coaches fellow team members on best-practices related to web design and layout
  • Utilizes Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) to work with two-dimensional graphics that support interactivity and animation

Maintains updated knowledge of digital creative standards/technologies and emerging UX tools by attending seminars, classes, and conferences, reviewing current literature

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in related discipline such as Computer Science, Business, Mathematics, Statistics, Science or Engineering, and 4-5 years of related experience, preferably 2-3 years in a supervisory capacity; or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Web Design or Multimedia Design. 5-7 years related experience in graphic and interactive design or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Technical Skills:

  • Detailed experience in standard UX software such as UXPin, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, Balsamiq, Adobe XD, or JustInMind.
  • Detailed working knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud (e.g., Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign)
  • Strong working knowledge of front-end Web technologies/programming languages (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript, XSL, SVG)
  • Understands custom CSS and how design compositions translate to code
  • Experience interpreting third-party software reports and making recommends to comply with accessibility requirements
  • Experience designing for web sites supported by content management systems

Other skills:

  • Strong problem-solving skills, which may include creative solutions
  • Demonstrated leadership through expertise in a user experience subdomain (interaction design, information architecture, etc.), front-end development, or departmental expertise
  • Advanced knowledge of audience definition, persona development, user research, and user testing
  • Extensive design experience in responsive web, mobile, voice, and other forms of user experience
  • Experience organizing and leading user needs research interviews
  • Experience presenting cohesive user flows, storyboards, and wireframes to stakeholders
  • Demonstrated interest in continuous improvement of designs, principles of design, technology advancements, and business knowledge
  • An aptitude for aesthetics, user interface design, and graphics creation to compliment a solid technical background
  • Excellent interpersonal, service-oriented, analytical and writing skills; excellent communication and problem-solving skills
  • Ability to work collaboratively with department heads, faculty, staff, and other project leaders in a team-based environment as well as individually
  • Displays a willingness and flexibility to implement change as trends evolve
  • Must be a self-starter, motivated to take on new projects and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously
  • Solid organizational and time management skills
  • Effectively and professionally represents URMC Web Services capabilities at meetings and in all communications

How To Apply

job.title: Front End Solutions Engineer
job.body:
About Matrix Precise:

Matrix Precise Inc. is a Technology Development, Consulting and R&D Company. We provide solutions in the areas of facial recognition, smart retail, handwriting recognition, and smart robots. Our client services also entail a range of development and support solutions from web and mobile application development, infrastructure and production support and testing services. We offer very competitive compensation and benefits packages including health insurance and 401K.

Position Summary:

This position is for Front End Solutions Engineer (Web/ Mobile) who will be working on design and development of web/mobile applications. The individual will be responsible for developing web/ mobile applications and have a broad understanding of various coding methodologies, testing practices, and tools and know when to apply each method to achieve the desired outcomes. The ideal candidate must have extensive React experience, Microservices architecture experience, and iOS development experience. The individual must also display excellent written and oral skills with demonstrated interpersonal and organization abilities.

Responsibilities:

  • Architect, design, develop and deploy reactive, dynamic web solution both mobile and non-mobile platform for enabling and managing lifecycle of solution that helps deliver clinical care.
  • Strong in React, Node based development expected in microservices architecture framework using Docker/Kubernetes.
  • Mobile App development opportunity for IOS.
  • Work with Product Owner/Delivery Manager/Business Analysts to understand user stories, develop user solution mockups, user experience based on approved standards in Agile workflow.
  • Collaborate and interact with other core team and cross-functional teams to architect, design, develop, unit test, and release.
  • Developing across the full stack of Web technologies – Persistence, Services, Platform, Performances, and with a focus on great experiences
  • Develop Proof-of-Concept projects to validate new solution for web and native IOS platforms.
  • Demonstrate broad solutions technical leadership, impacting significant technical direction, exerting influence outside of the immediate team and driving change.

Qualifications:

  • Minimum 10 years of professional experience developing applications using latest Java, React, Node technologies.
  • 5+ Experience in event driven architecture and service orchestration, API management and secure, role-based solution development.
  • 3+ years of solid, hands on experience with ReactJS/Redux, Electron, JavaScript, REST API, SASS, Webpack, Node, Express, Docker, Docker-Compose, RabbitMQ, MongoDB, SOA, Jenkins, ECR
  • Proficient in building Web User Interface (UI) using HTML, DHTML, table less XHTML, CSS and JavaScript that follows W3C Web Standards and are browser compatible.
  • MySQL and MongoDB Database experience for leveraging and developing applications.
  • Ability to consume REST APIs and microservices. Development experience for secure REST APIs are a nice to have.
  • Converting user stories to UI/Front end user interaction flows with UX guidelines.
  • Adapt and adopt corporate UX design guidelines and templates.
  • Solid understanding of UI development including HTML/CSS, jQuery, and responsive design.
  • Understanding of messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, IBMMQ…etc.
  • Development using Docker EE and microservices.
  • Experience in defining new architectures and ability to drive an independent project from a sole front end developer as part of full stack team.
  • Experience in complete agile project life cycle activities on development and maintenance projects.
  • Knowledge and experience in developing software using Agile methodologies.
  • Demonstrated success in performing work and managing complex and/or large consulting projects.
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills; Ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical staff.
  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.

Preferred Skills:

  • IOS App development.
  • Knowledge of Caching systems and patterns - Redis, Memcached, etc.
  • Experience collaborating with cross functional teams of engineering/PM/Design with varying skill sets

This is a remote position.

This position will be open and accepting applications until 5 PM EST on January 24, 2021.

Some Federal contracts require U.S. citizenship to be eligible for employment.


Ad Hoc is a digital services company that helps the federal government better serve people. Our team of experts from across commercial industry and government brings the modern skills necessary to help agencies transform public services into digital services. Our work enables agencies to meet the needs of their users while closing the gap between consumer expectations and government.


Requirements

  • All work must be conducted within the U.S.
  • As a contractor to the federal government, all hires may be required to complete additional background screenings at the time of hire or any time thereafter as requested.
  • Our technical screening involves completing our homework assignments exclusively - we do not do any form of whiteboarding in our process. You can read more about our homework here.

What You'll Do

  • Use Node.js, Ruby, Go or other programming languages to build scalable back-end services that gracefully integrate with legacy systems
  • Build APIs that support both the digital services we deliver as well as third-party usage
  • Use unit and integration testing to ensure systems meet business need
  • Ship software that impacts the lives of millions of Americans

What You'll Bring

  • 2+ years of experience developing consumer-facing web applications, services, and APIs Programming in a major open source language, such as Ruby, Python, Go, Java, or JavaScript.
  • Understanding of the fundamental technologies of the web: HTTP, SSL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JSON
  • Proficient spelling, grammar, and communication skills.
  • Strong node.js experience
  • Experience and understanding of one or more different agile methodologies, including Scrum, XP, or SAFe.
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services, in particular EC2, S3, and RDS

Benefits

  • Company-subsidized Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Use What You Need Vacation Policy
  • 401K with employer match
  • Paid parental leave after one year of service
  • Continuing education/annual conference attendance stipend

Ad Hoc LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, age, pregnancy, disability, work-related injury, covered veteran status, political ideology, marital status, or any other factor that the law protects from employment discrimination.

job.title: Full-Stack Software Engineer
job.body:
WHO WE ARE:

The current web3 lending stack gives users the ability to utilize the time-value of their assets through lending protocols like Compound and Aave. DefiHedge builds upon this infrastructure to provide access to previously unfacilitated financial tooling, decentralized interest-rate derivatives.

Interest-rate swaps represent an overwhelming majority of the world's trading volume and with their introduction DefiHedge provides users the ability to take fixed-rate and leveraged lending positions.

Started at EthDenver 2020 and incubated through Gitcoin Kernel, DefiHedge is a community project at its core. With the backing of world-class investors and angels, DefiHedge is looking to fill out its team of forward and independent thinking developers to push towards our initial release.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Web3 connection & smart contract endpoint integration (Web3.js or Ethers.js)
  • REST API and database maintenance
  • Front-end <> Backend endpoint integration (React-Redux)
  • Cloud server deployment and instance management
  • Work across the entire stack (NodeJS, PostgreSQL, React-Redux) to build, test and ship high-throughput products on top of the DefiHedge Protocol

Requirements

REQUIREMENTS:

  • At least 5+ years experience working as a full-time developer
  • At least 3+ years experience with NodeJS
  • At least 1+ years experience with web3.js / ethers.js
  • You have a depth of technical experience and have demonstrated excellence through previous work
  • You have a high degree of autonomy and communicative ability, ensuring efficient collaboration with other team members

NICE TO HAVES:

  • 2+ years experience working with database architecture and deployment (PostgreSQL/MongoDB)
  • 1+ years experience with React frameworks
  • Familiarity with libp2p and DHT core concepts
  • You have worked on successful high throughput applications products in the finance or web3 space

Benefits

Fully-Remote

Healthcare

Equity

Full Job Description

Outside Integrated Media, the independent publisher of Outside Magazine and Outside Online, is looking for a front end developer/designer to join its development team. The ideal candidate is passionate about designing and implementing user-first, on-brand experiences on outsideonline.com conducive to great storytelling and audience retention. They are excited about using web design to increase user loyalty, and they focus on delivering excellent UI/UX that adheres to our brand guidelines. They design, write, review, and test code to maintain and iterate on site features, and are extremely attentive to detail to ensure that users across devices and browsers are served a consistent site experience.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Design, test, and build responsive user-first features with a commitment to usability, excellent site performance, scalability, page load, and accessibility
  • Create high-quality mockups, graphics, and visual elements; collaborate with both technical and non-technical internal stakeholders to bring designs to life on the site

Web Designer - Full Time

National Strategic Group is looking for a passionate, motivated website product manager to join our firm. In this role, you will oversee the development of client website projects, initiatives, and redesigns. We are a largely collaborative group that works together to tackle our clients’ needs. job.title: Enterprise Solutions Architect
job.body:
Udacity's mission is to power careers through tech education. We partner with leading technology companies to learn how technology is transforming industries, and teach the critical tech skills that companies are looking for in their workforce, such as artificial intelligence, machine learning, data science, and robotics. With our powerful and flexible digital education platform, even the busiest learners can prepare themselves to take on the most in-demand tech roles.

Udacity is looking for people to join our fast growing Enterprise team. Helping the Fortune 1000 to upskill their ever evolving workforce. If you love the challenge of a startup, and truly want to make a difference in the world, read on!

Udacity's online platform serves to educate companies' workforce with modern digital skills. As the Solutions Architect you will be responsible for guiding our enterprise Fortune 1000 prospects to invest in Udacity's learning solutions by championing Udacity and ensuring alignment of our programs and content with the customers desired business outcomes. As a Solutions Architect, you will partner closely with your Sales and Delivery team colleagues to understand our Enterprise customers' challenges in developing skills in emerging technologies, and prescribe a solution that delivers value for their businesses that comes by investing in Machine Learning, Analytics, Cloud, and other emerging technologies. You'll play a key role in closing sales opportunities and growing Udacity's revenues both with prospects and existing customers.

Successful candidates in this role will have previous experience in technical sales, consulting, and/or enterprise account management, and be comfortable presenting to Senior Executive audiences. Other valuable experience includes a working knowledge of the modern IT landscape in enterprise settings (e.g. software development lifecycle, cloud services, advanced analytics and machine learning).

Responsibilities:

  • Deeply understand Udacity's curriculum, especially in artificial intelligence, machine learning, data science, cloud and related technical topics.
  • Articulate Udacity's unique value proposition and ROI (return on investment) story to Technology and Business Leaders at Fortune 1000 enterprises.
  • Advise customers on the critical technical skills of today and tomorrow across data science, AI/ML, and other software development domains–mapping to the enterprises' top technology initiatives & business objectives.
  • Identify trends in emerging technology adoption across enterprises to inform new content creation.
  • Partner with our sales team to exceed sales quotas by helping customers act upon their upskilling initiatives.
  • Identify and build relationships with technical champions within our enterprise customer organizations.

What We Value:

  • 2+ years of pre-sales experience in IT solutions.
  • 1+ years of software development or data science experience.
  • Working knowledge or ability to code with one or more modern scripting languages (e.g. Python, JavaScript, etc) or popular programming languages (e.g. C/C++, Java) is required.
  • Broad familiarity with common enterprise technology stacks in software engineering, data science, artificial intelligence, and cloud ecosystems.
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills.
  • Experience with enterprise integrations such as Single Sign On (SSO), and REST APIs.
  • Experience selling learning solutions a plus, but not required.
  • Must have superior listening, questioning, collaboration and leadership skills.
  • Must be a curious, life-long learner.

You'll have an opportunity to earn options in a groundbreaking, fast growing, pre-IPO company. Travel will be required.

Consider applying if your experience is close to what we described above. We look for people with exceptional potential, as we know highest performing teams include people of diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences.

Udacity is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. We believe that the unique contributions of all Udacians is the driver of our success. To ensure that our products and culture continue to incorporate everyone's perspectives and experience we never discriminate on the basis of regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.
