job.title: Senior Software Engineer, IOS
job.body:
Physera has joined Omada Health! We’ve added our musculoskeletal solution to its suite of digital care programs for the prevention and self-management of diabetes, hypertension, and mental health. Omada will begin offering the musculoskeletal program immediately, making the company the most comprehensive provider of digital care in the market.
Physera is looking for an experienced, Senior iOS Software Engineer to join our growing team. We are looking for people to help bring new features to our current mobile apps as well as create new life-changing mobile products for our patients and users.
We hire creative people and give them the autonomy to do great work. Our software engineers are comfortable dealing with high-level specifications, working independently and in small teams, and are involved in the product process from cradle to adulthood.
The most important characteristic of our engineers is curiosity – we build software to help people with their health, and are bridging new ground every day. We need engineers who are excited to try new approaches and collectively learn the right approach to delivering the best health care experiences.
About you:
  • 5+ years of experience developing software, with at least 3 years working with Swift and iOS SDKs.
  • A solid understanding of the build toolchain for getting apps beta tested and into production.
  • A passion for mobile and you've worked on apps that are in the Apple App Store.
  • Curiosity and care more about solving problems than being right.
  • An interest in product design and good user experience instincts.
  • You love delighting users with going the extra mile.

Your impact:

  • Work with product managers, designers and an eclectic group of other engineers to craft delightfully unique and beautiful user experiences that will make our mobile solutions best in class.
  • Play a critical role in the software architecture, design, and development of our mobile apps.
  • Writing clean and well-tested code that allows us to keep our applications stable and easily modifiable.
  • Building new and fine-tuning existing application features.
  • Building and improving our continuous integration processes and automation.
  • Contribute to a knowledge-sharing and an open and collaborative work environment.

Bonus points for:

  • Built an app using the new SwiftUI framework.
  • You have dabbled in cross-platform mobile technologies such as React Native understand the trade offs, and have experience developing with ES6 Javascript.
  • Experience working with GraphQL and REST APIs.
  • Experience working in healthcare or another regulated industry.

Benefits:

  • Competitive salary
  • Stock options (extended post termination option exercise window for Omadans who are with us 3 years or more)
  • Flexible vacation to help you rest, recharge, and connect with loved ones
  • Generous parental leave
  • Health, dental, and vision insurance (and above market employer contributions)
  • 401k retirement savings plan
  • Stipend for professional development
  • Two giftable Omada enrollments per calendar year
  • Healthy snacks and meals
  • Wellness events (e.g. running club)
  • Community volunteering opportunities, plus one day off per year to volunteer
  • ...and more!

About Omada Health: Omada is a digital care program that empowers people to achieve their health goals through sustainable lifestyle change. Working primarily through health plans, employers, and integrated health systems, the company delivers personalized interventions for individuals at risk for, or dealing with, type 2 diabetes and hypertension, as well as anxiety and depression. Combining data-powered human coaching, connected devices, a proprietary technology platform, and curriculum tailored to an individual's specific conditions and circumstances, Omada has enrolled more than 300,000 participants to date. Omada partners include Cigna, Kaiser Permanente, Blue Cross Blue Shield Minnesota, and other leading health plans.

We carefully hire the best talent we can find, which means actively seeking diversity of beliefs, backgrounds, education, and ways of thinking. We strive to build an inclusive culture where differences are celebrated and leveraged to inform better design and business decisions. Omada is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, legally protected medical condition, family care status, military or veteran status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal laws.

job.title: Apigee Developer
job.body:
Infosys is seeking an Apigee Developer. As an Apigee Developer, you will be a key player in the consulting team that helps discover and define the problem statement, evaluates the solution options and makes recommendations. You will create detailed design, architecture and process artifacts and implement the deployment plan. You will also support knowledge transfer with the objective of providing value-adding consulting solutions that enable our clients to meet the changing needs of the global landscape

Required Qualifications:
  • Bachelor’s Degree or foreign equivalent, will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education
  • Atleast 2 years of Information Technology experience (preferably in Integration domain)
  • U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply. We are unable to sponsor at this time
  • Candidate must be located within commuting distance of Long Beach, CA or be willing to relocate to the area. This position may require travel

Preferred Qualifications:
  • Atleast 2 years of experience in IT industry (preferably in Integration domain)
  • Atleast 1 year of experience in designing and building proxy APIs on Apigee platform
  • Experience/Knowledge in Apigee On-Premises and private cloud Architecture
  • Knowledge on configuring API Security (Oauth, JWT, 2 way SSL etc.) on Apigee Edge
  • Able to understand client requirement and communicate technical solutions(Apigee) to customers, SMEs and architects
  • Design and develop API specifications using Swaggers and Open API Specification
  • Writing Open API spec and knowledge of smart docs and on boarding APIs to developer portal
  • Debug EDGE components. Linux skills for troubleshooting and making the server level changes.

  • Support the APIs through the entire lifecycle
  • Experience with design and development of REST API platform using APIGEE/APIM, converting web services from SOAP to REST or vice-versa
  • Build and create shared flows for Error Handling, Security and other scenarios as deemed necessary
  • Design and develop API platform to connect to various disparate backend systems for seamless data exchange
  • Experience with API security norms and conversant in common Internet technologies and protocols viz HTTPs, SSL, OAuth, REST, JSON, XML etc
  • Strong communication, strong troubleshooting skills
  • Ability to work and communicate effectively with program management
  • Ability to work independently and as a member of a team
  • Experience and desire to work in Global offshore/onshore model
  • Experience in Scripting technologies like Linux Shell scripting, Java script, Node JS
  • Experience with CI/CD tools like Git, Jenkins, Jira
  • Previous experience with Splunk and/or SonarQube
  • Experience with Agile-scrum methodology and test-driven development
  • Hands on Drupal for Dev Portal

The job may entail extensive travel. The job may also entail sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Candidates should be able to effectively communicate by telephone, email, and face to face.

About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.
With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.
To learn more about Infosys and see our ideas in action please visit us at www.Infosys.com

Job details

Job Type
Contract

Full Job Description

We are currently 100% remote due to COVID, and will set you up with all the necessary tools to perform the job from your home office until we return to work in our office.


Earnest empowers people with the financial capital they need to live better lives.

We're an accomplished team of technology, finance, and design geeks who believe consumer lending can be radically improved and are doing something about it. We are disrupting the trillion dollar student loan industry by redefining what it means to be creditworthy. We created a company that combines data science, streamlined design, and technology to:

  • Build products that simplify the lending process
  • Personalize loans to suit the needs of our customers
  • Engage with our customers through more human experiences

Our culture is one that values transparency and blameless problem-solving. Earnest has a strong track record of employee growth and career progression. Earnies are empathetic, product-focused, proactive, and curious.

As a Contract Senior Technical Recruiter at Earnest, you will report to the Head of Talent and you will:

  • Creatively source outstanding talent using a variety of channels and tools for our technical teams

job.title: Lumin Digital Sr. Software Engineer
job.body:
Join the people helping people.

For people drawn to serving others through their work, PSCU is a place to thrive, as we serve our credit union members best by taking care of each other first.

If you want to help shape an industry, challenge yourself, and invest in your own future, this is the place for you. PSCU is a highly accessible environment where you’re empowered to think on your feet, work from your heart, and discover the very best version of your professional and personal self. “Our Momentum. Your Moment.”

This application is the first step in seizing your moment.

Join our group of passionate software engineers developing cloud-based web applications using the latest technologies. The best candidates will have a love of technology and a drive to improve developer productivity through automation. We work closely with our product owners in an exciting and interactive agile development environment.

All Engineers are expected to be engaged throughout the full life cycle of the product including architecting, developing, documenting, troubleshooting, supporting, bug fixing, and more. The product is being developed in a microservice architecture using Node.js and TypeScript on the server side. This API will be accessed from an Angular client, smart phone apps, and various other systems. Our engineers can work on any or all of these pieces as needed which is a constant opportunity for learning.

We need Software Engineers that:

  • Have hands on experience working with large web applications
  • Know the value of modularity and keeping it simple
  • Use object oriented programming practices
  • Feel comfortable with relational databases
  • Love working as part of a strong team
  • Want to keep up on the latest technologies and drive innovation

job.title: Senior DevOps Engineer
job.body:
Neptune Retail Solutions is the nation’s premier retail marketing services company. We are experts at influencing buying behaviors through our disruptive, innovative, and results-oriented solutions, including in-store, home-delivered, and online media tactics combined with rich data and insights. Our powerful advertising and promotion programs are relied upon by the country’s largest consumer packaged goods manufacturers for an unparalleled consumer reach.

The DevOps Engineer will be responsible for instrumenting/developing end to end automation that includes CI/CD pipelines, cloud infrastructure setup to automate every facet of SDLC. Must be a go-getter with a desire to learn and excel in new and exciting cloud technologies with a passion for automation.


Responsibilities.

  • Develop CI/CD pipelines with Containerization to support automated deployments in multiple application environments including Dev, QA, UAT & Production.
  • Develop scalable cloud infrastructure following the best security practices with an emphasis on Infrastructure as code using Terraform/CloudFormation.
  • Support existing Technology stack for a variety of different solutions across several teams within the News America Marketing technology group.
  • Be a part of 24/7 On-call support for all systems with a focus on critical/crown jewel systems.
  • Develop Custom Deployment solutions implementing Chatbots methodology to automate routine functionalities
  • Triage, Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure & application issues

Qualifications.

  • 4+ Years in a DevOps Engineer role with experience including but not limited to LAMP, MEAN & Java stacks, and Linux Ecosystems.
  • Must be a team player with a desire to excel in DevOps tools and practices to improve the productivity of the Development Teams across the organization.
  • Proficient in all of the following AWS Services: IAM, S3, EC2, RDS, VPC & Networking, SNS/SQS, Lambda, Route 53, API Gateway, Elasticache, Cognito, Redshift,
  • Proficient in CI tools including Jenkins, CircleCI, Travis, AWS Code Pipeline.
  • Proficient and adept in running Docker in production with Container Orchestration including Amazon ECS, Kubernetes & Docker Swarm.
  • Experience with monitoring/alerting tools such as NewRelic, CloudWatch, DataDog, PagerDuty, AppDynamics.
  • Experience with Logging tools such as SumoLogic/Splunk/ELK Stack.
  • Development experience with Node.Js, PHP, Java, BASH & Python is preferred.
  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code using Terraform/CloudFormation
  • Experience setting up and basic administering of MYSQL, Postgres & NoSQL Databases.
  • Experience with GitHub/GitLab with industry-standard GitFlow processes.
  • Expertise in Linux Administration of different flavors including Ubuntu, Red Hat Linux, Oracle Linux, etc.
  • Experience with Configuration Management tools such as Ansible, salt, chef.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
  • Minimum of one AWS Certification among Associate or Professional level certifications on DevOps/SysOps, Solution Architect

job.title: Asset Manager Platform - Risk as a Service - Front End Developer - Associate
job.body:
CIB - Asset Management Platform - Front End Engineer, Risk & Trade Management - Assoc/VP

About J.P. Morgan

JPMorgan Chase & Co. (NYSE: JPM) is a leading global financial services firm with assets of $2.5 trillion and operations worldwide. The firm is a leader in investment banking, financial services for consumers and small business, commercial banking, financial transaction processing, and asset management. A component of the Dow Jones Industrial Average, JPMorgan Chase & Co. serves millions of consumers in the United States and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under its J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Information about JPMorgan Chase & Co. is available at www.jpmorganchase.com .

Who we are

The Asset Manager Platform organization within the Corporate and Investment Bank (CIB)'s Securities Services group is a newly formed business offering best-in-class digital solutions for our institutional client base across financial products and investment lifecycles. Our mission is to develop top-tier client-facing analytical services and enable our clients to achieve their business goals by extending J.P. Morgan's capabilities and expertise as the leader in financial services into the digital space.

The Opportunity

The candidate will join Risk as a Service, a leading entrepreneurial team, as a Front End Software Engineer and be responsible for developing one of its new flagship client-facing products. The product delivers a best-in-class real time risk analytics and trade management via multiple delivery channels, including web and mobile.

The candidate will work in an agile environment and partner with other engineers, product managers, and UX teams. Candidates do not necessarily need banking experience but must be highly motivated, with a track record of success. The ideal candidate will have a thorough understanding of web technologies used to build web applications using HTML5/JavaScript/TypeScript. Any experience with other languages or full-stack knowledge is a plus.

This is a technical role, and the candidate would also be driving the design of our components, mentoring other members and actively contributing to the development of features. Experience is expected in analysis/design, Agile methodologies, application and SDK development, optimization and performance tuning - plus working with business analysts, UX, testers as well as internal and external clients. The working environment is competitive and demanding but one where creativity and problem solving skills are rewarded.

You will:

  • Work on some of the most complex problems imaginable at the intersection of two dynamic industries: finance and technology
  • Be part of a new business initiative within JPM that will create a significant revenue stream for the firm and influence the commercialization and go-to-market strategy of the service
  • Actively collaborate with other highly skilled engineers and work on a fresh, cutting-edge codebase.
  • Influence decisions on market strategy, platform strategy, client engagement and implementing innovative technology-based solutions at the bank
  • Interact with other high-performing teams within JPM to inspire innovation and champion change throughout the bank

Skills and Experience

The successful candidate should have a Bachelors Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, mathematics, or a related field, or equivalent working experience.

Following technical skills are important:

  • ReactJS, HTML5 / CSS3, and related tooling and technologies
  • JavaScript, TypeScript; understanding of transpilation, BOM, DOM, and Virtual DOM
  • Async programming; Promises; WebComponents; Redux; RxJS
  • Git, GitLab/Bitbucket, or related version control systems; working in CI/CD environments
  • Node (server side and tooling); Selenium; Jenkins; Jest

Additionally, understanding of/experience with following is highly beneficial:

  • Data visualization (D3, HighCharts)
  • Data Grids (AG Grid)
  • Advanced React design patterns; data binding; web sockets. WASM
  • ADA/Web Accessibility

Further, the candidate should possess:

  • Proven track record of taking an idea from inception to delivery
  • Practical "work smart" mind-set geared to effectively and efficiently solving problems
  • Highly developed communication and partnership skills - attention to detail in written format and articulation in verbal format
  • Ability to execute multiple projects simultaneously and independently, while maintaining a high degree of communication and escalation at appropriate junctures
  • Commercially-focused and entrepreneurial spirit
  • Quick learner with strong attention to detail, strong work ethic
  • User-centered approach with a strong appreciation for usability and overall client experience.
JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans

job.title: Executive Director Cloud & Digital Enablement
job.body:
Company: Exelixis, Inc.
Job ID: 2759
Functional Area: Development
Position Type: Full-Time Regular
Experience Required: Not Indicated
Location: Alameda, CA
Department: Digital Transformation
Education Required: Not Indicated
Relocation Provided:

Position Description:
Exelixis has newly formed the Digital Transformation (DT) function to effectively support Exelixis’ rapid growth which is expected in the next 3 to 5 years. To support business functions in process simplification, automation and data-driven decision making, DT will introduce relevant technology products. DT products will aid in sustaining both organic and inorganic growth of Exelixis, increasing operational complexity of additional product launches, indications, capabilities, and geographies. Exec Dir – Cloud & Digital Enablement will focus on cloud, web and mobile product design, development and maturity of AWS cloud, enabling relevant AWS services & tools, capabilities and platforms in close collaboration with Digital Transformation leadership team, business partners and business leaders at Exelixis. This leader will establish an agile, reliable, scalable, sustainable, compliant, secure and cost-effective cloud platform for business to innovate and advance. These tools and platforms are aimed enhance digital dexterity of the functions through simple to use user interfaces.

The ideal technology leader for Cloud & Digital Enablement functions will lead Cloud & Digital Enablement vision, product design, development, project, resource and portfolio management to allow Exelixis functions scale, promote faster and more informed data-driven business decisions, and optimize human resource levels and allocation.

The Executive Director of Cloud & Digital Enablement will actively collaborate with key stakeholders to determine scope and nature of business requirements and priorities to consider for the product engineering. The ideal candidate will be actively involved in identification, evaluation, selection, implementation, ongoing administration and improvement of Cloud & Digital Enablement products, platforms, procedures, and culture to execute the defined vision and product roadmap.

The ideal candidate will be an experienced technology leader with in-depth understanding of transactional data, master data, metadata, data governance, data lineage, data life-cycle policies, data vs. information vs. insight, etc. Cloud & Digital Enablement leader leverages this knowledge to establish a compelling vision & strategy to establish trust in data and in results and will enable rapid reporting and insights to the right personas at right time to help Exelixis continue to stay close to our patients and maintain its leadership in Oncology drug development & commercialization.

Position Requirements:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Evaluate, identify and support Cloud & Digital Enablement processes, technologies and tools to support Digital Transformation and business functions.
  • Establish a comprehensive vision and strategy for establishing a digital technology ecosystem for cloud, web and mobile design & development.
  • Build collaborative partnerships with product owners, infrastructure & operations, security to identify opportunities for digital tools enablement and process improvements
  • Establish a robust software development life cycle and process that includes requirements definition, resource and schedule estimation, sprint execution, and feature rollouts
  • Demonstrate strong engineering, leadership, and organizational development skills to drive application delivery, process improvement, for cloud, web and mobile development
  • Enforce risk-mitigation planning to proactively address technical risks including but not limited to coding standards, environment standards, static code analysis, secure coding practices, and security verification
  • Participate in defining and designing the Digital Transformation technology vision and roadmap for the department and for Exelixis at large.
  • Inspire and lead the day-to-day development efforts with multiple 3rd party contractor and service providers
  • Grow an exceptional engineering team that delivers with velocity and quality.
  • Support and enforce the use of standards, procedures, best practices, and methodologies for cloud, web and mobile development
  • Drive Exelixis cloud and web technology offerings, through innovation and establish a cloud-first strategy & mindset with critical business functions
  • Establish Cloud & Digital Enablement steering committee to prioritize new features, enhancements that contribute to the product backlog and to the technology roadmap
  • Partner with business leaders in establishing a comprehensive vision and create governance councils for master-data management; KPI/metrics management; innovation lab for new technology introductions and to develop a fail-fast culture; etc.
  • Establish operating policies and procedures for multi-domain master data management (e.g., data model, data catalog, business glossary, and data cleansing), data stewardship, security constraints, and dependency rules
  • Partner with the Program Management Office (PMO) to provide timely status updates on product releases and established business priorities to Exelixis executive leadership team, Cloud & Digital Enablement steering committee.
  • Build an effective team with dedicated, expert resources and lead team output to deliver expected outcomes for Cloud & Digital Enablement organization.
  • Identify risks and drive continuous improvements in Cloud & Digital Enablement products and tools through technological innovation, operational improvement, and championing adoption.
  • Act as strong advocate for the advancement and adoption of new products, capabilities and technologies; educate internal stakeholders on the advantages of cloud computing.
  • Partner across the enterprise to drive alignment on cloud, web and mobile platforms and technologies.
  • Maintain in-depth industry knowledge.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Yes. Will lead efforts to build internal expertise and staff Cloud, web and mobile product / engineering teams.

EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/SKILLS:
Education:
  • BS/BA degree in related discipline and 18 years of related experience; or,
  • MS/MBA degree in related discipline and 16 years of related experience; or,
  • PhD in related discipline and 14 years of related experience, or;
  • Equivalent combination of education and experience.

Experience:
  • Typically requires a minimum of 22 years of related experience or the equivalent combination of experience and education/training.
  • Experience is required in the areas of cloud computing, web and mobile development technologies, defining strategy, product design, engineering, for the respective functions.
  • Experience in Biotech/Pharma with emphasis on cloud, web and mobile is nice to have

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:
  • Requires deep understanding and high domain expertise of Cloud & Digital Enablement processes, tools and industry benchmarking data.
  • Must be proficient on aws products and services including computing, storage, networking, database, analytics, application services, deployment, management, mobile, developer tools, and tools for the AI/ML/RPA/IoT
  • Significant experience working in an Agile development organization and must have the ability to lead others to mature this methodology across a growing organization.
  • Experience with iOS and Android app development.
  • Strong knowledge in HIPAA, PII, EU Data Sovereignty and Privacy, and other compliance metrics along with ISO 9000 and other quality assurance metrics and capable of implementing them on cloud in a fast-growing Exelixis cloud environment.
  • Strong knowledge is required with a range of aws services such as S3, EC2, Lambda, Glacier, SNS, CloudFront, EBS, Kinesis, VPC, SQS, Redshift, Glue, etc.
  • Strong knowledge of one of the web development methods such as Angular.js, React.js, or Spring
  • Working experience / knowledge with React Native or JQuery Mobile or Mobile Angular UI
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver large, complex, cloud programs involving system and process reengineering and integration.
  • Proven ability to collaborate with senior functional leaders to set vision, drive innovation and facilitate transformation to meet evolving business needs and priorities.
  • Applies strong analytical and business communication skills.

JOB COMPLEXITY:
  • Guides the successful completion of major programs, projects and/or functions.
  • Leads or manages the work of others by providing guidance to subordinates or teams based on organizational goals and company policy, with responsibility for results, including costs, methods and staffing.
  • Interprets, executes and recommends modifications to companywide policies and/or divisional programs. May establish organizational policies in a major segment of the company.
  • Has extensive knowledge of other related disciplines.

#LI-JD1

job.title: Lead Web Development Engineer
job.body:
As the Lead Web Development Engineer for Bezos Academy, you will be the first software engineering member of our organization. If a problem can be solved with code, particularly on the web, you will figure it out. As someone who keeps things simple, you will find the easiest and most maintainable way to solve our needs. As an experienced engineer, reporting directly to the Head of Technology, you will work independently without needing much direction. You will join us while we are literally at Day 1 of starting software development in our school system and will help us make decisions which will impact our organization for years to come.

You will help us build functionality into our website, build integrations between SAS providers, and pull reports from government organizations and combine them in useful ways. As we are operating in a startup environment, you will focus on immediate needs (e.g. updating our Wordpress environment, handing our Head of Education a CSV file he needs), as well as longer-term strategic needs (e.g. designing a parent communication hub or a teacher training portal).

You bring excellent communication skills, ability to operate independently, and willingness to work through ambiguity to contribute both now and as we scale. Above all, you share our passion for mission of expanding access to high quality, Montessori-inspired preschools in underserved communities.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

  • 8 or more years of technology experience in a software development role
  • Web application design and development experience
  • Experience with Javascript, CSS, and modern web technologies
  • Experience with backend software development (examples include C++, Java, etc.)
  • Ability to speak, read, and write English fluently

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Proven ability to solve difficult technical and UX problems involving a great deal of ambiguity
  • Comfort and confidence working independently with senior leadership
  • Experience optimizing web performance, strong judgment around when to use progressive rendering and asynchronous loading, and knowledge of media optimization and lazy loading of assets
  • Familiarity with a broad range of common programming languages and frameworks
  • Excellent technical, communication, customer service, and interpersonal skills
  • Demonstrated expertise regarding information security and best practices regarding data privacy
  • History of writing policy and maintaining strong documentation
  • Prior experience with AWS services, Microsoft 365, Azure, and Wordpress

Bezos Academy participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with employee Form I-9 Information to confirm authorization to work in the U.S. Bezos Academy only uses E-Verify once a candidate has accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. If E-Verify cannot confirm that an employee is authorized to work, Bezos Academy will give the employee written instructions and an opportunity to contact the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so the employee can begin to resolve the issue before any adverse employment action is taken. For more information about your right to work, please see the Notice of Right to Work.

job.title: Senior Program Manager, Data
job.body:
Company Description

Publicis Sapient is a digital transformation partner helping established organizations get to their future, digitally-enabled state, both in the way they work and the way they serve their customers. We help unlock value through a start-up mindset and modern methods, fusing strategy, consulting and customer experience with agile engineering and problem-solving creativity. United by our core values and our purpose of helping people thrive in the brave pursuit of next, our 20,000+ people in 53 offices around the world combine experience across technology, data sciences, consulting and customer obsession to accelerate our clients’ businesses through designing the products and services their customers truly value.


Job Description
As a Project Manager at Publics Sapient, you will partner with clients undertaking major digital business or engineering transformation engagements. You will work within a cross-functional, globally distributed team to lead the planning, estimation, and delivery of client projects and programs.

Your Impact:
  • Plan, document, and implement the optimal team structure (roles, people, expertise) to ensure high-quality delivery, exceeding client expectations and achieving established goals
  • Lead teams to successfully deliver customer experience and engineering solutions leading to client business value
  • Identify and realize business outcomes through the use of the most suitable and effective project management approach, methods, processes, and tools to ensure a high degree of delivery and solution quality
  • Support clients’ business objectives by delivering experience and engineering solutions, including experience management, ecommerce, customer data, cloud, and microservice platforms
  • Enact lasting changes to the client’s ways of working by utilizing a consultative approach that focuses on defining and measuring customer value delivered at each milestone
  • Organize and lead ongoing team planning sessions to identify key risks, issues, and dependencies across workstreams
  • Optimize delivery within a project or program through insights and mitigation strategies for project risk management
  • Guide internal leaders and external senior stakeholders on program delivery methods ceremonies and protocols to streamline and structure workflow to deliver timely results
  • Articulate and manage engagement commercial metrics including client outcomes, leakage, burn rate, revenue and margins etc. to support account health and account-level planning within the industry vertical

Background:
  • Ability to effectively communicate and collaborate with all levels of the organization to achieve broader insights into managing work streams and outcomes
  • Capable of earning trust and influencing stakeholders without formal authority to required results
  • Proficient with collaboration tools including Atlassian Jira and Confluence, and Microsoft Office applications.
  • Flexible, collaborative, and able to manage and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously to maintain teamwork and optimal project flow
  • Experience managing and contributing to sales proposals by collaborating and negotiating with multi-disciplinary teams to shape a cohesive delivery approach, team shape, and cost estimates to deliver transformative value driven proposals
  • Experience working with Agile delivery methods like Scrum and Kanban, waterfall and hybrid systems
  • Experience leading teams to implement digital technologies such as atomic and responsive design, experience management platforms, cloud platforms, DevOps, AI and Data Platforms
  • Ability to travel frequently
Set Yourself Apart With:
  • Experience in writing, reviewing, and finalizing statements of work
  • Scrum, Product or SaFe Certification
  • Conference speaking engagements such as events/blogs/thought leadership within different industry verticals
  • Understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, React, or Swift
  • Relevant experience at a digital agency or consultancy leading cross functional, multi-disciplinary teams to deliver exceptional digital experiences

Tip for Success:
You are an exceptional digital Project Manager that is always one step ahead of the game. You are a solution-based thinker and ‘doer’ that has a clear understanding of the agile methods and tools required to deliver outstanding digital products and services.

Qualifications

Additional Information

As part of our dedication to an inclusive and diverse workforce, Publicis Sapient is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity without regard for race, color, national origin, ethnicity, gender, protected veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or religion. We are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at hiring@publicissapient.com or you may call us at +1-617-621-0200.

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

job.title: Learning Management System Technologist
job.body:
Description:

The Learning Management System Technologist will help us reimagine our online learning space and will be accountable for supporting all aspects of the member experience on the Virtual Learning Platform (VLP). This position will collaborate across Employers Council and work with subject matter experts to execute design concepts that support the development, build-out and launch of Employers Council branded online courses.


As a critical member of the Corporate Training and Events team, The LMS Technologist provides technical leadership in service of the larger organizational vision of the Director of Corporate Training & Events and the Learning and Development Manager through the virtual platform and administration of the LMS. Moreover, this person is an outside of the box, technical guru who can use data analysis processes and metrics to efficiently and effectively administer all learning through the platform and report on the evolving user experience central to the organizational mission that is focused on Employers Council members. Additionally, the Learning Technologist will work closely with other members of the team through a thoughtful, holistic approach to assessing, prioritizing, and evaluating learning technology requirements and push team members to be on the cutting edge of the user experience (UX) when it comes to technology, data and the LMS.

Above all, you are savvy and bring both technical acumen and creativity in offering us options to do things in ways we hadn’t thought of. On one hand, you are the first line for all technical requests, tickets and customer correspondences attached to the LMS, analytics/ metrics, reporting and learning solutions. On the other you can offer ideas and contribute a point of view about evolving best practices, current trends in the field and technology based learning solutions. By creating a seamless, branded and consistent experience for users through your technological expertise in administering the platform, this position will be responsible for the support, design, development, implementation, delivery, and maintenance of content, assets, and other resources used for instructional functions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

  • Administer day-to-day operational management of LMS through the creation/scheduling of new courses/classes and eLearning content testing
  • Communicate effectively with customers around their needs and explain technical solutions to audiences who may not have the same technological know-how
  • Responsible for the overall system set up, delivery, deployment and daily management of the LMS system to ensure an efficient and effective delivery of content to learners
  • Manage tasks associated with the Learning Management System (LMS) including managing course enrollment; progress tracking; system adaptation; administering updates to courses
  • Manage all user experience (UX) needs on the VLP; collect and analyze user feedback and communicate key issues arising to leadership; and troubleshoot flagged requests/issues/tickets
  • Generate standard and custom reports using translatable and measured metrics through data collection, analysis; able to query data from a database of user/course information
  • Manage relationships with third party vendors
  • Expert in data and metrics methodologies; measure and evaluate effectiveness of learning program curricula and learning solutions; communicates/implements new and emerging trends
  • Demonstrate enthusiasm for branding and marketing learning products and understands concepts like click-through rate or introduce other measurements for online learning businesses
  • Ensure the learning infrastructure meets departmental goals and supports organizational needs, operational efficiency, and can scale with the future growth of our business
  • Demonstrate understanding of technical constraints and opportunities, exhibit demonstrable skills with programming in modern technologies;
  • Familiarity with learning technology systems and protocols
  • Ability to create a competitive, cutting edge, intuitive user experience
  • Acquire and maintain knowledge of current technology as it applies to LMS software and systems
  • Recommend technology solutions and participates in technology selection
  • Research technology trends and platforms to enhance our learning programs; report/present
  • Expert in backend computing like database management, hardware integration and security
  • Work with Corporate Training Director and Learning & Development Manager and other stakeholders around the program roadmap to ensure that courses are delivered into the LMS and made available to learners in a timely manner; be consistent and reliable
  • Continually evaluates the LMS and advocates for updates, performance upgrades and systems integration as necessary
  • Deliver digital assets per a program/course development schedule

Core Competencies

  • Adaptability – Responds to change with a willingness and ability to learn new ways of working. Adapts approach and demeanor in real time to match the shifting demands of different situations. Demonstrates a gusto and excitement for reimagining ways to learn online.
  • Imagination – Demonstrates a gusto and excitement for reimagining ways to learn online and become a flagship leader in industry standards by thinking outside of the box.
  • Communication – Develops and delivers communication that conveys a clear understanding of the unique needs of different audiences. Listens to others and allows them to make their point.
  • Organizational Support – Is keenly aware of the time frame in which tasks or projects needs to be done; accepts and mirrors the level of urgency conveyed by the manager or customer being served; puts first priority on the needs of the organization or the needs of its customers. Fosters collaboration and teamwork across the Institution.
  • Technological Savvy – Executes macro and micro organizational goals and vision using technical skills, expertise and tangible data driven results to support the user experience.
. Requirements:

Qualifications/Education

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

  • Minimum of 3-5 years’ experience as an LMS technologist or in similar position that provides a know-how on the front line as a technical expert and support representative
  • Knowledge of online course design and development and interest in leading tech industry development trends, cutting edge learning technologies and solutions emerging in the field
  • Understands technical constraints and opportunities as a problem solver and time manager
  • Ability to create and speak to a world class, 21st century user experience by utilizing data and metrics in a translatable manner to the team and organization at large
  • Ability to develop courses through collaboration and project management coordination with subject matter experts as well as a film and production team across all Employers Council regions
  • Can execute projects in Instructional Design software applications and implement e-learning tools such as: Articulate 360 (Storyline/ Rise), Adobe Captivate/ Spark, iSpring Suite and can articulate strategy for utilizing new e-learning technologies as they emerge
  • Understand how to integrate video lessons into the broader, branded virtual learning experience
  • Understand the capabilities and limits of video/moving images from a technological side as well as an engagement with story and graphics; understands storyboarding in course development
  • Knowledge of SCORM 1.2, 2004 and AICC tracking standards
  • Working knowledge or basic understanding of programming languages like C++, Python, HTML5 and/ or JavaScript and their implementation in content creation on various modalities
  • Expertise in DevOps or alternative software development/ IT operations practices so that you can support users of our learning infrastructure or ability to learn and create that environment
  • Ability to navigate competing priorities with balance, competency and technological savvy
  • Provide excellent customer service/communication skills with internal and external customers and all stakeholders in the LMS experience
  • Demonstrate expertise in various online learning development tools and platforms and a desire to learn new technologies
  • Technical skills including: troubleshooting course issues, answering submitted tickets, uploading batch CSV’s accurately, quickly and with ease as new members join us, understanding and helping to improve systems and process so that technology is supporting staff and the customer experience at a highly competitive and cutting edge level
  • Understanding and helping to improve systems and process so that technology is supporting staff and the customer experience at a highly competitive and cutting edge level
  • Ability to collaborate with others at all levels of the organization and work with current and emerging vendors with whom we partner and/ or will partner in reimagining Employer’s Council online learning space
  • Ability to gain new technical skills quickly and a gusto to problem solve and get it done quickly
  • Committed to filling in learning gaps
  • Customer service skills, responsive attitude in helping audiences who may be unfamiliar with technological jargon and translating our brand and approach with confidence and couth
  • Strong oral and written communication skills; ability to communicate complex technical concepts in layman’s terms; problem solve quickly and carefully
  • Adobe 360 Suite experience preferred
  • Experience with utilizing corporate training videos preferred

Work Environment

General office environment the majority of time. Occasional lifting. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job.

Note: This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the job.

Employers Council is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability, genetic information or any other status protected by law or regulation. Qualified applicants are provided an equal opportunity and selection decisions are based on job-related factors.

job.title: NEW Knowledge Management Senior Consultant
job.body:
Workforce Transformation - Knowledge Management Solution Specialist

At Deloitte's US Delivery Center (USDC) we help clients achieve a higher level of service in operational efficiency and business value. The USDC leverages scale, talent, and a center delivery model to provide high quality, cost-effective service with standardized processes and procedures. Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Our delivery centers are based in Mechanicsburg, PA, Lake Mary, FL and Gilbert, AZ.


Work you’ll do

Our Workforce Transformation – Knowledge Management services help government and public sector clients design and deliver holistic knowledge management solutions that include the technology platform, processes, model and support to sustain long-term change.


In this role you will:


  • Identify and prioritize areas of knowledge loss risk and define mitigation plan
  • Design and implement knowledge-capturing methods, tools and processes
  • Plan knowledge retention programs
  • Serve as an integrator between human needs, organizational value, and technological feasibility
  • Perform project tasks independently
  • Facilitate and/or participate in design sprints and requirements gathering workshops
  • Anticipate client needs and formulate solutions to client issues
  • Review deliverables for accuracy and quality
  • Practice human-centered design (HCD) process and deliver UX from early-stage prototypes through launch

The team

From our US Delivery Centers, we work collaboratively with our consulting counterparts to design, develop, and build solutions to help clients reimagine, reshape, and rewire the competitive fabric of entire industries. Our Center is home to a multitude of specialists ranging from systems designers, architects, and integrators, to creative digital experts and Human Capital professionals. We are a unique blend of skills and experiences, yet we underline the value of each individual, providing customized career paths, fostering innovation, and developing knowledge with a focus on quality. The US Delivery Center supports a collaborative team culture where we work and live close to home with limited travel.


A business strategy focused on activating the workforce is essential to maintaining competitive advantage. By analyzing the changing nature of work against your business outcomes, we can work with you to compose the workforce required for your business to thrive. Our Workforce Transformation services help you reimagine your talent management strategies across leadership, learning, rewards, inclusion, performance management, career mobility, and talent acquisition.


Qualifications:


Required:

  • Bachelor's degree in computer science, human-computer interaction or a related field
  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience
  • Portfolio that demonstrates a strong understanding of UX process and outcomes and the ability to enable those outcomes through code
  • Experience in translating UX design outcomes such as sketches, storyboards, wireframes and user flows into requirements and related working presentation layers
  • Proficiency with a three or more of the following front-end prototyping and production technologies: HTML, CSS, JS (node, react, etc.), Angular, C++ or similar technologies
  • Experience working with SharePoint, React, Azure or ServiceNow
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future
  • Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role
  • Ability to travel up to 20%
  • Must be willing to live in or within a commutable distance to the Gilbert, AZ, Mechanicsburg, PA, or Lake Mary, FL delivery center(s)

Preferred:

  • A track-record of driving creative solutions
  • An understanding of the relationship between technology and human-centered design
  • Experience with relevant software and processes to inform the user experience in prototypes and scaled designs
  • Experience producing data-centric UX
  • Experience working information taxonomies, ontologies, meta-data and/or similar concepts
  • Desire to deliver on a promise of social good

How you’ll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there’s always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.


Benefits

At Deloitte, we know that great people make a great organization. We value our people and offer employees a broad range of benefits.

Deloitte’s culture

Our positive and supportive culture encourages our people to do their best work every day. We celebrate individuals by recognizing their uniqueness and offering them the flexibility to make daily choices that can help them to be healthy, centered, confident, and aware. We offer well-being programs and are continuously looking for new ways to maintain a culture where our people excel and lead healthy, happy lives.


Corporate citizenship

Deloitte is led by a purpose: to make an impact that matters. This purpose defines who we are and extends to relationships with our clients, our people and our communities. job.title: Technical Solutions Consultant
job.body:
Hearsay Systems is looking for a Technical Solutions Consultant to join our pre-sales team!

In this role, you’ll be challenged on both technical and functional aspects of the deal lifecycle from developing new demo environment enhancements to presenting in front of a technical audience. You'll enable the go-to-market team to navigate deep product and technical conversations winningly and easily; consult, develop, and present custom solution presentations mapped to strategic customer challenges; and function as a key liaison between go-to-market, product, and product marketing on our platform and services.

This is not a sales role, but is an integral part of the pre-sales team that partners with the Account Executives (and many others!).

About Hearsay Systems:
Founded in 2009 by Clara Shih and Steve Garrity, and helmed by CEO Mike Boese, Hearsay Systems leads the field in offering sophisticated client engagement products to companies within the financial services vertical. We are a tightly knit and dedicated group that passionately believes in our products, our people, and our culture. Our products engage customers across Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram, email, text, and voice. And every product syncs beautifully to Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics, and other CRM systems.

Hearsay is used by more than 170,000 financial advisors and insurance agents. Our clients include Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, Wells Fargo, JP Morgan Chase, Prudential, New York Life and Allstate. We enable them to get a real-time pulse of field conversations and to trigger more effective targeted advisor-client outreach with AI-optimized calls, text messages, email follow-ups, and social media interactions.

About the role:

  • Develop new capabilities into the demo environment such as integrations with CRM systems
  • Perform great insight driven technical discovery
  • Drive the sales cycle to close by delivering compelling technical presentations, lead technical design and architecture whiteboarding sessions, and developing prototypes
  • Design and run executive workshops to drive technical selection and win
  • Own technical executive relationships to influence early design decisions
  • Serve as the end-to-end business application expert and technical liaison between the customer, the Account Executive, and Product Management
  • Complete security reviews and manage RFP’s to completion
  • Stay knowledgeable about competitor’s products to continuously refine how to best position our key differentiators
  • Partner with Sales Enablement to refine product training business application knowledge for Go To Market teams
  • In the context of Hearsay products and the client's technological infrastructure, consult on integration best practices

About you:

  • Hands on development experience with a solid understanding of object oriented programming principles
  • Experience in Java, C#, JavaScript, or Python
  • Technical experience with REST APIs
  • Great work ethic and sense of ownership
  • 5+ years experience in technology industry, FinTech preferred
  • 3 - 5 years in comparable Solutions Consulting / Pre-Sales Engineer role
  • Comfortable with 50% travel across assigned region and valid passport (when safe to do so post-Covid)
  • Strong grasp of SaaS concepts and application integration
  • Skilled in managing expectations with challenging audiences
  • Ability to surface risk and reduce sales cycle with technical solutioning
  • Talent in value selling, and solutioning for business outcomes
  • Configuration experience with Enterprise CRM deployments: Salesforce, Microsoft Dynamics or another CRM systems
  • Experience with cloud based SaaS platforms and AWS
  • Ability to partner with other Go To Market teams from value consulting to product marketing
  • Great presentation skills: you should be adept in both small and larger audiences
  • Proven ability to mentor, train, and convert audiences into advocates

    • Our commitment to diversity and inclusion: At Hearsay we believe that diverse teams are the best teams. We are an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job.title: Pre-sales Developer Manager - Workflow Design Studio
job.body:
Pre-sales Developer Manager - Workflow Design Studio
Solution Consulting
Location: San Diego, CA

ServiceNow is changing the way people work. With a service-orientation toward the activities, tasks and processes that make up day-to-day work life, we help the modern enterprise operate faster and be more scalable than ever before. We’re disruptive. We work hard but try not to take ourselves too seriously. We are highly adaptable and constantly evolving. We are passionate about our product, and we live for our customers. We have high expectations and a career at ServiceNow means challenging yourself to always be better.

ServiceNow is offering an exciting opportunity for an individual who has built and managed high performing rapid development teams. For this key role, we are looking for ServiceNow technical experience and strong leadership abilities to manage the day to day operations of our Workflow Design Studio Development team in the Solution Consulting organization. The Workflow Design Studio Development team rapidly creates custom experiences supporting our Pre-sales Solution Consultants. The solutions delivered by this team include prototypes, demo artifacts and proofs of concepts of apps and platform solutions that are presented to customers and prospective customers to demonstrate the ‘Art of the Possible’ through the capabilities of the Now Platform.

This role will lead a growing team of creative and energetic Solution Developers whose primary focus is to quickly build and enhance pre-sales solutions on the ServiceNow platform. The Pre-sales Developer Manager will report to the Director of Workflow Design Studio. The position will be responsible for the day to day operations of the team that includes (prioritizing) qualifying requests, managing and assigning development work, ensuring timely delivery, adopting and updating development best practices leveraged as well as improving the efficiency of the team and ensuring that the team’s offerings and performance align with Solution Consulting and Sales Organization changing needs.

What you get to do in this role:

  • Coordinate development and deliver Custom Service Portals, Virtual Agent Conversations, API Integrations, and Provide Application Development Assistance to global solution consulting
  • Qualifies field requests and assigns/manages development work to delivery
  • Tracks and Reports Metrics to Leadership on Operations and Utilization of Team by Solution Consulting.
  • Manages & Measures Development Team Operational Efficiency (Timeliness, Quality and Reusability)
  • Mentors/coaches solution developers in Solution Consulting
  • Ensures solutions are shared with organization.
  • Updates team Offerings/Templates to address ever changing needs of Solution Consulting.
  • Manage and Forecast Demand through coordination with Area & Industry Vertical SC Managers
  • Ensure team members are trained on the ServiceNow platform and are matched with user stories and tasks that meet their skill set
  • Provide application development assistance to a global solution consulting organization
  • Interact with User Experience Designers to ensure solutions provide consistent experience
  • Solving complex problems in a highly dynamic and agile environment with moderate guidance
  • Manage multiple projects simultaneously with contributors from across the globe
  • Learning ascending technologies, and willingness to learn enough to integrate with them

In order to be successful in this role, we are seeking someone who has:

  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in Computer Science or equivalent practical experience
  • 3+ years of solution consulting and software development experience in enterprise software and/or building web services and service portals at scale
  • Leadership, coaching, and organizational skills
  • Must have strong written and verbal English communication skills and customer presentation skills
  • Experience in ServiceNow application customization and ServiceNow scripting
  • ServiceNow application development experience
  • ServiceNow Certified Application Developer Certification
  • Demonstrates strong coding style and practices
  • Knowledge of JavaScript, JSON, XML, SOAP, REST and associated frameworks (JQuery, Angular JS)
  • Ability to quickly shift focus and manage/coordinate multiple projects
  • Excellent team player
  • Deep familiarity with the capabilities available on the Now Platform
  • Customized ServiceNow applications and built reports and KPIs with the ServiceNow standard reporting tool and Performance Analytics offering
  • Experience working on process consulting, solution designing, integrations and implementation process
  • Experience working within a multi-disciplinary development team, including UI/UX designers, front-end developers, and back-end ServiceNow developers
  • Exhibits prior and current technical expertise in web technology and the ability to learn new technology.
  • Ability to execute against multiple work streams in a fast-paced environment to deliver applications that resonate with users
  • Strong people development, including coaching and mentoring for technical roles
  • Strong requirements gathering experience working with both business users and end users
  • Experience in custom application development on cloud development platforms
  • Passion for software development and problem-solving
  • Strong written and verbal English communication skills
  • Attitude: Be self-motived. Be polite. Be respectful. Be humble. Get work done!

  • Expected Travel: 10-20%

Partners with:

  • Sales Leadership
  • Solution Consulting Leadership
  • Workflow Design Studio

We provide competitive compensation, generous benefits and a professional atmosphere. This is a very collaborative and inclusive work environment where individuals strong on aptitude and attitude will have an opportunity to grow their professional careers through working with some of the most advanced technology and talented developers in the business.

job.title: Sr Associate Software Engineer
job.body:
Career Category

Information Systems

Job Description

Amgen discovers, develops and delivers Innovative human therapeutics. A biotechnology pioneer since 1980, Amgen was one of the first companies to realize the new sciences promise by bringing safe, effective medicines from lab, to manufacturing plant, to patient.

Amgen’s Commercial IS team (GCO IS) is looking for a highly motivated software engineer developer who has a good record of building thoughtful, well-designed solutions with a history of using their experience and creativity to tackle problems in an innovative, yet practical, manner.

GCO IS is responsible for partnering with Amgen’s US Business Operations (USBO) organization to deliver technology services and solutions that achieve corporate commercial strategies, business plans and patient needs. As a software engineer, you will design/build, deliver and run/support of the software applications under a product development process that meets healthcare regulations.

You will lead/support verification and validation testing, unit testing, and ensure that all product development conforms to design specifications and coding standards. Also you will develop productive internal/external working relationships.

Responsibilities

  • Work multi-functionally with product team, design, and client teams to bring amazing UI designs and features to life.
  • Assist in the preparation of software design requirements and design specifications for implementation of software design.
  • Develop and support native mobile apps (iOS and Android) or web application
  • Design flows for User Experience (UX) and interfaces for custom applications.
  • Develop application programming interface (APIs) to support mobile and web functionalities.
  • Help automate and streamline operations and processes.
  • Troubleshoot production issues and coordinate with the development team to streamline code deployment.
  • Apply Cloud (AWS) computing skills to deploy upgrades and fixes.

Basic Qualifications

Master’s degree AND 1 year of information system and/or computer science experience as a developer

Or

Bachelor’s degree AND 3 years of Information Systems and/or computer science experience as a developer

Or

Associate’s degree and 7 years of Information System and/or computer science experience as a developer

Preferred Qualifications

  • 2 year of experience with AWS native services (such as Lambda functions, API gateway, Dynamo DB, Mongo DB, S3, Cloudwatch, etc.).
  • 3 years or more of experience developing in one or more languages (Node.JS, Angular, Java, Swift).
  • 3 years of more of experience with open sources development tool chain (SVN, Git, Jenkins, etc.).
  • Experience with AWS common services (MongoDB, DynamoDB, S3, Lambda, API Gateway, Cloudwatch and ..)
  • Experience with Salesforce platforms (such as Heroku, Marketing Cloud and Lightning)
  • Ability to think strategically about technology and recommend solutions that align with business strategy and achieve the greatest business impact!
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to interact optimally with different personality styles and establish relationships in a multi functional environment!
  • Experience is healthcare or medical devices is helpful.

We understand that to successfully sustain and grow as a global enterprise and deliver for patients — we must ensure a diverse and inclusive work environment. Amgen is an Equal Opportunity employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.

job.body:
CBS BUSINESS UNIT: CBS Interactive

JOB TYPE: Full-Time Staff

JOB SCHEDULE:

JOB LOCATION: Fort Lauderdale, FL

ABOUT US:

CBS Interactive, a division of ViacomCBS, is the world’s largest publisher of premium digital content and a perennial top 10 Internet company. CBS Interactive’s brands span popular categories like technology, entertainment, sports, news and gaming.

Properties include the websites, apps and streaming services of the CBS Television Network such as the CBS All Access subscription service, CBS News Digital platforms including the 24/7 digital news network CBSN, and CBS Sports Digital brands including the 24-hour streaming sports news network CBS Sports HQ, as well as digital-first properties in key content verticals, including CNET, ZDNet, TVGuide.com, GameSpot, Last.fm, Metacritic and Chowhound.

Follow CBS Interactive on Twitter and Facebook.

DESCRIPTION:

Division Overview:

Do you have a passion for Sports? Do you love to code? How about managing people? Do you have experience managing & building engineering teams? Are you a strategic thinker? If you answered yes, then CBS Sports may be looking for you! CBSSports.com is looking for an experienced Manager of Site Engineering to lead our CBS Sports.com Engineering team!

Not only will you get to remain hands on in the day to day technical operations of the CBSSports.com website, but also lead a team of hardworking developers and third party vendors in continuing to build the greatest website for sports on the internet. To be successful at this job, you need to bring a winning attitude, technical architecture skills and excellent leadership skills.

Your Day-to-Day:

  • Lead a team of talented web developers and engineers in the day-to-day technical operations the CBSSports.com site
  • Develop new business-led features with an emphasis on performance and user experience
  • Write and review PHP code to extend and enhance the CBSSports.com site
  • Write JavaScript code to extend and enhance the CBSSports.com site’s live scoring applications
  • Build interactive UX using HTML and CSS from designs provided by design team
  • Deploy periodic site updates to QA, stage, and production environments
  • Provide engineering support to stakeholders, ensuring a high level of application availability and stability

Key Projects:

  • Build the next generation of CBSSports.com interactive products and experiences
  • Enhance existing applications for CBSSports.com powering Live Scoring components
  • Build a set of tools and APIs to support various CBSSports.com production needs
  • Adapt and optimize current systems for deployment on cloud-based infrastructure
  • PHP and Symfony framework upgrades
  • Refactor various parts of the site to be more efficient and build shareable components

QUALIFICATIONS:

What you bring to the team:

You have -

  • Led a development team of hardworking web developers & engineers in the day to day technical operations of a website for 2+ years
  • Hired great software engineering and web development talent
  • Worked with vendors, contractors and internal resources building a website design and/or doing a full website redesign from scratch
  • Performed vendor selections on technology tools to enable producers, editors or product managers
  • Minimum 5 years of PHP development experience and familiarity with Symfony framework, composer package management and Twig templating engine.
  • A minimum of 2 years of core JavaScript experience, 1 year of React.js experience
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience building UI/UX from the ground up based on designs provided
  • Familiarity with core AWS technologies
  • Ability to design and debug complex systems.
  • Familiarity with HTML5 Web-Sockets
  • Proven experience using and writing content-driven REST APIs
  • Familiarity with using version control systems. (Git)
  • You love sports, fantasy sports and/or sports gaming
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • You possess strong initiative and the ability for creative thinking with product development staff plus the ability to work in a collaborative, innovative, flexible and team-centric environment
  • You have excellent understanding of Object Oriented Programming and Design
  • Worked with agile processes
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

The Hartford’s Quality Centre of Excellence (QCOE) team is seeking a highly-motivated Senior Developer to join our team. Our Quality Center of Excellence (QCoE) organization is comprised of highly technical, diverse teammates focused on Automation as a core component to transform enterprise QA for Agile, Continuous Delivery and DevSecOps. The selected Senior Developer shall support key accountabilities for architect/design frameworks, building capability roadmaps, integrating the DevOPS practices and providing innovative solutions to help transform the Enterprise Quality practices. job.title: Principal Software Engineer
job.body:
Job Requisition ID #

20WD44750

Principal Software Engineer

Location: San Francisco, CA- United States

Position Overview

Do you want to create engaging, helpful, and attractive websites that are frequented by millions of visitors worldwide? Autodesk’s Web Platform Engineering team is looking for a talented software engineer who is passionate about technology to join our globally distributed team and help us develop beautiful, personalized website experiences.

Our team faces a variety of unique and interesting challenges, from creating new tools and components, implementing critical web services, to digging into low-level performance details and streamlining processes. To be successful in this role, you’ll need a solid foundation in a full range of web technologies from server to client, experience designing and describing complex software systems, and a drive to tackle new challenges head-on. This is your chance to work with a team of experienced and talented individuals, participate in a fun and engaging workplace culture, and have your work used by millions.

Responsibilities

  • Design, code, test, debug and document new and existing components to ensure that software meets business, quality and operational needs
  • Drive and participate in code and document reviews, mentoring team in best practices
  • Collaborate with peer organizations, dev ops, support organizations on technical issues and provide guidance
  • Interpret and translate business needs to technical requirements and accurate estimates
  • Evaluate and recommend tools, technologies and processes to ensure the highest quality and performance is achieved
  • Apply deep technical expertise to resolve challenging programming and design problems
  • Focus on scalability, security and availability of all applications and processes
  • Contribute to the design and architecture to enable secure, scalable and maintainable software
  • Contribute to risk identification and risk mitigation strategies associated with the architecture
  • Ensure architectural consistency across multiple implementations
  • Align with teams across functions to achieve successful technical design and implementation
  • Continue to research and adopt new technologies to evolve our products
  • Use and advance our agile practices
  • Lead development and adoption of automated test suites

Minimum Qualifications

  • Strong knowledge and experience with web technology stacks
  • Understanding of server-side web development using Java
  • Experience developing efficient and reliable server-side JavaScript.
  • Full understanding of Object-Oriented and Functional programming paradigms, software architecture principles, and at least one modern backend framework.
  • Working understanding of latest web APIs and standards, current trends in web and mobile development.
  • Practical experience building RESTful web services
  • Experience with Amazon Web Services (i.e. EC2, S3, IAM, RDS, CloudFront, CloudWatch, Lambda, CloudFormation), or developing in other public Clouds.
  • Experience developing and deploying code across distributed clusters, using Kubernetes, Docker, ECS Fargate
  • Experience with continuous integration tools, such as Jenkins
  • 8 years or more of relevant work experience
  • 3+ years of experience working in a modern web application stack
  • Excellent communication skills and proven ability to lead cross-team projects independently.
  • Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or similar field, Masters degree preferred

Preferred Qualifications

  • eCommerce experience
  • Understanding of PCI compliance and security best practices
  • Familiarity and experience with Adobe AEM (CQ) and related technologies
  • Experience with Node.js, npm
  • Experience building scalable microservices
  • Familiarity with responsive web design

About Autodesk

With Autodesk software, you have the power to Make Anything. The future of making is here, bringing with it radical changes in the way things are designed, made, and used. It's disrupting every industry: architecture, engineering, and construction; manufacturing; and media and entertainment. With the right knowledge and tools, this disruption is your opportunity. Our software is used by everyone - from design professionals, engineers and architects to digital scientists, students and hobbyists. We constantly explore new ways to integrate all dimensions of diversity across our employees, customers, partners, and communities. Our ultimate goal is to expand opportunities for anyone to imagine, design, and make a better world.
