job.title: Director of Data & Business Intelligence
job.body:
Sunroom is reinventing leasing to empower renters.


We're a venture-backed tech startup, headquartered in Austin, that's dramatically improving the home and apartment search process. We believe that the existing tools renters use, like Zillow, are just scratching the surface. We've created a platform that enables renters to self-tour properties apply & lease inside our app. Sunroom was started by the Favor founders Ben & Zac.

What you'll be doing:

  • Lead business intelligence projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will inform strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.
  • Making technical architecture aand framework decisions to optimize our infrastructure and easily pull the data we need.
  • Monthly updating our financial model/forecast to ensure we're growing to plan.
  • Setting up a company and individual OKR reporting charts. Pulling data for board meetings and other company initiatives.
  • Ad-hoc analysis projects to assist with product & marketing measurements.
  • In the future, manage and develop a team responsible for maintaining reporting systems, dashboards, and performance metrics that support key business decisions.

We're sitting on all sorts of interesting data, from the 100k renters using our site, thousands of property listings on our platform, and funnel data on what's driving conversions.


Team: You'll be joining a company that's small today (15 people). In this position, you'll work closely with the co-founders and the engineering team.

  • Today our engineering team consists of 3 talented engineers: David, Darius & Antonio.
  • As you can see the team is small so you'll start working independently, but in the future, you'll have a data team reporting to you.


Codebase: This is our stack. Our product was built mostly with Node.js & React. We've set up some systems for data/BI already, but you'll be able to play a major role in shaping our systems.


Our ideal candidate:

  • Intellectually curious: You'll full of questions that can create value for our customers and team members.
  • Self-directed and organized: You can size and prioritize data projects and determine what's most important.
  • Thrives in an iterative environment: You can adapt to changes in products, projects, and direction won't throw you for a loop. You know how to work quickly and balance quality with speed.
  • Technical: You are fine to roll up your sleeves and get the job done. You are excited about changing the future through amazing products.



  • 5+ years of experience working in data science or analytics.
  • Exceptional academic record with BA/Master’s degree from a top-tier college or university.
    • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent preferred, but not required.
  • Previous experience at a fast-growing startup.
  • Experience with the following tools, languages, and platforms:
    • Data visualization tools (i.e. Chartio)
    • Application programming languages (i.e. Python, SQL)
    • Reporting APIs + big data platforms (i.e.Redshift, Amazon Web Services)
    • Customer segmentation platforms (i.e. Segment)

Note: Our team is currently remote due to Covid-19, but we're excited to get back to the office when it's safe. Our ideal candidate will be willing to return to the office when the time is right.

job.title: Senior Software Quality Assurance Analyst
job.company: One on One Sherpa LLC - St. Louis, MO 63103
job.body:
The Role

The Sr. QA Analyst will contribute to the success of Sherpa by creating and structuring our QA process and we’ll give you the autonomy and flexibility to do it well. As an experienced QA professional, you will be an advocate for software development best practices. You will also be experienced in test case design and implementation of testing practices against complex systems and will work to ensure that our most critical systems are production ready. Main responsibilities of this role include:

  • Gaining a deep understanding of the existing features and software development process
  • Collaborating with software engineers to develop effective test plans, test suites, and automated test cases
  • Performing tests, reporting problems encountered, and verifying when defects are fixed
  • Assessing the severity of defects, providing clear reproduction instructions, and conducting root cause analysis
  • Working with product and customer experience teams to prioritize defects and determining which defect fixes are critical to the end-user and business
  • Working with the team to improve testing and release management processes to ensure that the team meets those quality goals
  • Actively participating in Scrum ceremonies (Sprint Planning, Sprint Grooming, Sprint Retro and Daily Stand-ups)
  • Collaborating with the team to define and refine feature requirements, while advocating for ways to improve the user experience
  • Asking questions, identifying risks, and challenging others to consider the consequences of design decisions
  • Responsibilities will evolve over time, and flexibility is important

The Skills

Individuals who ideally fit this role will meet the following qualifications:

  • Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent experience, in a technical field of study
  • 3+ years of experience with testing methodologies and strategies (UATs, E2E testing, API testing)
  • Working knowledge of unit testing and automated testing frameworks
  • Familiarity with a programming language such as JavaScript/Typescript, PHP, or React
  • Ability to operate across many functional domains (frontend-UI, backend platform, APIs, Android and iOS, etc)
  • Experience with ancillary technologies (Gitlab, Postman, Chrome Dev Tools, Jira, etc.)
  • Backend database and API testing experience, using SQL and Postman
  • Working knowledge of quality assurance processes and methods used in software development
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with other team members to determine testing requirements and to ensure the delivery of high-quality code releases
  • Ability to switch between manual test case authoring, test case execution, contributing to writing automated tests suites

The Organization, The Team and Our Benefits

Sherpa is a fast-paced technology organization positioned for rapid growth. Our sales CRM and training solution is unique to the Senior Living Community and our team of passionate, collaborative Sherpas is also unique and very fun to work with!

Sherpa offers an excellent compensation package with market competitive pay, comprehensive healthcare options, 401k matching, flexible PTO, scheduling flexibility and organizational growth potential.

As we strive to be the best solution for our customers and the best employer for our team members we focus on Courage, Empathy, Curiosity, Trust, Collaboration and Results. If this aligns with your personally held values, we look forward to receiving your resume.

One final important note: We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

Company Overview:

Shamrock Trading Corporation is the parent company for a family of brands in transportation services, finance and technology. Headquartered in Overland Park, KS, Shamrock has been named “Best Places to Work” by the Kansas City Business Journal every year since 2015. We also have offices in Chicago, Dallas, Laredo, Midland and Nashville.

With an average annual revenue growth of 25% since 1986, Shamrock’s success is attributed to three key factors: hiring the best people, cultivating long-term relationships with our customers and continually evolving in the marketplace.

Responsibilities:
Shamrock Trading Corporation is looking for a Software Developer to join the IT team. An ideal candidate will be a technical expert with an entrepreneurial drive and passion for customer success.

  • Work with customers to overcome technical obstacles, answering questions and proposing solutions
  • Validate partner recommendations and solutions to ensure the right partners are engaged with customers
  • Understand customer needs to help shape company long-term product strategy
  • Package solutions into a published portfolio of best practices for use by partners and customers
  • Research and test solutions, including authoring sample code, to solve customer technical obstacles
Qualifications:
  • 3-5 years of experience in software development
  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or related technical field, or equivalent practical experience
  • Experience architecting, developing or maintaining production-grade cloud solutions in virtualized environments such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud Platform
  • Experience in writing software in one or more languages such as Python, JavaScript (Node and React), Java, C#, Swift or similar

    • Familiarity with AWS Gateway, Lambda, S3, EC2, Serverless, IAM and other AWS technologies
    • Proven success working directly with customer technical teams
Benefits Package:

At Shamrock we hire bright, ambitious people and give them the tools they need to be successful. By investing in training and development, we hope to become a long-term career for employees, where there are always opportunities for advancement. Shamrock also offers a premier set of benefits for employees and their families:

job.title: Lead Software Engineer
job.body:
Since launching in 2010, WP Engine has become the world’s leading WordPress Digital Experience Platform (DXP), now with over 100,000 customers in 140 countries. We’re proud of the technology and service we offer our customers that move their businesses forward faster. At WP Engine, we strive to do the best work of our careers, and feel empowered to do what is right for our customers. We love investing in employee success and uncovering opportunities for you, the best, to get better. 99 percent of employees believe you’re made to feel welcome at WP Engine. Be you. Be here.

What's cool about this job.

WP Engine is on a mission to help our customers win online! Whether that’s helping an aspiring entrepreneur to turn a hobby into an online business or a multinational corporation to launch a new campaign in weeks instead of months, our platform is there to help them win — whatever that means for them.

We are searching for an experienced engineer to help shape the future of Headless WordPress. Leading our Headless Themes initiatives, you will directly impact on the way headless WordPress sites are built with modern tools like Node and React. You will shape the vision for our product line and help hire the team to build the software. This software will be Open Source, so you’ll also be directly interacting with the community that you will help develop.

Our culture is renowned; we believe it is meaningful to hire the best and ensure that we provide an environment where the best get better. If you are great at solving problems, a hard worker with excellent interpersonal skills, and enjoy working across different time zones and cultures, you may be the engineer that we are looking for!

The day to day.

  • Be customer inspired and work closely with Product Management, Engineering Management, and business partners to incrementally and frequently deliver positive outcomes through technology
  • Provide ongoing technical leadership and guidance to your teammates
  • Collaborate to design, write, test, integrate, and maintain a frontend theme framework that is extensible, usable, and performant; meeting the needs of our users
  • Write clean, maintainable code; improve test coverage and build deployment pipelines to safely and rapidly push quality code to production
  • Help build a positive and inclusive community around the software we build; representing yourself and WP Engine well in every interaction

Your skills and expertise.

  • 7+ years of writing software using Agile practices to deliver high quality software addressing customer needs
  • Expertise in Node, React, Next.js, and WordPress
  • Experience developing frameworks or libraries used by other developers
  • Self starter with natural problem solving abilities, an inquisitive personality, a continuous learning attitude, and an eagerness to tackle big problems even with uncertain requirements
  • Comfortable working in public; being an inclusive and positive contributor to Open Source Software communities
  • Passionate about developing others; mentoring, guiding, and teaching
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills

The perks and benefits.

  • Compensation (We offer market competitive salaries)
  • Health Benefits (100% Paid Employee Medical, Dental, and Vision)
  • 401(k) (Make the most of retirement)
  • Life and Disability Insurance (100% Paid Life, STD, LTD and AD&D)
  • Generous Vacation Time (Who doesn’t like time off)
  • Transportation (Downtown parking or commuter reimbursement)
  • Lunch (Provided Monday – Thursday)
  • Gym membership discount

At WP Engine, we strive to have the broadest possible view of diversity, going beyond visible differences to include the background, experiences, skills, and perspectives that make each person unique. WP Engine is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, Veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law.

job.title: DevOps Software Engineer
job.body:
STILMAN Advanced Strategies
US Citizenship required for this role
DevOps Engineer / Software Engineer
In this exciting, newly created hybrid software engineering role you will work to on our infrastructure software to design, build, and maintain the operations environment which includes our own software suite and various customer software packages. As the Senior DevOps engineer here, you will design and implement tools to automate software deployments into target environments. You will also support integration of our software with customer software and frameworks as we containerize, integrate, and evolve our system. These integration efforts are often complex, fast paced and involve standing up various customer systems, with little guidance, in our dev & test environment to support the integration work. You will contribute to the software development efforts in the areas related to integration with various virtualization and container frameworks. You will also communicate with the rest of the team continually working on updating code, testing the updated sections, and deploying them to manage code releases
Key Experiences to Have
  • Preference to the Dev side of DevOps, having some software development experience in FE/BE or FS and/or QA skills
  • Proficiency with Windows and Linux administration
  • Proficiency with virtualization platforms, such as Hyper-V and VMWare.
  • Proficiency with Docker and Kubernetes
  • Proficiency with infrastructure-as-code tools, such as Ansible and Terraform
  • Proficiency in scripting using Bash and other tools
  • Experience administering and deploying DevOps and CI/CD tools, such as Git, Mercurial, Jenkins, Jira, or GitLab
  • Experience with database deployment and administration.
  • Experience with software deployments in AWS
  • Experience with ELK, Kafka, ActiveMQ and other similar tools
Great Bonus Experiences to Have (which combo do you bring to the table?)
  • Proficiency with static and dynamic code analysis tools
  • Experience in JavaScript/TypeScript, C++ and other programming languages
  • Experience developing engineering applications
  • Modeling & Simulation
  • GIS & Mapping
  • Military concepts and tactics
STILMAN Advanced Strategies develops software based on Linguistic Geometry (LG), a unique Artificial Intelligence (AI) approach. Our core technology generates predictive, tactically correct Courses of Action (COAs) that dynamically adapt in response to changes in missions and actions taken by the intelligent opposition. These tools support mission planning, rehearsal, training and execution use cases for military commanders across echelons and services. Our applications have been shown to deliver unique value to the warfighter due to the quality of generated COAs, UX/UI design that makes it easy to fully comprehend complex COA results and to define mission inputs, as well as ease of deployment and integration with other system with well-defined modern APIs.
The Team
We are a small team that's distributed throughout United States and work 100% remote, with some possible travel to customer sites and we've been doing this for 20 years. The software developers are self-motivated and able to work independently, but collaborate closely with each other to take advantage of each other's strength and help where help is needed. This small, distributed team has been developing and continually improving these software applications since 1999. All aspects of our work are collaborative rather than stove piped into narrowly defined roles. We pride ourselves on the quality of our software and we are excited as we continue this development with US Navy, US Army, Missile Defense Agency (MDA) and other agencies to further enhance, integrate, and deploy these products.
Benefits & Other
  • We offer an attractive compensation package including competitive salaries, bonuses, medical and dental coverage, flexible schedule & PTO, and tuition assistance
  • US Citizenship is required. No CTC or 3rd parties please. Contact rick@stilman-strategies.com to learn more. Thanks for considering STILMAN Advanced Strategies for your next career move!

job.title: Full Stack Developer/Team Lead
job.body:
The adjective that epluno™ has come to embrace in 2020 is the term “pivot”. Pivoting into supporting our clients in ways we never thought necessary, from PPE to apparel with a mission to custom e-commerce solutions implemented to change a 100-year-old industry overnight, to name a few.

Our journey started, nearly eight years ago, as a custom e-commerce, technology company designed for the school space. Hundreds of schools, districts and hospitals later, we’ve evolved into a technology company with a specific emphasis on a scalable, licensed solution for all organizations as a B2B platform.

Our third software iteration has slightly changed in scope due to the pivot our company was forced to make; however, we are working on exciting custom technology solutions simultaneously as we refocus on our go to market, scalable solution.

Our team designs, develops, and supports systems for automating and orchestrating the provisioning, configuration, and life-cycle management of complex, user-defined e-commerce and related systems. By providing our users powerful, streamlined interfaces, we empower them to accomplish more with less time and effort.

As a result, we are seeking an experienced Full-Stack JavaScript developer whom also has the experience, presence, collaboration and communication skills necessary to drive the program to market.

The Full-Stack JavaScript developer will be designing, scoping, implementing, debugging, and supporting new, creative features to bolster the ability for our customers to configure, deploy, and manage reproducible e-commerce sites and related systems.

  • Collaborate with team members and company leadership to scope, design, implement, and document new features.
  • Must reside in SW Ohio.
  • Identify bugs, write tests, and propose improvements to maintain code quality standards.
  • Participate in code reviews to ensure code quality and distribute knowledge.
  • Respond to questions and problem reports from internal users and sometimes end users with collaboration and support as a mantra.
  • Document internal processes and procedures.
  • Proven knowledge of JavaScript, including the latest ES6 features.
  • Working knowledge of backend JavaScript API / web services development in Node.js.
  • Demonstrated ability to write effective tests for full-stack JavaScript applications and services.
  • Autodidacts who are drawn to continual learning and improvement.
  • Comfortable in a Linux shell and working knowledge of git.
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Duties require the ability to utilize a computer, communicate over the telephone, and read printed material.
  • May occasionally work outside normal working hours.
  • While travel is infrequent, it may occur occasionally.
  • Requires 4+ years of related experience with a bachelor's degree or 6+ years equivalent experience preferably in a customer facing environment (agency or similar).
  • Ability to communicate in a professional and collaborative manner with all stakeholders involved with the roll-out.
  • Can cope and thrive under an environment of change.
  • Experience crafting efficient and reusable web components in Vue or React.
  • Familiarity with JavaScript build tooling, such as Babel, Webpack, and/or Gulp.
  • Familiarity with cloud provider APIs, concepts, and architectures.
  • Familiarity with continuous integration, testing, and deployment strategies.

job.title: Front-end Engineer / Fullstack Engineer
job.body:
ndustrial is a Raleigh, NC based startup looking for a high quality Front-end/Fullstack Engineer. As a Front-end/Fullstack Engineer at ndustrial, you should be passionate about your work and you will be counted on to drive us to build and improve best in class products for the industrial IOT market. The right candidate is interested in being an impactful, collaborative part of a smaller team. Are you ready to join our team and take on the challenge of not only helping us keep up with the pace but also continue to improve the system?

On a day-to-day basis as a Front-end/Fullstack Engineer you will be developing APIs and Frontend applications to build out features in our Contxt optimization platform and our nSight energy management application. We work on a broad set of data and sometimes there may be a need to pick up new knowledge about different levels of our system from ETL workloads to IOT data to Utility Rate Tariffs to Asset Management, etc. Industrial optimization requires us to have a broad working knowledge of multiple datasets and, as a Front-end/Fullstack Engineer at our company, you will have the opportunity to develop applications for delivering and visualizing the crucial data they need to interact with, operate on, and drive action from in their facilities.

From a more general perspective, Front-end/Fullstack Engineers should expect to:

  • Work on new features and functionality for our existing software while also developing new software to complement our customers needs
  • Actively participate in scoping, estimating, code reviews throughout the development process
  • Communicate with your fellow coworkers about your progress and offer suggestions/improvements to continually improve all aspects of the software
  • Be able to provide thorough reasons/explanations for software decision in order to prevent technical debt
  • Have a constructive voice. It will be expected and respected

Requirements


  • 3+ years of experience React or another modern ES6 Front-end Framework
  • 3+ years of experience developing APIs with NodeJS or Python
  • 3+ years of experience with an Object-Oriented Language
  • Experience using NPM, Bower and JavaScript task runners (Grunt/Gulp/Webpack)
  • Experience with unit testing (Mocha, Chai)
  • Experience deploying and debugging applications in production
  • Experience with deploying code in the cloud (Kubernetes, AWS)
  • Experience implementing or improving CI/CD workflows (Travis, Github Actions, Jenkins)
  • Expert at pull requests and code reviews. We are a small team and lean on each other to make sure we are writing the best software possible
  • Experience working in a start up and understanding the needs that come with that
  • Good sense of humor, we enjoy working with each other
  • Must be able to get things done in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment
  • Local candidates only, please (we want to be able to see your face from time to time)
  • BSc degree in Computer Science or relevant field
  • Experience with designing APIs

Benefits

  • Commuter benefit
  • 401K
  • Team outings, catered lunches, celebrations!
  • Flexible work environment with telecommuting options
  • New, modern, gorgeous office conveniently located on Fayetteville St. in Downtown Raleigh

job.title: Design Lead
job.body:
Tulip, the Manufacturing App Platform, is empowering the world's leading manufacturers to improve the productivity of their teams, the quality of their output, and the efficiency of their operations. Born out of the MIT Media Lab to bring better interfaces to frontline workers in manufacturing, excellent design is in our DNA.

With Tulip's no-code platform, manufacturers can empower those closest to operations to digitally transform their shop floors and gain real-time visibility into the people, machines, and processes involved in production-all in a matter of days. Manufacturers of all sizes, across industries including consumer electronics, aerospace and defense, contract manufacturing, automotive, apparel, medical devices, and more, have implemented Tulip's intuitive platform to solve some of the most pressing challenges in manufacturing: digitizing paper-based processes, integrating industrial IoT (IIoT) technologies with legacy factory machines, and capturing and analyzing real-time production floor data.

The company is headquartered in Somerville, MA, with offices in the UK and Germany. It has been recognized as a Forbes IoT Startup to Watch, Gartner Cool Vendor, IDC Innovator, Frost and Sullivan Entrepreneurial Company of the year, and a World Economic Forum Technology Pioneer.

The role is a huge opportunity to continue growing our world-class design team and set the design vision across all our products - from the no-code app builder to our analytics engine, all the way to our IoT hardware. You'll be working closely with our product managers and engineering teams to build a category-defining product that brings consumer-grade experiences to enterprise customers and is disrupting the way manufacturing works. If you are up for the challenge, we want to hear from you.

About You:

  • You are an exceptional designer who wants to lead and grow our talented design team.
  • You are passionate about the potential of digital-physical systems to augment people and bringing human-centric design to an industry that has lagged behind
  • You want to redefine the way an entire industry works

What skills do I need?

  • 5+ years of industry experience as a product designer with experience creating design systems and leading design for large-scale software projects
  • Passion for effective mentoring and coaching; you love to help others grow!
  • Experience leading and managing operations of a design team (e.g. critiques, team processes, etc.)
  • Strong in strategic thinking and communication. You can leverage storytelling to craft clear narratives of where projects could go and help influence teams.
  • Team player who enjoys collaborating with product, engineering, and other stakeholders throughout the product development process.
  • Growth mindset. You like taking risks, improving yourself, and others.
  • Expert proficiency in Figma, Storybook, and other design tools.
  • Web development skills (HTML/CSS/JS) and hands-on skills are a plus.
  • Previous experience leading a team a plus, but not a requirement.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead. Coach and mentor a team of exceptional designers and help them grow to the next level by providing design feedback and developing the strategic skills to weigh tradeoffs between business, technical, competitive, and customer contexts.
  • Design. Set the design vision and strategy for our platform. Own the Tulip design system, develop Tulip's design standards and vision, ensuring the team delivers cutting edge UX/UI, user flows, user journeys, taxonomies/folksonomies, wireframes, prototypes, detailed mockups.
  • Inspire: Cultivate a conducive environment for great design by helping with team processes like user research, critiques, etc, for all necessary deliverables. Foster a great design culture within the design team and across the company.
  • Operations: Work with product managers and engineering to establish objectives, high-level strategies, and key results for the design team. Understand the design needs of large-scale software and hardware projects and break them down into bite-sized job stories. Ensure the team and projects are well planned, scoped, and organized to ensure their timely delivery..
  • Collaboration. Identify opportunities to improve how we all work together, and the relationships both within and outside of the team. Work with product managers and engineering to ensure implementations meet design standards. Integrate a highly decentralized team into a coherent and unified continuous product design process

job.title: Lead Engineer
job.body:
Job details

Job Type
Contract

Full Job Description

This position is open as a 3-month 1099 contract arrangement, with a possibility of extension. Ideally this position will be based in either Dallas, Austin, or Colorado Springs, but we are also open to 100% remote (note: candidates must be US based for remote work).

**Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.**


Who we are: At Hypergiant, our work is driven by individuals pushing the boundary and always professionally challenging our clients to think differently. We're seeking individuals who are both analytical and creative and can help us fuel our motto: Tomorrowing Today. We're based in Texas and have a strong track record of working with some of the biggest brands around the world in industries spanning retail, oil & gas, energy, aviation, healthcare, and more. We provide large enterprises with cutting-edge advice, bespoke technology solutions, and deployment expertise needed to harness the value out of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Our goal is to work with forward-thinking organizations and to help them understand how Artificial Intelligence will affect their business and their industry.

We are looking for a Lead Engineer who can build and maintain web apps and open-source libraries that can be shared across projects. This position will work alongside a dedicated project team on highly complex DoD projects.

You will write high-quality code, ensuring excellence with unit tests when appropriate; collaborate with developers, designers, testers, project managers, product managers, and project sponsors; communicate tasking estimation and progress regularly to a project manager through appropriate tools; and work in an Agile-like, iterative development process.

Required Experience

  • At least 7+ years of professional front end development experience, with at least 2+ years in a Lead position.
  • At least 5+ years of professional experience with React required (other JavaScript frameworks are a plus).
  • Demonstrated experience in managing, mentoring & coaching development teams in an Agile environment.
  • Ability to manage client expectations and project timelines.
  • Able to write organized, accessible, and performant apps using JavaScript, advanced CSS, and HTML.
  • Experience with CSS in JS solutions such as Styled Components or Emotion.
  • Ability to architect complex and performant React applications; solid understanding of application architecture, and concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES6.
  • Ability to make effective architecture decisions if necessary.
  • Ability to manage robust testing & workflow automations (Jest, Rollup, Webpack, Babel).
  • Ability to quickly fix bugs and solve problems in large, complex apps.
  • Familiarity with creating custom visualizations using D3 or similar SVG libraries.
  • Demonstrate good design and UX sensibilities.
  • Design-minded attention to detail in user interface implementation.
  • Proficient with version control and effective collaborative development workflows.
  • Penchant for learning new technologies, balanced with strong pragmatic thinking.

Preferred Experience

  • Experience with DoD information systems.
  • Experience auditing third party dependencies in React ecosystem preferred.
  • Experience with single page application CI/CD.
  • Back-end development experience is considered a plus.
  • A portfolio of past projects with code samples or GitHub links.

Hypergiant, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace. We offer a fun, flexible work environment, company-sponsored activities, and commit to providing each employee with job satisfaction by addressing core needs. Learn more at hypergiant.com.
